sequence: I saw the trailer and read some reviews , and I had low expectations for this movie . I was pleasantly surprised by it. The story is not too original , but it gets interesting when the characters find out that there are two versions of the true story . I bought a copy from Amazon because I liked the cover art, the title, and the premise. Unfortunately, the movie disappointed me. This movie did not live up to the initial hype.The movie begins with David Carradine's character being released from hospital after being treated for an injury sustained in a motorcycle accident.

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman:TAS and its ilk, I enjoyed it in my youth and recently had been able to watch them all again, great voice acting from Tim Curry, Richard Moll, Tony Jay, and Maurice LaMarche in various roles. The only qualm I had was Rob Paulsons voice seemed a little too old for the title character, but that wasn't a big deal as the stories were great, and the fact that the whole thing has a great time loop twist ending.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it. That would be fine if the film were a travelogue, but as a dramatic exercise in cinematic artistry, that is not good enough. The theme of inter-species respect and co-operation ventures timidly into the forbidden world of inter-species love, but its approach is stereotypical, indicating a lack of understanding of the behavior motives of either species. As with many films, one always wonders what could have been achieved by a more innovative director and a more creative screenwriter. Alas, we probably will never know.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous death scenes ! And most of all - this film is really stupid. The first time I ever watched it , I did not believe that anyone would make such a terrible film . Let me just state up front that this is a movie that has some good points (not to mention one or two interesting ones) but it is so far down the road that there is little left to hope for. First off, you are going to laugh your ass off and then think about it for hours afterwards.

Pity the Monkees . People always accused them of being manufactured ( which they were ) or being nothing more than lip service. The fact that nobody ever heard anything new about them really proves that they were just a product of their time. I found this series to be very enjoyable. The humor came off as good but not perfect. The characters, though somewhat bland, actually seemed like human beings who were at least willing to have an honest dialog. The only major flaw is that the plot was predictable and overused.

What a cast of actors and actresses in this Columbo episode, beside Peter Falk, you have Julie Newmar, Jeannette Nolan, Martin Landau as twins. Anyway, the old uncle dies mysteriously and it looks like a heart attack on the bicycle discovered by his fianc√©, Julie Newmar, who plays the role so deliciously. Jeannette Nolan plays the other woman of the house, the housekeeper who prides herself on her talents and chides Columbo's sloppy and often typical behavior with his cigar. Martin Landau plays identical twins in this one. Each who accuse the other of murdering their uncle for money.

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ("Three Minutes"), the survivors are shocked to find out who the occupant is. With the use of the boat, Jack and Sayid come up with a plan to confront "The Others". However, when Jack, Sawyer, Kate and Hurley follow Michael to "The Others", Jack is forced to reveal Michael's deadly secret whilst they are in the middle of nowhere.Meanwhile, Locke decides that the time has come to find out the time has come to find out what will happen if "the button" is not pressed.

At first I did n't think I would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and better. I loved the story line and the characters . I could see why they used them in such a short time span . I have seen this film 5 times now, and it is still not good. It has been over a year since I saw it, and it seems that every time I watch it, the quality of the acting drops. One of the main reasons I have stuck around so long to see this film is for the character development.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I 've ever seen on film . I do have to admit, this is not a 100% factual account. It's far too long and drawn out. I watched this movie because it reminded me of two movies I used to love so much: The Princess Bride with Cary Grant and A Clockwork Orange with Michael Redgrave. Both movies were full of suspense and dark humor, both stories about an ordinary guy in a strange world that kept surprising him with its weirdness.So I thought I'd give this movie a shot.The story is simple.

Due to its predictable, second-rate title, (the one it was distributed under in Italy, at least) I didn't expect much from this movie. Thought it'd be another cheap flick about a haunted house ("LA CASA MALEDETTA" means "The cursed house"). Well, I had to change my mind just after the very first brilliant scene! The constant presence of priests and the creepy atmospheres, reminded me a bit of The Exorcist and some of its decent Italian rip-offs, but this was going to be something completely different...

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from ! For some reason I wasn't convinced, and I really don't blame anyone for doubting it, but it's not a bad film. If you're into thrillers with lots of gunplay and gore then this movie might just be for you. It's not for everyone. If you're looking for an adventure movie that's not overly violent, this is not for you either. You've been warned though, as the movie starts out with quite a few moments of extreme violence.

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons , and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out . I must admit that some of the writing is quite good , but I'm always disappointed when my favorite shows are criticized in such a way. This movie was terrible! It only took about 20 minutes from start to finish and i could see that it was going to suck. But i sat there and watched it like a moron. The story lines were stupid and predictable. If you read the book, then this movie isn't that bad.

When the Romulans come , they will not be bearing gifts ; no , they bring with them war -hounds, trained to hunt and kill. I was hoping for some good sci-fi/comedy but was disappointed. In my opinion this is the worst TV show I have watched in a long while. One can't even call it a science fiction show because you don't see any aliens, cyborgs, or anything of that nature. It is almost entirely about a bunch of white guys in their late 30's (and sometimes into their 50's) sitting around watching movies and eating Cheerios all day and night.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be. Terrible acting! Implausible scenerios! Ridiculous death scenes! Creepy, evil-for-no-reason villains! The last 30 minutes of this movie just might be the best 30 minutes ever put on film, especially in the scene where the decent, hardworking citizens string chains across the street, knocking down the evil bikers and then shoot them, only to be joined by the neighborhood children (!!!) in celebration. And how can I forget the elderly woman with the broom? She's sweeping out the scum!

I 've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was involved in it all makes it even more hilarious. This movie is the epitome of bad taste. First, as a huge fan of the "Flipper" series, I was disappointed with this movie. But I have to say that my disappointment wasn't because of the actors, since they are great in their own way. However, I was surprised by the story itself. This movie made me want to give up on movies altogether.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency . Putney Swope is on the board for his son. I was so ready to like this movie! There were all kinds of great things going on in New York City in 1964-65. You've got hippies and black power and everything! And, of course, you've got rock n roll and drugs and sex and all sorts of other crazy stuff going on! The problem is, I didn't.This is a good movie, but it seems like every scene had someone doing something completely ridiculous.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers. Ultimately the market place determines the message that is sent to the public. This movie dramatizes that point. A conservative white-collar advertising company is taken over by a group of street-wise African Americans chaired by a no-nonsense black man who wants to make a buck and believes he can sell products by telling the the truth. But the movie shows that no matter how hard he tries to do something different, the market place and the political system demands that he conform, rendering him no different than his predecessors.

Before I forget, let me say the artwork in here is outstanding. From garbage cans to the huge cruise ship, the drawings are beautifully done. If this wasn't animated, critics would be lauding the "direction" in here, because it's really good.To the story: Sylvester is picking through the garbage at the shipyards but the pickins' are slim. While brooding at the dock next to a big ship, in a porthole he spots Tweety in his cage. Tweety spots him, too, and you know his first comment - the same one he always makes when he spots the cat.

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war . Everything about the movie was perfect . But something went terribly wrong and made it truly a poor movie. It starts out on a great note but when the characters are introduced things just fall apart . I don't care if you like this movie . You have no business watching it . It's a bit funny to me that this is considered a masterpiece compared to some other movies such as "Rampage" or "Terminator 2".I think it's a pity that they didn't make a better sequel to the original.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan, where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion. I really admired the story and visual approach. The action is frightening and the mood of loneliness that the film projects is amazing. There is much beauty in the melancholy that surrounds these three misfit heroes. Not just in the desert but in the city too. My best scene was after the boy discovers his friends in the apartment and then rides his skateboard through all the remarkable lights of the city. You really feel for this guy.

This film, like much of their music, is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer. It is terrific and, in many ways, ahead of its time.The images are funny, disturbing, and at the very least, engaging. The music is amazing. This is not the "candy pop" sound they are unfortunately associated with. This is the sound of a band in exploration and revolt.HEAD, alone, should put The Monkees into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Can anyone tell me why these guys are not in there?

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form . I tracked it down, and was quite impressed by the acting. I first saw this movie when it was being broadcast on BBC1. It was presented at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe (which I enjoyed) and so I went to go see it live. There wasn't a single redeeming feature or aspect to this film. It was boring, repetitive, and badly acted.The only character that really stuck in my mind was Dottie. What a bore she was.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family's journey from the Old World (Italy) to the New World (America). Salvatore, a middle-aged man who hopes for a more fruitful life, persuades his family to leave their homeland behind in Sicily, take the arduous journey across the raging seas, and inhabit a land whose rivers supposedly flow with milk. In short, they believe that by risking everything for the New World their dreams of prosperity will be fulfilled. The imagery of the New World is optimistic, clever and highly imaginative.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once , about ten years ago . I can only assume the film producers decided to make up some of the characters from the book
I found this movie, although I thought it would be better than Alien, boring and poorly directed. The story was very cliche, the ending was silly, and there were several plot holes throughout. The only thing that kept me from loathing the film was the fact that I liked "Alien" and wanted to see the movie in all its glory. What a disappointment.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.

This is one of my favourite Disney films . It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation, but unfortunately, the characters and plot are too shallow. I'm sorry, but this movie really isn't worth watching. The only redeeming quality of this film is that it made me realize why I hated all those Disney movies I'd previously watched when I was younger. I did not find this to be good. Not even close. I suppose there must be some people who like it just because it's from Disney. However, it lacks any charm or emotion.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

Years ago when I first read John Irving 's The World According to Garp , I was astounded that most of my friends couldn't find the movie in theaters. I always think it's great for a film to be released as a big blockbuster, and with this one, Warner Brothers seems to have accomplished that goal. However, even though many critics gave it a "meh" rating, I would still not recommend it to anyone under the age of 25 or so. While the story isn't bad by any stretch of the mind, the dialogue is cloying and the acting is cheesy.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White , Cinderella , or Bambi , but it IS a very entertaining and well-acted romp with plenty of laughs, plus a great love story. I found this film quite hard to follow. In my opinion it should have been subtitled "An American in France". Most of the action occurs in France, where the plot takes place, so the main characters would be French. However, only one of the main characters is French, and most of the other characters come from the U.S. (or even Canada! ).

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the world as well. I don't know how you can not like this movie. The story is simple, but there's a lot of heart and emotion behind its simplicity. This is a good example of an American drama that has been lost in translation. A beautiful young girl leaves her mother to try and make it as a singer with her uncle/cousin. There is a tragic twist at the end when she is killed in a freak accident while on stage.

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war. Everything about the movie was perfect. I just saw the movie yesterday and I want to get my own DVD asap and watch it many times over. The story ends as it started I was very happy that he came back and I was proud of her for becoming a doctor and fulfilling her father's dream. She honored her father, boyfriend-husband, and her lover. The character had many shades. Christian Bale is also an phenomenal actor. Some stories do have happy endings.

I still can't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site. Such a rare movie, so little spoken and known, is difficult to find, even to fans, but the contrast betwen past and present is devastating: now I hold a DVD of the movie, with the finest quality possible. As I did in Atlantis, the other rare Besson movie I bought by the internet, I saw this one at home, with all the lights of my dvd and tv turned off, and marveled at the experience. I didn't know what to expect.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

* Could contain spoilers , read only after seeing last episode season 2 * Think about it . The guys are out to kill each other for money but they never kill anyone else . They end up killing people and not killing themselves. If I were to ask one question, "What can I say that you won't know already", this is it. My problem with this show is that it doesn't get enough credit. It started off as a fairly good cop drama, and now it's a really bad cop drama.

"Showtime" is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro (Meet the Parents,A Bronx Tale) and Eddie Murphy (Shrek, Dr. Dolittle). The story is this: In the beginning of the movie detective Mitch (Robert DeNiro) and another detective go into a tv store trying to bust some criminals. When the cops arrive, Tray(Eddie Murphy)a cop, tries to arrest Mitch not knowing he's a cop. During this scene loads of funny things happen which catch the eye of tv producer Chase Ritz.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies . Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 is just a sequel to this movie.I can't believe that it got made at all. It was bad enough in the first movie but this one's even worse! If I had my time back, I would never watch it again.The acting is poor, the music is terrible and the effects are also poor. You might not care if you don't know anything about the story but it doesn't really matter anyways.

I thought Besson 's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them. I didn't expect a lot, but it was something. I'm surprised that this movie got as much acclaim as it did. The acting wasn't the best but it was at least good enough for me to want to see this in the theater. That's where I will admit that I really did not care about the story and the characters. I couldn't help but shake my head at the idea of people taking part in these kind of stunts.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films, it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment. The most noticed element of the film is its silence; no one speaks. I don't think Besson, despite what is evident in most of his later work, meant it as any kind of cool gimmick. I think what makes it so clever and so effective is the fact that with no other way of communicating, everyone has to read each other based on intuition and conveying of emotion, no matter how slight.

Great show ! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps . Contestants range in ages from 18 to 72 and they have to get married within 3 years of the show's start date. I'm so happy this program is here, but I must say I found most of the material to be completely unrealistic! I didn't realize how difficult it was for young women to find a good man when they're only 20 or 21 years old. I don't think people who marry before age 22 are "crazy" or immature.

After spotting the boat at the end of the previous episode ( `` Three Minutes '' ) , the survivors take off for shore. However, they are immediately attacked by a pack of wolves, who are able to kill several members of the group before they decide to return to the island. As they try to get back on the ship, they run into another pack of wolves, but are unable to escape again. I was pretty disappointed in this movie, it had many problems. The story line and characters were just awful.

This is a good film, no doubt, but with some odd aspects. Without spoiling anything it takes place in 3 places only- a Sicilian farm, the boat,and Ellis Island New York. All shots are close up so we never see a broad sweep of anything. I wonder if this was to save money? No street scenes anywhere, and we don't even see the boat except in close ups. And the music...what on earth was going on with playing Nina Simone songs, decades before they were out?

A great movie . The movie was even better then the commercials put on . And believe it or not there were some action sequences that were very close to scenes from the book. This is one of those shows that everyone seems to like to hate. There's nothing special about it; it's just a show for kids. My two cents? If I'm going to get paid for writing reviews, I'll tell you what this show is. You can see it if you look for it. I was so excited when i rented this DVD and watched it.

If you haven't seen this film, do it. Its a genremix as i've never seen another. Some very surreal scenes, some hilarious funny stuff, a film noir felling, musical numbers with a swing, sex scenes (The 2nd best played orgasm on Film, bested only by Sally), a pitch of Orson Welles blended together into a work of art. As an work of art it hasn't to be logical at the end, at least not logical for everybody ;-). I owned an tv copy on VHS but loaned it to an ex-girlfriend and now i can't get it back.

What's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season... Here is my forecast: 1. The hatch was indeed blown, but somehow everybody inside survived. Buts lets see about that. 2. The episode at the end with the tent is an observation team monitoring the tracking device installed on Desmonds boat by Penny. Now that the magnetic shield around the island was lifted, the signal was picked up by the observation station and they are going to send a rescue mission. 3.

My favorite show of all time ! Yeah , I thought this was so cool , and Larisa Oleynik was just so perfect in the role...I don't know what i'm supposed to say...just watch it!If you didn't already know what this show is about , then you are going to hate it right from the beginning.The characters are so clich√©d and unoriginal, that you will start laughing at their bad behavior after a few episodes . Some of these characters even started to be annoying when they tried to speak Russian. This is my 2nd time watching this particular show.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job. He apparently received no credits. Too bad.All the Dead End Kids do their jobs beautifully in this 1939 entry. It is odd to watch them in a Western setting with their Brooklyn accents ( I guess that should be Bowery ). They even show some swimming abilities.I think there are many special scenes that can stay with the viewer of this boxing/love/crime story. My favorite right now is in the fight scene near the end of the film.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in! I love watching him!! i was 10 yrs old (1979) when i seen him for the first time.i eagerly await each and everything he'll be acting in. hopefully one day i can see him in person. he's very hypnotic and mysterious and that voice is commanding and strong! he is very attractive, even now at 65 he is absolutely stunning!!!! In my opinion he is the greatest actor iv'e ever seen!

At first I didn't think I would like this movie, but as it progressed it became better and better. I love music and I was impressed with how well Cage could fake the movements of playing a mandolin. My son was with me and he also like the movie a lot for its music and the story and the way the story unfolded--- slowly showing how Corelli won the girls heart. The acting and the story were both well done and well directed. At first Corelli's bravado was irritating, but soon he grew on you.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time , when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original run, which was not available on videotape back in the early 70s. The series was absolutely brilliant and I'm surprised they didn't sell out and put a re-run on TV instead of letting the rights lapse. If I had $300 million to spend on any project, this would be one of my top picks. Well, it was obvious that the producers weren't trying hard to pull this off; it's basically a glorified episode of "Saturday Night Live."

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline. I go to the movies as an escape, to leave everything behind and enjoy a "story". I found this to be a good movie, not great, but good. It was worth my money and my tears :)Diane Lane was wonderful as always, Richard Gere isn't an over-actor. He held his own and has a certain presence that we always come to expect. He brings his own style to the movie.I think it was the kind of love story that doesn't always get told.

Not a stunner, but a good movie to see once or twice. Bill Macy shows he can do more than just act; his writing was pretty darn good. Great supporting cast, especially Jamie Cromwell as the extortionist private eye.The movie's greatest strength is the work of Macy, who reminds us of his Jerry Lundergaard role from Fargo. He has numerous scenes where he is extremely funny as a slimy, manipulating and deceitful character. It's enjoyable to watch him be a weasel, and for a while I was happy that things were turning out well for him.

I 've commented once on this Chucky great , but I had to do it again to say some things here.The film starts with a scene from a movie about a woman who went to see a man in a black mask, he had a huge knife and was holding a girl. She tried to save herself by jumping out of the window. In the end, she died. It was a very depressing beginning to the film. Then, we see a group of guys in a van. One of them has a large knife and cuts all his friends.

Due to its predictable , second-rate title , ( the one it was distributed under in Italy , at least ) this movie is not worth a second look. I will only say that if you are looking for a cheesy horror/thriller with a decent lead , then by all means , go see it . Otherwise don't waste your time . It looks like a cheap remake of John Landis' "Maniac Cop". The plot of the film is as follows: A cop is hired by a rich guy to kill some robbers.

SPOILERS BELOW ` A Dog 's Life ' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing . In Charlie Chaplin 's last film before his death in 1939, he and Buster Keaton set out on a hilarious adventure through the underworld of London. This is the movie that made him a great director. It's as close to a masterpiece as he gets. This movie has very few redeeming features - other than maybe one or two things that you would probably like to see more of (or less of). The story doesn't make much sense, there's not much action and there's no sense of urgency.

This movie got better with time . I ca n't believe that it has been forty years since I saw it. The first half hour of the movie is very good but by the end it is not funny anymore. After the first fifteen minutes the movie became completely unbelievable. "The Day the Earth Stood Still" starts out slow and easy, as if to lull you into thinking it's going to be a nice little piece of science fiction. Unfortunately, it never quite gets there. A couple of guys drive around an abandoned desert looking for one of their friends who went missing some time ago.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time. Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. Every time I watch it, I can get something else out of it. It's a real testament to wanting to hold onto a life that was good, but now the world is changing. But you don't have to be older to hold onto the past, even the young characters, like Charlotte don't want things to change. The overall tone and mood is excellent. The cast is outstanding with all-stars like Kathy Bates, Beau Bridges and Arthur Kennedy.

As with so many modern US films , there has to be a supernatural element to the plot , but it's never explained what this means . This is one of my favorite comedies of all time! It had me laughing out loud every time, and I think everyone in the audience would have done the exact same thing.The story itself is a little silly, and doesn't really tell you much about the relationship between the characters or the events that occur during the course of the film. There are also a couple of annoying minor characters that get too much screen time.

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground , and in particular the `` flowering " aspect of their friendship. Not a bad start, but I was expecting more.I was pretty sure this one would be so good that I'd actually go see it. This movie didn't live up to my expectations at all. It wasn't even as good as the other reviews say it is. I did not realize the extent of my own ignorance until recently when I started watching something else (a film by Roger Ebert).

When I was 10 (currently 14), I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would not have a happy ending. And until a few weeks ago I had done pretty well, except for Shakespere for English class...etc...I was still only watching things that ended happy. But then I saw Ramola Garai in Havanah Nights, which was cute, not good but entertaining enough to watch. After seeing this a few times over the two or so years since I first saw it, I grew to like it, especially the music.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another "he-man" flick. That is a complete disservice to both Charles Bronson and the man himself. This film is a truly incredible piece of cinema. The set design, the camera work, the special effects are on another level altogether. A true movie classic in every sense of the word. Bronson's first two films had little to no plot or dialogue and were made in a similar style to his later works, however, this one is much better.

When the Romulans come, they will not be bearing gifts; no, they bring with them war - war and conquest. As any familiar with this episode know, it is a redux of the war film "The Enemy Below" from the fifties. The obvious difference is that instead of a battleship and a submarine (or an American Destroyer & German U-boat) engaged in lethal war games, it is two starships in outer space. In Trek history, about 100 years before the events here, according to this episode, Earth fought the Romulan Wars.

I thought that the storyline came into place very well . I liked this movie a lot . If you like horror movies , then you should give it a read . The actors are great . The setting is eerie . The ending was a little bit cheesy for my taste . But all in all i am happy that I bought this DVD . It was worth the effort . This film is nothing more than an imitation of "Rosemary's Baby". To be honest though, I think it could have been a lot worse.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius . And this movie is good ! Although the film does n't nearly reach its full potential (the writing and acting are not quite up to par) it is still a worthwhile experience that should be watched by any serious fan. I really didn't expect much of this movie at all but boy, was I wrong. I think most people who like Sacha Baron Cohen movies tend to love them for the sheer absurdity of his work so I wouldn't expect this one to be particularly funny. Sadly, it is not.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

I 'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci 's films . Most of his 80s gore films had their moments, but they did not compare to movies like this. That said I have no real issues with this film, I just think that it is a tad over the top and in some cases downright ridiculous. It's pretty much a "man-on-the-moon" sort of story, where we are introduced to a character through the eyes of a small boy (played by Michael Bierut ) as he tries to figure out who all these people really are.

I thought Besson's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them; Capture true human emotions. The main character's struggles, triumphs, set backs, hopes and desires are all so honestly shown that you wonder if he is acting at all. The film has a low budget and is obviously made without the glitz and glamour afforded to most Hollywood productions but that minimalism is what allows this film to transcend the stereotypical Sci-Fi labeling and become a true drama. However calling this film solely a drama would take away from the fantastic post-apocalyptic plot.

it's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar fight, and get into serious trouble. they find themselves fighting some shadowy people, and can't deal with. very, very disturbing portrayal of japan, the arbitrariness of modern life... some intense scenes, but a bit of a potboilerthe spoiler was that the plot is not too clear based on English sub titles. obviously, i don't know Japanese.the only other Japanese movies i've seen were kurosawa, who is a different and far loftier than this modern genre.

I 've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months ( maybe longer but not much )and it gets better and better. It's really good, i don't care what you think. The writing is really good and I always enjoy the guest appearances by people we've seen on other tv shows. "Attack Of The Show" is a terrible show that does nothing but waste my time with every single one of its stupid jokes. In particular there are very few episodes that do not have their share of gags, so if you like humor in general, you won't like this show.

Jeff Garlin's film is filled with heart and laughter. As in Curb Your Enthusiasm, his screen persona is hilarious; but in addition we get to see both warmth and a sense of emotional vulnerability that makes the story universal. While the film chronicles his character's dreams of love, performing success, and weight loss, it will appeal to anyone who dreams of a better life. The supporting cast brings the frustrations and joys of his life to the screen in funny and heartbreaking ways. The simple joys of food, friendship, and trying once again once life has disappointed us are all themes.

This movie , based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt , is one of the best films I 've ever seen. I can't tell if it was supposed to be a realistic film or a comedy (or if it was a combination of those things). But there was something about it that made me really enjoy it. That said, I had no idea what the plot would be about or how the characters were going to relate to one another. I love this movie. I'm not a fan of horror movies and I'm always up for good popcorn entertainment.

A Formula For Murder isn't a well known Giallo, but that isn't to say it's not a very good one! The film is directed by Alberto De Martino, the man behind cult classics such as The Antichrist and Blazing Magnums. The film was released late on in the Giallo cycle, but more than stands up to many of the films released around the 'golden' period in the early seventies. Despite a lack of logic in some areas, the film works mainly due to the competent way it mixes Argento style death scenes with some genuinely surprising plot twists, and a host of well defined characters.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts. But it will put you close to being in a time and place that no longer exist by getting to the *feeling*.As Keith Richards remarks in Paul McCartney's movie about Holly, there's some Buddy Holly in almost all rock made since his day. The tragedy that took him is dealt with gently, and the rest of the movie recreates the joy of a great music career and a joyful body of music.Gary Busey does a remarkable, energetic portrayal of Holly, and his performances hint that he really gets into the music.

I went to the pre-screening of `` Rory O'Shea Was Here . '' I like this movie better than I thought I would and found myself thinking it had more potential. That being said, there is not a whole lot going for it. One of those early '80s genre films that was destined to never catch on with anyone, but eventually ended up on an MTV compilation. It features a fairly average cast, including John Travolta as a lawyer who works for a high-society woman in New York City when she learns that her sister has been killed.

What a shame this movie was never released . ( It is now playing on cable . ) I tuned in just so I could see what they got up to in the writers rooms. But, I can't help but feel there was some really good ideas that were left on the cutting room floor. There was a lot of tension in the story and I would like to see it be explored further. The problem with this film is that no one talks. I am an avid film buff from childhood and have been a professional film reviewer for over twenty years.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback , and if anyone is confused about her past ( like I was) - it's that one moment. She seems to have been through a lot over the years, but there was no real connection to what we saw on screen. The first problem of this film is that it starts with a scene where the camera pans up a couple of inches and then cuts back down almost right into the middle of it, which is not only an incredibly bad way to show you're beginning, it also ruins the entire story.

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

This is one of my favorite films, ever. The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so good. Unlike the other Disney films of the age, this film never bores the audience. 101 Dalmations, Peter Pan, Robin Hood, they were all good, but lack what we have here. This is funny, creative, and always on target. This movie just has an extra something that you can't learn in books. However, this is not the best animated film ever made. That title belongs to the BRILLIANT Toy Story.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange . I was confused , sad , angry and scared . This movie made me cry, but not out of pain or sadness. It's about a young woman who is lost and left on an island in the middle of nowhere to die.She finds a man and tries to go back to her old life.The movie did not give me any hints or foreshadowing about how she got there, where she was going or when she would arrive. This one has all the elements needed for a good horror genre movie.

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it (typical Malibu Barbie) but the rest of the actors are just great! I watched the film last night and it totally kept me going thru out the whole film. Chad Michael Murray IS SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO HOTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT and he's just a ace actor. Total hero man. The main girl who is the sister to nick (chad) is such a brilliant actress. Thumbs up. I think it's so different to films out their these days, most of them to go with psychopath's, possessions, ghosts but here you have a theme about wax!

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in ! I love watching him ! ! i dont know what the movie is about but its one of the worst films i have ever seen. It starts off really badly and goes downhill so fast that it would take an hour to get to the end of the film. And even then you wont be able to find out what happened because there is no ending. The acting was terrible. They all sounded as if they had just gotten up from a long sleep.

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. The only good that came from it was this movie, "Take it to Limit" Right as the movie started, we could tell we were in for a true classic. The music is probably done by rural white boys from Colorado, but it sounds just like early 90's rap. The star of the show, actor Leo Fitzpatrick, plays the bad-boy so well, especially sporting a big zit the entire movie.

I really enjoyed this film , it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat . It was very well shot . The actors did an awesome job . There are some cool scenes in the movie .If you're looking for something different then I recommend this movie to you . What can I say other than "this is one weird movie". It's just not that funny and the dialogs are almost always clich√©-ridden. My favorite scene was when they were going to leave him in the woods and he had to find out where his car was parked.

i love this film!! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is talking about and means to do. it kept me laughing for the duration. duration of the film, the next day, and beyond. i think this film is not one to watch if you mainly care about the plot and character development. this film is pretty much only for the generation that will understand it. there are lots of things you just know being brought up in that generation that you wouldn't if you were say 40. i think Sacha barren Cohen was Very and i do mean Very good.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I'm Dancing'... i didn't know a thing about it, so had no preconceptions before i went in.The film is about two guys who are confined to their wheel chairs, and live in a home. Michael (Steven Robertson) suffers from Cerabal Palsy and Rory (James McAvoy) suffers from Muscular Dystrophy (please excuse any spelling mistakes!). They form a bond, as Rory seems to be the only person who can understand what Michael is saying.

The last film by underrated director Alberto De Martino ( `` The Antichrist '' , `` The Killer is on the Loose '' ). I guess this isn't very shocking, since you have to ask yourself: why didn't I see it? Well... because I couldn't stand the acting! A few years ago I rented this movie off of Amazon Prime Video and I would like to say that I wasn't expecting much at all for an "edutainment" movie. Unfortunately, I found out just how wrong I was.

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries (Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island) that keeps many of the novel's characteristics. I think that greek sceneries add something special and magical to a movie. One thing i didn't like at all though, is that the main characters, like 'Mandras' and Pelagia's father weren't greek actors but foreigners. I mean the actors tried to express the greek way of living, but to me they didn't succeed and it was quite clear. Even their pronunciation when they were trying to use greek words was terrible and that was bad for the film's plot.

Another enjoyable Warner flick . I really liked John Garfield in this , though I 'm wondering why Cagney was in the cast. This was an awful film, but one of the few movies I could stand. The only "bad" thing about this movie are the actors playing their characters. But that doesn't mean that it isn't a bad film to watch.The plot makes little sense and at times goes off the rails. At other times, it is incredibly stupid. One of the funniest scenes actually happened during the chase sequence near the end.

I don't care what some of the reviews said, this movie was funny. The thing with this film is that you can't expect anything else except to be entertained. This is not some intellectual comedy, this is a clever popcorn movie. The three main cast members are great and work very well with each other. Shatner is a standout in the supporting cast as himself, a former TV cop, brought in by Russo's character to coach the cops on how to be "TV cops." Those are by far the funniest scenes.

"Nuovomondo" was a great experience. Many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue. Emanuele Crialese directs his film very visually driven. For everything he wants to tell, he finds powerful images that are able to stand for themselves. Thus, he understands film as a medium that primarily tells its stories over the pictures on screen. Particularly European cinema is often very dialogue-driven (and many of the young US-American directors are strongly influenced by that). Crialese's opposite attitude was really the point, that made this film special for me.

the first time I saw this movie, I just thought "what the hell?" a 10-year-old kid driving around bizarre places, meeting bizarre people, going after a game called MOTORAMA! Hell yeah! I enjoyed this movie a lot!Jordan Christopher-Michael is a brilliant young actor! It's a shame he stopped act. He interprets very well his character Gus on the movie.Gus loses an eye, got tattoos and go at the most weird cities acting with Flea, Drew Barrymore and Meat Loaf! Want more? OK, don't even try to understand the story, but why this movie needs one!?

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80's, and this one is even better. Sylia, Nene, Linna, and Priss are all back as the Knight Sabers in their hard-suits battling the robotic boomers. The animation is crisp, the characters are well-developed, and the action rocks. Priss is a singer in her regular job, so the series features some wonderful songs as well. There is a fair amount of violence, but most of it is against robots, and there is some fan service, but nothing too racy.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD (I'm expecting to see the My Mother the Car collection any day now) this film has been unfairly neglected. There are innumerable stupid comedies from the 60's as well as many other eras that have received at least a cursory DVD treatment. This one wasn't even released on VHS to my knowledge, despite the talents involved in the making (Arthur Hiller, Eli Wallach, Anne Jackson, Murray Shisgal (notable later for co-writing Tootsie), even Dustin Hoffman in his debut).

SPOILERS BELOW`A Dog's Life' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing. In Charlie Chaplin's other movie from 1918, `Shoulder Arms', the silent film genius focuses on an entirely different brand of humor. His war comedy specializes in surreal, exaggerated set pieces in which Chaplin demonstrates unprecedented creativity and mastery of composition. When the soldier's bunker gets flooded, the water level reaches just the right height so that Chaplin can execute his gags most successfully. In a later scene, the soldier dresses up as a tree, a disguise that belies Chaplin's much increased ingenuity and goofiness.

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to try this one. I was surprised how bad this version was!The only reason I gave this a 2 is because of the special effects, although they weren't great, they still looked good and were enjoyable to watch. However, the writing was so terrible that it made it almost laughable!I have to hand it to Tim Curry and his production crew, they managed to put together a movie that was fun to watch at times but didn't even resemble an original work.

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since it helps you to forget what is going on in the movie. In fact I think this movie has more visual impact than an actual movie. This film is not worth your time. There are some good scenes here and there but it's just so bad that it's hard to believe that this was ever made.The acting is very poor, especially from the main characters. The story is extremely contrived and doesn't really make any sense.

The show start out with the boat. Desmond was i it. Then they went to try to save Walt. And Lock things that the button pushing is a big joke at the same time Desmond found out that hes the one that crashed the plane. Eko tries to open the door that Jhon locked on him, and Charlie helped him find the Bomb. While Sayid and Jack plan is that, Sasyid is to find the others first and see who and what the other are. And find if there armed and have any weapons. Micheal takes Jack, Swayer, Kate, and Hugo in a trap.

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character. The humour is very much a 'like it or love it' brand of totally politically incorrect, irreverent and self effacing type.Personally I totally love this film, and so has everyone i have met who has seen it. You can watch it several times and pick new gags up each time. The humour is both aural and visual, and the timing is impeccable. The humour is probably very English, and specifically London, so its possible that non-English viewers may not get some of the humour.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell the tale of how he came to this place. He started out as an officer in Napoleon's army fighting in Egypt but became separated from his unit. After nearly starving and/or dying of thirst he came upon a leopard which somehow became his bosom buddy. It brought him food and before long the soldier became almost totally wild so acute was his bonding with the animal. All things do end however and the man decided it was necessary for him to leave the critter.

In the first transformation scene , what is the music ? I 've heard it was `` The Greeks Do It Better `', but this is very bad. They don't care to do anything right, they just jump around and sing. This is a shame because in the first movie i really thought that it could turn out to be pretty good. I can see why it would get cancelled, since it has all the ingredients of a decent movie: comedy (which is lacking), romance, drama, and suspense. So what goes wrong there?The story is lame.

I thought that the storyline came into place very well. I liked this movie a lot. If you're going to rag on a Bridget Fonda movie, you can just rot. I thought that ragging on movie stars was a bad idea. Apparently somebody doesn't think so. I rather enjoyed the movie. I'm even thinking of buying it. I want it to be my very first DVD for my room. That's how much I like it. I rather would not start an online argument with someone I don't know & have it be over a movie.

This little film is hysterical , full of stereotypes about gays , straights , dwarfs , British tea and pubs , as well as some very strange sexual references. I don't want to sound too negative, but I am not sure I would be able to enjoy this film. It's so bad that it really makes me wonder if there is any hope for a positive gay representation in films at the moment? The script is so unbelievable that I feel sorry for Blythe Danner, her co-stars and the director. The only thing I can say is that I was laughing out loud at every joke.

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's like getting an extra free ticket to see your favorite comedian. That 's about it. This film is terrible. I have nothing but good things to say about The Kids are All Right, the last feature film I saw from James L. Brooks before he went broke trying to write "Beetlejuice 2". He did a very solid job making fun of kids' TV for the most part while using some dark humor, but the film was not particularly funny.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery 's best performances in a movie , and I have seen quite a number of her other films - but this one ranks as one of her very worst. The script is extremely confusing and the film feels like it was poorly edited. It seems like it would have been better if the two leads were married or at least living together; because they could have developed feelings for each other and had an honest discussion about life rather than trying to work out how to keep their secret from each other.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10 , and it just blew my socks off.The series has the look of a soap opera (which it is), but the plots, characters, and even the actors are far ahead of anything else that aired at that time. In the 90's there was another series that was much better than this one, as far as showmanship and production values go, but I never found myself really liking it either. This one is definitely on the worse end of them.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music . Filmmakers such as William Wyler, Howard Hawks, John Barrymore, Mel Ferrer, Robert Aldrich, Richard Lester, Charles Laughton, John Frankenheimer, Michael Curtiz, James Mason, David O. Russell, Roger Corman, etc. , have created an era of cinematic art that can be considered as one of the greatest years for the genre. It's very hard to put my finger on why i didn't care for this movie. Maybe it was the title?

I wish there were more films about middle aged people . The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of the story are well done but i am disappointed with the characters. I like them but i think it would be better to have someone else play the role as the plot is confusing
This movie was so bad it was funnier than anything I've seen this year. Not only did they fail to give me any idea of why the war happened, they also failed to show a shred of humanity or remorse for the people that suffered on either side in the war.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear of being killed and is a scary movie that will not be missed. The only thing I can add is that the story is too long. It was just way too much for the time given to watch it. In the early 1970s in the rural countryside of Italy there lived a couple who had lost everything but each other. Unbeknownst to them, they were being stalked by a deranged killer on a seemingly endless series of gruesome murders.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it. I found the storyline very distressing and can still remember the various bullying techniques used. One in particular was when the other school children spat in his soup before he could even taste a spoonful. They also bound him and shaved his private parts. This was all because he was unpopular. Why was he unpopular? Because he was bad at games. I have a feeling though that even if he was good at games he would have been bullied because it's hard to decide what makes someone popular.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years . On the contrary , I feel it has improved considerably over those early years ! I remember seeing a version of this film as a young boy and having a rather good impression of Peter Cushing . He was fine as an old man . This film seems to have done better by casting younger actors (with the exception of Michael Gambon ) who are much more lively in the lead role . This movie should not be allowed to happen! The cast is all terrible, the directing and acting is just awful.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film. I have got to say that I think everyone was impressed with how good this movie was. Though, my roommate didn't care for it but he's not into horror movies anyway and just went to see if Paris Hilton can act. By the way, if you're worried about that, don't be. I'm not exactly one of her fans, but I must be honest and say she was pretty good and she has the best death scene. Overall, all the actor's were very good.

Wow , What a wonderful film-making ! Mr. Im has done it , again ! His last work , ChunHayang (2005 ), is also an example of this kind of films, with a nice script, beautiful acting and a great director. This movie left me in despair for its failure. I know that there are many talented people who make movies in Korea nowadays. Yet, when watching this movie, the biggest regret I have after seeing it was how boring it was. There were times when I felt like I was looking at an old episode of The Brady Bunch or The Jeffersons.

Even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing . In fact , they are all better now than before their last reunion in 1998. If you are like me, when you first hear of this movie you wonder if it's a joke. The plot sounds as though it will be about two people (the main protagonists) and their adventures while stranded in a cave on an island. There are also mentions of an ape or monkey but I've never seen one! So I had to see it with another set of preconceived notions attached to it.

As I have said before , I am NOT a fan of Tweety . He 's just so aggravating I don't know how anyone could enjoy watching him. However, this film had the potential to be very funny if done right. Instead it felt like it was trying to be an "All in the family"-type sitcom and never quite achieved it. I saw this movie for the first time on a Sunday night. I was disappointed because I was expecting some fun. I love comedy, but not when it is so over the top.

First off, I absolutely loved this movie. As a Billy Crystal fan, I must say that I was expecting more comedic situations than I actually got. However, it was nice to see him in a role with more depth and emotion. His portrayal of talent agent Sammy was brilliantly performed and uniquely him. In addition, Gheorghe Muresan (as Maximus) was superb in his first film role. When Sammy goes to Romania to visit his client on location he has his world turned upside down. He never expected that he would accidentally find the one person who could change his life.

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage in places. This is true, and is the biggest flaw of this film. However, it isn't so often, or so bad, that one shouldn't see this video. If you are a Black Sabbath fan, you have to see this. Aside from having seen Black Sabbath in the Sevnties and early Eighties, I saw them in 2005 or 2006 when they also headlined OZZfest just like in this video.

The last film by underrated director Alberto De Martino ("The Antichrist", "The Killer is on the Phone") is a truly suspenseful but incomprehensibly neglected giallo, containing pretty much all the trademarks that makes this Italian horror sub genre so magnificent and addictive to the fans. There are some very disturbing themes (child abuse, phony priests¬Ö), loads of creepy moments, plot twists left & right, outstanding music and ¬ñ last but not least ¬ñ a handful of really sadistic murder scenes! Especially the opening sequence, which is some kind of prologue, is a powerful piece of horror!

Spike Milligan 's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years , and 2002 's 'Puckoon ' is an exception . I was very disappointed at the end, but I will give it a pass for the first 20 minutes or so because there are some very interesting ideas. But after that things become predictable. The whole movie takes place in a factory, and it seems like you could easily make it about any industrial setting. It is hard to think of a worse way to spend your Sunday afternoon than watching this abysmal movie. This is the worst comedy/drama I have seen in quite some time.

Dr. Paul Flanner (Richard Gere), a successful surgeon, has his wife leave him, his son (an uncredited James Franco) not respect him and looses a patient he's operating on. Adrienne Willis (Diane Lane) has two children and discovers her husband has cheated on her. They both need to get away. She watches over a beautiful oceanside inn in Rodanthe at the same time he books a room. They're all alone together. You can pretty much figure out the rest.This is what's known as a weepie or a woman's film.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh : as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-shot, they are forced to re-act their most famous comedy number. It's almost too perfect. What the hell?! I saw this on TV when it was playing in theatres. It was so bad I thought it was going to get cancelled. When I saw it on Netflix, I instantly thought "It will be like that! "I have no idea what made me decide to give this a chance. It is just plain silly.The movie has two main plots.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years. On the contrary, I was more impressed now than in my callow youth with its honesty and brave humour. In 1969, the transition among African-American groups from a predominant policy of conciliation and integration to one of confrontation and self-determination was still quite new, and more than a little controversial. It took courage and finesse to portray both the Establishment and the Anti-establishment as the caricatures they often closely approximated in real life. Special mention should be made of Arnold Johnson's performance: he successfully avoided having his character lapse into either sociopathy or buffoonery.

I've been a fan of Rachael's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network, so I have seen her grow over the years. The minute I saw her interact with Oprah, I predicted that this show would happen, because I saw how taken Oprah is with her, and with good reason: she comes across as very natural, and willing to laugh at herself, which is very engaging. The set is appealing, and there are some fresh ideas (I love the lazy Susan that the audience sits on).

What a surprise . A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor ' only naughtier . Funny guy goes to a school and sees that he's in the middle of a class war between two students, one of which he likes better. I am sure that you will enjoy this film. However, I feel like it was poorly made. The acting was sub-par, the writing was horrible, and the soundtrack was mediocre. It just seemed like a bad joke that was too dumb to ever get a green light from any studio.

`` Pearl Harbor , buddy . '' This movie is brilliant ! Sure it does n't exactly flow like an ocean in the water, but damn! The actors are good. And they are doing their job perfectly. I couldn't care less what the plot of this movie was about. It's just a well-acted film with some pretty decent songs. As someone who loves to see movies which make you think, not just sit there and get your ass handed to ya, I thought I would give this one a go.

Exclusively for Coop 's lovers , though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this movie , if you see it, do not bother with the story . I am a fan of James Cameron and I have been watching him since his first movie T2: Trainspotting came out. This movie was so bad I almost threw it out of the window. I'm not even sure if it should be called a "movie" because there isn't really anything happening here that you can't find in any other part of the movie.

SHOWTIME is a mess, but it's an entertaining mess. The plot is forgettable, the satire is lightweight and the action sequences, though well-staged, aren't that exciting. But I laughed. A lot. Credit goes to the inspired pairing of De Niro and Murphy. They have great chemistry. Murphy delivers the one-liners, De Niro cracks us up with a look or grimace. This movie will get a RUSH HOUR-like reception from the critics. Don't listen to them. If you're a fan of De Niro or Murphy, you're going to enjoy this movie.

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce, Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman's remote country home and spend some time with her. When Kate arrives, however, Susan is nowhere in sight. That's because someone has murdered her and stuffed the body in a trunk in the basement. As a storm rages outside, Kate tries to figure out where her sister could have gone and places her own life in great danger...the killer is still on the premises! In her first post-BEWITCHED vehicle, Elizabeth Montgomery gives a solid dramatic performance.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.Thing is there are 2 different stories that start off around the same time, but they aren't related at all.They were filmed in sequence, so when one ends, it just seems to drag on and on.I wish I could give it higher ratings but I can't..it's just terrible.The characters are totally uninteresting. The writing is weak, with lots of dialogue that is completely pointless.It would have been much more interesting had you never watched the first story.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? I doubt it!Blankfield was fairly popular at this time for playing the pill-popping doctor on Fridays. Thomerson has been funny in anything he does, from movies to series to stand-up comedy. If I ever find this movie on DVD I will definitely buy it. I recorded this movie off of HBO back in '82 and have pretty much worn out the tape. One of the funniest takes on the Jekyll & Hyde theme ever.Of course.

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war . The rain and muddy battlefields are an apt setting for this story of a young soldier trying to make it in the face of death. As I have mentioned before (and will mention again) this is one of my favorite films. When I saw this movie on television, I went immediately to the DVD store to buy it. It wasn't just that I was interested in Chaplin but also that I liked his movies.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good. I have to admit Ms Cruz can really act. She puts on a very good performance. In fact she our does her boyfriend Tom in drama. John Hurt was great as usual. Nicholas Cage seemed to be enjoying himself. I bet he felt he was going back to his roots as an Italian. However, I did learn something. One more chapter in Horrors of Nazi Germany the many Italian soliders killed during the period of there surrender to the allies and Germany's eventual surrender.

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but still I enjoyed it. This time, Charles is not just fighting one or two muggers but a whole army of them. Death Wish 3 has a lot great action scenes and I enjoyed it every single second of it. Director Michael Winner knows how to direct a good action movie like this and Jimmy Page providing the music, with producers Golan and Globus still doing there thing and Charles Bronson is still acting good for Paul Kersey.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918. In fact, it is now more available with two other medium sized silent Chaplin features (A DOG'S LIFE, and THE PILGRIM) that Chaplin re-released in the 1950s. In it's day SHOULDER ARMS was a big hit because of it's humor in uniform approach. It still is very funny (Chaplin in disguise as a tree, spying on the Germans, is so ridiculous it's hysterical), but it suffers from being set in it's own age.

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen , However , I am only in the first year of a Phd Degree in Psychology. It is so hard for me to keep my mind from wandering . I've always been a bit of a Columbo hater but this film was a complete disaster. To begin with, it was badly acted and poorly written. The story was not believable and neither was the ending.The plot was very simplistic and it was hard to believe that there was anything at all going on here.

I just saw this film and I recommend it. It has a very good plot, it holds your complete attention, the acting is superb, Tom Wilkinson was fantastic and Emily Watson was also very good. A very good film indeed, about great and unconditional love. Tom Wilkinson's character is a man who is not prepared for the ordeal that is about to begin, but he takes the matter in hand as the story progresses, and this great actor gives a performance that makes you feel the character's anguish and suffering.

You know, people who make comedies so often forget it's really ok to be outrageous. Well, not this time. Unconditional Love has it all. Barry Manilow and a dwarf in a movie with Cathy Bates as the romantic lead...and it works. Not only does it work, it works very very well. In fact, I think it's perfect. I laughed so hard I think I hurt myself yet the main characters were all so human, so honest, and so very real. But isn't that where great comedies come from?

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen. Clearly not that many because it only got a 6.8. There is nothing wrong with it at all. It's my favorite of the Disney classics, which have tons of fantastic films already made. Like Beauty and the Beast, Snow White, and Peter Pan. The reason why The Aristorcats is so high on my list is because of how funny the film is. I hate to say this, but I don't blame Edgar for what he does. I probably would've had them taken care of too.

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local election (because that's what people do with bad films) and having this film fail miserably at both the box office and with the electorate, I was left thinking 'what the f***? How can anyone look at this movie and justify it?' It's one thing to make a movie that is a complete mess but even worse to make one that actually has an audience. This is quite possibly the worst disaster of all time.

No real plot , no character development , no Scorcese-level direction , but seriously , were you really expecting any more out of a movie like this? I mean we all have seen worse , right ? This is probably the best, most original film in my entire life. I can't think of another thing that's been able to so completely surprise me. The acting was good, but it could have been better. There were a few odd scenes, but for the most part this was one of the most interesting films i've ever seen.

A labor of love. Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you. Then the sheer emotion and story-telling take you through a dream that stays with you long after the movie. The director gets your heart and leads it through 100 minutes of visual poetry. You are a part of the emotional ride of the characters. I have seen this movie at 2 festivals and it got with standing ovations at every showing. The remarkable story-telling transcends nationality and language and I felt I was a part of the drama unfolding before me. The casting is as perfect as one can get.

I thought this movie was pretty good!OK, so maybe it had a few scenes that could make people think of other horror movies, but i have seen a lot more pathetic movies that got much higher ratings than this! Many movies nowadays are remade to a more modern version and there's nothing wrong with that, it keeps the story alive. i don't think this movie was pathetic at all and i'm not just saying that because i'm a major Chad Michael Murray fan, but because i enjoyed it.

I loved this film , which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival . In March 2005 I went to see "The Manchurian Candidate" on television. While watching the movie I felt an eerie, unexplainable sense of foreboding. This film was not like that. After viewing this film I found it a disturbing experience. This is one of the greatest horror movies of all time. There are so many things that are wrong with this movie that I can't believe anyone actually liked it. First, it doesn't make sense.

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of this film. When you look for a good documentary film, you might end up here. And I wouldn't blame anyone for it as this film is not bad at all. The problem comes from the fact that it fails to give the audience enough to be interested in. First of all: This movie has absolutely nothing to offer on its own terms. In my humble opinion, it is too slow and boring.Secondly: There is really nothing to do in the movie except sitting down and watching.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie ( I have lived here my whole life), I have never seen a more miserable film in my life. Not even the worst of the "Hood" movies! When you get into the mood to sit down and watch a depressing movie, then this is the movie for you. The dialogue between the main characters is so horrible you almost wish you were listening to them talk. I saw this movie about a year ago on HBO and I thought it was going to be a wonderful piece of art.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I 've seen in a very long time. If you have not seen it please do yourself a favor and check it out. I don't know where I was when I first saw this film, or even if I had seen it when it was released. When I found my copy years later it was already half way through the run. After hearing positive reviews about this film I decided to go pick it up and give it a try. First of all, it looks like crap.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly (1936-1959) is a tour de force for Gary Busey. The movie's highlights are Busey's stage performances where he plays guitar and sings Holly songs. He brings such energy to the performances that Holly's own filmed performances almost pale in comparison. Busey's infectious toothy grin lights up the screen, he creates a totally believable and winning personality and his Oscar nomination for best actor was well deserved.The film follows Holly's career from growing up in Lubbock, Texas, to stardom and New York and his untimely death in a plane crash.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title. The movie was cool,despite the fact, I hate new ones! All of the cast was awesome . It has great cast and an awesome plot!! The main plot is a man is poisoned and he has to solve his own murder , neat eh? !Dennis Quaid is the man who is "D.O.A"(in other words Dead On Arrival).He finds help with his friends, but everyone is now a suspect! !Dennis's character has several hours to find out who poisoned him.

I love the TV contest. Hate to see it end. There are so many talented contestants. It's a shame that only 2 will be picked. I love watching the judges also.
