And others, looked so young that perhaps parents or teachers handed down the movie hoping it would touch their lives the way it once touch them. Grease has truly become an American icon. Grease is a fun and entertaining movie in which the young and old can relate to. "You're The One That We Want" is sure to gain even more Grease followers.

It's just that. Chucky 1 was good. Chucky 2 was better. Chucky 3 sucked. Now, the 4th in the series which is, in my opinion, the best out of the series. Jennifer Tilly was just great in this movie. For dolls, they were better than a few actors that come to mind (Freddie Prince Jr, for one) and funnier than many comedies I've seen in the past.The plot wasn't great, but I really didn't care about it. Just to see Chucky and Tiffany bicker and fight each other.

I usually give horror films around 6/10 , but this one caught my eye . House of Wax was by far the worst movie I have ever watched. I've seen many movies where the killer is still at large and the main character must fend him off, but this film made me sick. The special effects were awful .The camera work was so bad it looked like somebody had put a big screen over the head of someone in the audience . If you want to feel something when watching this, then do yourself a favour and stop watching after the first 20 minutes.

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people would n't like it . But at the same time i have never seen something so funny , well done and with a plot as good as this. The only thing i did find really bad was the fact that they kept on cutting to other things while the film was playing. It should be clear to everyone by now that this movie has no staying power whatsoever, in my opinion. One minute, you're thinking, "Why didn't anyone tell me about this?!"

Like some people here , I love/loved Stingers ! In Norway it got aired a lot later . That also made it more enjoyable. I've seen the TV version about a dozen times now. It was always a pretty decent show, and very well directed, but that's about the only good thing about it. Most of the stories were weak, the actors seemed bored or just didn't work, the songs were not really that good, and there weren't enough of them to carry the whole thing. One of the worst things about this is that the music from the film wasn't used at all.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread. Louis de Berniere's bestselling novel is one of my favourites and anyone who has read it will realise that there is no way in hell that any screen adaptation can be 100% faithful. All the way through I found myself convincing myself that the movie was unsuccessful, and had stripped the book's plot back so far as to render it redundant. The ending, however, is much better than that in the novel, and I could not stop thinking about the movie afterwards.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative , but I loved this movie . I have to say I really do not like movies that are totally devoid of any story or even character. This film however has a great storyline that will keep you interested long after the last scene is screened. The cinematography is good, and well done. The sound quality is also quite good. I know it might be easy to write off the movie's low rating as a product of its low budget. However, I felt there was something off about the movie for at least 2 reasons.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character . The humour has always been based on the idea that you're watching somebody who's playing to win, and in that way, it can be quite funny. Well, this is the best film I have seen all year. It might be a little long for those just wanting to get to the end. After that, my eyes were glazing over like a bowl of popcorn, and I could not even finish what I had started. This film was very bad.

where do we go from here ? that is the overriding question of this film . And make no mistake , if they were going to make another movie like the original, it should have been a "sequel". "Sci-Fi/Horror" doesn't sell very well. I understand that audiences are willing to try out movies like this and not be overly critical. Unfortunately, you don't want to be seen with someone who really knows what they're doing at the movies. There are too many examples of films that could have been much more good but fell short due to an inferior cast or plot.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads. The movie is about Bartelby .B. Gaines a guy who has rejected from all the colleges he has applied for so decides to make his own college and invites all the other people who did not make it, problem is hundreds of people sign up to his school. The movie is hilarious and I was lucky enough to buy it for $5.00 at a sale and I have always watched it since. Overall this movie is a must watch for fans of all comedy as it is funny, witty and just a good movie all up.

"A Slight Case of Murder" is an excellent TV movie, which is defiantly worth the price of a rental. William H. Macy is great as a movie critic who accidentally kills his mistress, and then has to try to conceal the crime. Although that may sound dark, the film is actually quite light hearted and funny, with many memorable lines ("Acting is harder than I thought- you ever see BODY HEAT? I think I owe Bill Hurt an apology" and my personal favourite "For next week answer these two questions about film noir, What do these people do during the day?

The `` all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring ... '' scene was a riot . I don't think I'll ever watch it again, but I do remember the rest of the film quite well. The movie had a lot of twists and turns and not a single one was predictable. It had a lot of interesting people in it. I came across this as part of a bargain bin at a local thrift store for a couple of bucks. After seeing the trailer, I decided to go back and check it out.

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it . Since then I 've searched for a copy , and have not been able to locate it anywhere on the net! So, I thought I would share it with all those who might appreciate it . What is wrong with movies nowadays? From "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy (and its sequels) to Hollywood's current output, there is a depressing amount of shallow, formulaic storytelling that lacks originality, creativity, or any genuine emotion.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film? Probably someone. But no-one, truly no-one, could ever compare their expectations with the amazingly emotive and powerful performance given by the two actors in this film.Michael (Steven Robertson) lives in a home for disabled people. He has Cerebral Paulsy, and as shown to us right at the beginning, he has huge trouble communicating. So it truly is a lifeline when fellow disabled member Rory (James McAvoy) who can speak normally, understands him.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO, regardless of the age of the OAV. The plot itself makes sense, but the characters don't.This might sound picky, but considering that the city of Olympus is almost exclusively populated by living machines, would YOU feel comfortable there as a human? Would any machine ever emulate human arrogance, short-sightedness and greed quite so effectively? I doubt it. There are some pointers towards this in the movie, but only when the team can be bothered to put them in, by and large the 'bioroids' (or whatever they are) are interchangeable with human characters.

This movie was great. It had everything a true action fan could want. Plenty of people getting shot and/or maimed, minimal romance involving sex, a hero that can be identified with, violence at many intervals instead of pointless plot storing up just one scene at the end, and villains that are just asking for it. Bronson appears to be at his lowest level of tolerancy in this film and it shows. Ed Lauter makes a great cop and was seamlessly worked into Bronson's plot without stealing his spotlight. The movie doesn't involve a plot so boring or over-consuming that you watch this film once and never again.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've been on this Earth (about ten years), I have had a love/hate relationship with some of his works. That being said, The Fifth Element was an extremely enjoyable film. The action scenes were incredibly good, particularly in the opening portion of the film when a space ship comes to earth. This movie is one of the lowest rated movies I have ever watched. The characters are so clich√©d that it becomes comical rather than scary.

At one time `Buddy Cop' movies ruled the box office. It seemed that every summer flocks of Beverly Hills Cop wannabes descended on our nation's theaters. Not any more. Lately the gusher has dried to barely a trickle. The drought has eased a bit recently with the release of Showtime, a movie that is a genuinely funny and consistently entertaining example of the genre.Mitch Preston is a dedicated cop. He's not a Dirty Harry type by any means. He's just incredibly focused professional who's completely intolerant of anything that gets in the way of the performance of his duties¬Ölike, say, a T.V.

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007. I saw this film three years ago at the Vancouver International film Festival and have been waiting for it's release ever since so I could send everyone I know to see it. It's like taking a trip to India....colorful, magical, thought provoking. Aside from one rather strange Hollywood style auto rickshaw chase scene this movie is very realistic. This is not a Bollywood style song and dance movie but it does have drama and romance and humor.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky' is a "return to greatness" but the series was never really great. Very good #1 was, #2-3 were throwaways, and I think this 4th installment is equal to or even better than the first movie. And it contains the best subtitle/tagline: "Chucky Gets Lucky." So he does, in the role of Jennifer Tilly, who thoroughly rejuvenated this series as Jeri Ryan did for 'Star Trek: Voyager.' Tilly didn't just create a presence; she added much needed humor, back-story, drama, tension and a great little sidekick/play-thing for Chucky.

Jack, Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond. His traumatic past experience before sailing to the island is disclosed through flashbacks. Sayid plots a plan with Jack to surprise "The Others" in case Michael is double-crossing the group. John Locke convinces Desmond to invade the hatch, which is protected by Mr. Eko, and not press the button of the computer to see what will happen.This episode is one of the best of the Second Season. Unfortunately, we lovers of "Lost" can see the lack of respect the producers of this stunning series have with the fans.

I will admit , I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film , and after about 5 minutes, my eyes popped out of my head , because it just seemed like a big waste of time on so many levels ! First off , the plot is totally unbelievable. I know that you have to tell a good story or something , but how can you even come up with a story like this ? How are you going to explain all the things happening in the movie ? It just doesn't seem believable . What a waste of a film.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I, which gave us Werner Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness".Le Dernier Combat is not "Sci Fi". It's more like Judgment. I've watched it at least a dozen times. It really is a fitting companion to Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness": "And in that time, men will seek death, but they will not find it, for death will flee from them. "That someday, alas, may be today, in Iraq.

This new installment to the Child's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as a stoner witnessing Chucky giveing him the finger and saying "rude f--king doll" and lots of references to the series: "you can kill me but I'll come back. I always come back". The movie's title was probably thought of before the script and was written around it. This is totally different from all other films in the series. It doesn't even have Andy, the central character for all the previous ones.

The writers of lost have outdone themselves . Season two 's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the first episode that set the series off with its brilliant cliffhanger. However, instead of making the characters truly suffer or make us sympathize with them, the show has made us care for the bad guys only because they are so pathetic. I bought this because it had been recommended as an alternative to Lost. There was something appealing about having a cast of actors in their late 30's and not having to worry about their ability to act on screen.

This was a riveting film, one that really drew me in. I'm a big fan of William H. Macy, and he puts in a wonderful performance. His great likeability, coupled with the way his character breaks the fourth wall, really gave me a sense of complicity in his actions. I found myself waiting tensely for the whole house of cards to come collapsing down around him (and by extension myself, as his confidante and silent witness). It took several minutes for me to relax once the film had ended, I was so wrapped up in it.

These days, you rarely come by a kid's show that does not involve 1) a preteen/teen pop star who is as amusing as watching paint dry 2) involve a plot about finding the perfect date with a different guy/girl every time 3) revolves around erratic yelling and unintelligible humor. About 95% of shows on Disney, Nickelodeon, and Cartoon Network fit the listed criteria. To put in simpler terms, they all lack good acting, originality, and good story telling. It as if producers and writers think kids aren't smart enough to understand character development and plot detail.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread . Louis de Berniere was a friend of mine, we worked together on a film called Le Voyage du Monde (The Journey of Man) when I was young. He's not my type of guy, so I don't know what the appeal was, other than the fact that he was French and had an interesting name. First of all let me say I'm sorry for the low ratings. This movie looks like a total waste of money.

When I was 10 ( currently 14 ) , I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would be bad. I am still the same kid, even after becoming a big time movie fan. I'm not one to get all excited about movies I haven't seen before. That's when I decided to take a chance on "The Big Lebowski". This is so bad it's worth its own section. First of all, the script has absolutely nothing in it. You could tell immediately from the very beginning where this was going.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families by stowing away on an outbound ship. They think that if they successfully make the voyage they can better their lives by making enough money in New York to send for their families. Unfortunately for them, the ship that they select is a rundown Russian freighter which has already been heavily fined at a previous port for harboring stowaways. The captain and the first mate are determined not to let this happen again as their jobs are on the line.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety , my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of art, especially those made for a modest budget, should not be given such a wide release with so little information concerning them. When I watched this film I was quite surprised to see some of the technical and artistic achievements displayed in the film. It is one of the worst horror flicks I've ever seen and I would consider it to be one of the worst British films ever made. If only it were more widely available!

I thought this was movie was great, Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie. Yasmine Bleeth's character plays a women who has fallen head over heals in love with Richard Greico's character. They end up getting married and everything seems perfect except Yasmine Bleeth wants a baby more than anything, however she has a hard time trying to conceive. Richard Greico will do anything to make her happy, and will go to extreme measures to make her happy. I thought the acting was great in this movie, and it keeps you guessing.

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

This film is an impressionistic , poetic take on the immigrant experience , a reflective look at the turmoil and struggles of living in America . The characters are mostly caricatures, but it's hard to tell if they're trying to be funny or telling the whole truth . It's not easy to figure out how this film is supposed to make us empathize with these people . For example , there are no lines in the film that suggest any sort of self care . I saw this movie when it came out. I would have paid $5.00 for it back then.

WTF ! ! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending ? ? The Notebook was good ... I can't say that the other ones are much better. I read this book as a teenager, it was actually the first time I'd read an adult novel. (My brother bought it for my birthday, but I thought it was a silly teen novel) I remember being enthralled by the title and the plot line. It was very exciting, especially after hearing about the previous success of "To Kill a Mockingbird".

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London(England). Enjoyed it immensely. Although the Crow & the Chinese Policeman don't appear, and Dan Milligan becomes Dan Madigan (played by Sean Hughes (I)). The interaction between Dan and the Author (Writer/Director) voiced/played by Lord Richard Attenborough, works very well.The rumour is that Lord Attenborough and Elliott Gould (as Dr. Goldstein) appeared in the film for just a pint of beer.Spike was shown the film, on video before he died and by all accounts enjoyed it immensely.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink. Suddenly, a man and a woman are sitting in a darkened room with a red bandana over their eyes. The man says, "If it's so good, why won't everyone see it?" As the camera pans down, we see two more people dressed in black sitting on a bed in a darkened room. The camera then pans up again. This time the lights are on, but there are no people in the room.

inspite of many movies dealing with great artists or a genius, chihaweseon pointed out the real dilemma in which an artist is capted...the decision whether to ease the demands of the popularity or to create something new and to define ones' own style.Chiahweson's desperate seek for inspiration and broadening his conscious led him to live the way he did, restless, outrageous, and yes very drunk! But still he defended and retained the most important ethical rules for an artist: respect to his Master, respect to the nature and the gradual seek for improvement and to perfection.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie . She was only 19 when she starred in this one. She was so young that it seemed like she was already in her 20's during most of it. This is one of the most awful movies I have ever seen. First of all, I am old enough to remember the time when horror movies weren't just for little kids or people under 15. This has nothing to do with any of that. The acting was beyond bad.

This is a 100 % improvement over the dross of a third movie and it 's one hell of a ride. This film should never have ever been released in 1996, let alone be made into a Hollywood film. It was absolutely horrible. The only good thing i can say about the movie is that it was directed by Sam Raimi! I wish he had directed something else rather than do this garbage. He is no Samuel Jackson and his acting is atrocious, to say the least. The writing of this piece of crap is beyond pathetic.

Lucio Fulci's "Don't Torture a Duckling" paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by series of brutal murders of young boys.This surprisingly well-directed film(especially in comparison to later Fulci's gorefests)is distinguished by overall atmosphere of perversity,nastiness and two truly grotesque scenes of brutal violence.The soon-to-be-dead children are depicted as casually cruel and budding peeping toms;Bruno's near-seduction by the naked Patrizia(Barbara Bouchet)really has to be seen to be believed.Highly recommended-especially in pair with my another cult favourite "House with the Windows That Laugh"(1976).

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere , strikes him and then runs him over with the speedo. This film should never have made it to the big screen, I can't imagine anyone who would be able to handle a plot that has so many ridiculous elements, but no more than you'd expect from a low budget movie.I had read some good reviews of this film, however I thought it was about as bad as "The Last House on the Left".

Then again, I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, sweet, fresh, and such a joy to watch. I have to alter just about everything she makes as I am a vegetarian...but it's great to see her with a program that shows more of her personality. After all, she is a television personality. I think it's cool that she is so inviting with her fans and still appears to be down-to-earth. The studio audience appears to be rather small, but that just makes for a cozier environment. Some people have posted that the show sucks.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. We'll be seeing more of them in the near future. One thing to remember about the film's creators is that you don't need to know anything about French politics, history, sociology, or literature to appreciate this film. That said, one very interesting fact I picked up from Goethe is that the original title was Le Fauchon (The Fish). There's also a whole other set of characters, with different titles and plots as well.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I 'm dying to have another viewing! This film is just plain offensive. If you don't know what it is, just imagine an old fart yelling at some little children who are trying to play outside in the backyard. This man (or woman) would tell them that God doesn't exist, that they're all stupid and worthless and he can take care of it. He's also a big homophobe and wants to force people to love each other as he does.

Chucky (the murderous doll from "Child's Play" and 2 crappy sequels) is dead. But his ex-girlfriend Tiffany (Jennifer Tilly) gets his remains and (using "Voodoo for Dummies") revives him. Then, through circumstances too convoluted to get into, SHE is killed and has her soul put into another doll! Together they fall in love and kidnap a nice couple (Nick Stabile, Katherine Heigl) to take them to Chuck's coffin to get an amulet to make Chucky and Tiffany real people again...A lot better than it sounds.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it. It's one of the best "teenager" horror films I've ever seen; and that's saying a lot. Nothing is left without an explanation to back it up, the characters and plot break countless horror movie stereotypes, and it has got nothing to do with some other horrible pieces we've been submitted to lately. (A clear example is the mindless "Saint Ange".) The first 30-40 minutes might be downright boring with the exception of the beginning, although some minor light mistakes can be easily spotted.

Let me clarify that. This is not a "good movie", but I am so glad it is out there, I am so glad I saw it, and for the role that it plays in my DVD collection, it is sublime. It is the ultimate PG-13 romp, it is college as we imagine it will be when we're freshmen in high school, it requires so much suspension of disbelief that it may as well be taking place on Mars. It is so wholesome that even when it tries to be dirty it wouldn't make your grandmother uncomfortable.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . I thought it was a waste of time to watch him in something like this. He does not do a good job in this movie . The acting is poor and the plot does not add anything at all to the story . This movie is nothing special , it is an action movie with no plot . A bunch of guys are stranded on an island and have to get out of there. They find an ancient temple, but can they make their way to the inner sanctum?

This version of `` The Lost Horizon '' is actually not a bad film at all . I think the director tried to go back to the original movie but was unsuccessful. For the uninitiated (like me) here's how this "comedy" works: an eccentric scientist and his young prot√©g√©e travel in search of the legendary Lost Horizon, an island rumored to be under the water somewhere in the Pacific ocean. As you might imagine, there isn't much going on as they spend most of the time doing absolutely nothing. But it's entertaining for a couple of reasons.

Based on a William Faulkner short story , Two Soldiers is a top notch short film , a movie that I am sure was intended as a comedy, or at the very least to make people laugh. My son and I have just returned from a three-week vacation to Greece, and when we got back home, our first stop was to visit my father-in-law in the hospital. We went through the motions of going out to dinner, and then he started making fun of my hair. He kept referring to it with an air of disdain.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the opening credits. I could see why they did this, there was a lot of action in the movie but not nearly as much as other Hollywood action flicks like Die Hard or Lethal Weapon. I was expecting something that would challenge me to find it's way back to the theater over and over again. Instead I came out empty handed after an average viewing of just over 30 minutes. That's about half of what I expected to see.

When his elderly mother Emily (Jeanne Bates) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier (Brion James) and turns into a cannibalistic monster, TV news reporter Clay Dwyer (Mark Thomas Miller) struggles to keep dear old mom from satisfying her hunger.Although the above plot summary conjures up images of trashy, over-the-top, 80s horror titles such as Flesheating Mothers and Rabid Grannies, Mom actually turns out to be a refreshingly original take on the werewolf/vampire/zombie mythos (exactly what Emily becomes is never really clear, but it ain't nice!

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect father, Louis Kahn, dead since 1974. The film builds slowly, but perfectly, and what starts out as a seemingly lost fortysomething's identity crisis unfolds into a beautiful tale with much deeper meaning with regard to the importance of love, loss, family and perhaps more importantly, our life's work.I had never heard of Louis Kahn prior to this film, although I was vaguely familiar with some of his work.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a bucket load of gore lead to him earning the title 'The Godfather of Gore'. While Don't Torture a Duckling was made before Fulci became well known amongst gorehounds, and isn't all that gory; it's certainly a gritty and nasty little thriller, and for my money - the best film that Fulci ever made! Don't Torture a Duckling really is head and shoulders above a lot of the Giallo genre in terms of production values and unlike many of Fulci's later films, everything about this Giallo is great.

Great movie. Post-apocalyptic films kick ass. This one is no exception. Kept up the pace and interest without a speck of dialogue (mainly through some good character development). The fight between Reno and the Hero was tight. I also liked the use of cave paintings and medieval-like weapons to show how primitive and savage mankind had become without their technology and guzzaline. The connection between the beginning and end was a little spacey, that is, I had a hard time understanding the distances between the hotel and the opening sequence.

Always enjoyed `` DOA '' ,1950 , which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film . Dennis Hopper had a nice performance, but in my opinion he could of done much better. The first time I heard the title "D.O.A. ", I was immediately enthralled with it. It is an awesome movie from start to finish and I would highly recommend anyone to see it. The acting was top notch as well as the plot and story lines. But the worst part of the entire movie was that it just took away all the enjoyment out of the movie.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC. I've been looking for it ever since. It was haunting: visual, textural, sensual. This movie took me somewhere like a dream and I didn't care where. I will never forget the curtain blowing in the breeze. I still remember the way it made me tilt my head. I remember my facial expression when I saw it. I didn't know what had happened when the movie was over, but I find life is that way. It didn't bother me.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime . This was the kind of movie that you could watch when you wanted to forget about your problems and have a good time. I watched this with some friends and had a great time.The storyline is not very interesting, there is no real mystery to the murders but the main character is extremely creepy. The cinematography is superb, especially during the scene where the killer takes his revenge. I think this has been one of the most underrated horror movies in all of the horror genre.

The Aristocats is really quite charming, and is rated far too low on IMDb. The songs aren't as memorable as the ones in the Jungle Book, but they weren't bad at all. The animation is really lovely, the best sequence being the landscape of Paris in general. It looked beautiful. This is probably Disney's most relaxing animation I think, and as another reviewer quite rightly said, who doesn't love cats? Another great piece of animation was O' Malley looking into Duchess's eyes, as their romance was so believable while not obvious.

I just saw this film and I recommend it . It has a very good plot , it holds your attention for the most part and the performances are very convincing . This film is very dark and depressing. Not to mention that there are some graphic scenes that you won't want to end your day with, even if you are a fan of horror genre . If you like horror films you will love this. There are some really cool ideas at work here, though they can be hard to follow. The basic premise is great, but the execution is a little off.

`` Live Together , Die Alone '' is divided into three main story lines , and each one of them tells a different type of story (romantic, comedic, historical, horror etc.). So far i am not very impressed by these stories but i think that this movie has some good points in order to be interesting. The director tries to create something original with the characters which are based on ordinary people and he does it quite well as his films always are. I especially liked the comedy in this movie.

This is Christmas time ! A nativity in terms of rebirth , or at least this is what can be read into the image. This is obviously an allegorical representation of Jesus ' birth . I agree with the reviewers on this one, this film lacks all the subtlety and wit of the original. I think there is a very strong plot here that involves some major issues. I have to say though, the acting was not bad either. There are many people involved in this film and I believe it's fairly well done for a low budget film.

I would say 'Bride of Chucky ' is a `` return to greatness '' but the series was never really great. If you're looking for a scary movie, then there's no better movie than 'Chucky,' but unfortunately it is not one that I want to watch over and over again. I mean, look at this thing! You've got a kid being possessed by a demon, his best friend's mom is trying to kill them and the whole damn place is crawling with hellspawn. Not exactly a recipe for your nightmares.

NOBODY ( 1999 ) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir . It 's about three salarymen who get in trouble when their boss starts making off with their bonus money. I haven't seen this yet. I read the reviews here and had some reservations, but after watching the first 3 minutes I didn't care anymore. I'm sure that most people will be underwhelmed, too.The action scenes are extremely slow, and the plot twists are weak at best. The lead character is also a bit annoying, especially because of her short temper. And the music sucks.

This little film is hysterical, full of stereotypes about gays, straights, dwarfs, British tea and pubs, American gun culture, divorce and marriage; yet, it manages to be sensitive to the issues surrounding each. Kathy Bates is "Amazing" Grace Beasley, and as a character actor of staggering range, she brings her considerable comedic talent to ground this somewhat unusual film as she did in Fried Green Tomatos. With the help of other comedic talents like Dan Akroid as Max, her ex-lawyer husband and the backdrop of downtown Chicago and rural England, the story is just intriguing enough to entertain.

I'm not going to go into too much depth, but Showtime was a pretty funny movie. There wasn't any slapping-your-knee funny scenes (that I can remember), but it had it's moments. The cast is pretty good, Robert De Niro is good as usual and Eddie Murphy pulls off a pretty funny performance. Rene Russo was just fine in the film, no complaints there. There were two characters in the story that I liked that they didn't explain much at all. The first one was Trey Sellars' (Eddie Murphy's) buddy at the gym played by Ken Campbell.

Easily Lucio Fulci 's most respected film , `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is highly renowned for it's disturbing subject matter and dark atmosphere, but this movie has none of that. It's the complete opposite, if you can believe it.Let me explain. I think there are only two reasons why an American audience would ever see this kind of movie: 1) to be entertained 2) because they want to see someone die horribly or go through some horrible trauma. I never saw any of these films until recently, so forgive me if I'm wrong.

Coming from the "druggie" generation, I thought this movie was hilarious. It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde up-to-date, so to speak. My husband and I laughed all the way through it. Would love to have the movie in my collection. I told my two teenagers about the movie and they would love to see it. They aren't into drugs but they know enough about them to understand the comedy in the movie. It's been so long since I've seen it I can't remember but a few things.

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian-film-lovers. What happened? It was horrible! I have never seen an Indian film so badly made. I felt sick from what I heard. There are two or three scenes where I did not feel like I was watching someone else's work, they were clearly lifted out of the movies of Steven Soderbergh, David Lynch, Francis Ford Coppola, Robert Altman, Brian De Palma, etc. It is sad to say that this movie just doesn't make any sense whatsoever.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David . I can't believe that I went to see this crap. The movie was completely ridiculous. At first I thought they were actually trying to make it funny by having lots of fart jokes in there, then I realized that they were just making the film as silly as possible. The only reason I had to come out to see this was because my friends told me it was coming out, so I'm gonna give it a miss.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I've seen in a very long time. Granted I spent much of the first half an hour wondering what the hell was going on but once I had accepted that I would never understand everything from the subtitles I was able to enjoy the film.Can you really hate a film where a staff turns into a flock of birds that defecate over the enemy? What does character development matter when faced with a lesbian alien princess whose people built the pyramids? Why does Buddha wear seriously blinging diamond earrings?

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply. I've been looking for this movie on DVD for a while and VHS for years. One can get all sorts of movies on line...old movies, new movies... but it all targets a particular group. This movie is very nostalgic for many. I'm not sure why I can't get a copy. Maybe if enough people will write in, the copyright holder will get a clue. It's about time for this to happen. Yes, it's date, but so is The Wizard of OZ.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was. I was looking forward to it after reading the plot (even though I find Nirvana overrated). It sounded like it would be tons of fun but it was more than that. Jansen puts in little touches like the books (Kubrick book among others), movie posters, etc. I like when I see a director takes his time and put his heart into a film. And you can really feel that in this.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up, many people began to get excited about seeing it... really excited. Who could blame them, it looked like fun. But that's exactly the thing. People went into Accepted looking for a good movie, but if you think about it, Accepted isn't the type of film destined to be a good movie. It's meant to be a film that pleases its crowd without too much effort being given. That being said, for those of you who expected a great film, you need to think about what could be made of a comedy like this one.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character, unable to speak, living in a world incompatible with modern life. He trusts to his homemade weaponry - helmet, sleeves, and spear - made out of hubcaps, seat cushions, and discarded office furniture. Just as Don Quixote rode Rocicante, "The Man" rides his contraption (literally) transcending the lost lives caught up the harsh and demeaning modern world - soaring above the earth, away from the plight of modern man. Both characters ride in search of adventure in an effort to right the wrongs of the world.

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary ( a lot ) - but he is funny ! He is so funny i cant describe it. He plays with children and scares them. The first time I saw it was when it came out in the UK as "Curse of the Cat People." I was absolutely disappointed. It's a very silly horror-adventure movie that doesn't come off particularly well, at least not on the surface level.But then, you start poking around. There's a reason why the film has remained popular for so long.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters. I had never heard of it when it appeared on cable. After the first shock of realizing this is not like any other movie you have seen since Bringing Up Baby you have to let it sweep you along and run with it. Not until it's over do you realize it covers issues that are not only subtle but significant. Alienation, denial, wish-fulfillment, for a start. Cathy Bates owns this movie, she's never been better.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G: The Next Generation'. In fact I can not believe this could have been produced without Michael Jackson's input. I've been a fan of the original since it aired in 1980, which made me curious as to what new features the "modernized" Ali G was gonna bring to the party. Well, it took about two minutes of my life and thousands of dollars into my bank account to realize that the remake is nothing more than yet another rehash of the old show.

This is sweet . The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira in Gremlins 2, and it's weird to think that two different actors can have such similar voices. This movie also suffers from a lack of direction. There are too many things that just aren't explained very well. So I've always heard people say this film is terrible because it takes place in an American hospital, and since it's not set in Europe or Japan it doesn't belong here. That's all fine and well but then why didn't they use any English on this one?

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO , regardless of the age of the OAV . The plot is far from original, although it does attempt to keep the audience on the edge of their seats for a couple of scenes. It's hard to say whether this movie is a good idea or not. On the one side, if someone can't tell that the story they are about to see is a fake, I think that's a really bad idea. On the other side, though, if someone says "This movie looks so bad...", you should listen to them.

Just as in `` Columbo '' we see the fatality occur right at the beginning . What follows is an extremely slow-moving and dull series of events where the detectives are forced to work through a mountain of evidence to determine who killed the young girl. I have to say, I don't give a rat's rear end who made this film! My problem was with my friends who went to see it! I didn't find anything entertaining about it! The only thing that really bothered me was the lack of action/horror scenes.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce, direct, finance and/or star in their own films who might otherwise not have been able to? Is that a good thing? This film does not answer the latter question either way, but it does appear that without Curb, Jeff Garlin would not have been able to make I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With. Like most new producers/directors, Jeff Garlin's independent piece heaves a heavily more sensitive sigh than the vehicle he is primarily known for (Curb).

It's Showtime! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro's careers. It's an entertaining movie and a guilty pleasure but not quite up to the actors' standards, especially not Robert's. Showtime is directed by Tom Dey and features some small roles from guys like William Shatner and Mos Def.Showtime is about two very different cops, Mitch Preston (DeNiro) and Trey Sellars (Murphy). One takes work seriously in a low profile, quiet manner while the other is more easy-going and wants to have more fun than felons in his back seat.

I have to offset all the terrible comments . I love this movie . I own the movie and the soundtrack. I loved it . It is the worst movie ever . It ruined me . This is what you get when you watch a lot of action movies , where they try to make up for their lack of acting with CGI and special effects. This movie tries to be very realistic, yet fails miserably . My friend has a copy of this so i decided to give it a chance. So far I'm disappointed. The premise is alright but that's it.

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age in an airplane crash. He wasn't in the old rock 'n roll class of , let's say, Chuck Berry or Jerry Lee Lewis, but he wasn't far behind. Who knows how big his legacy would have been had he sang for decades. Almost every single he put out was a hit.So, I was very pleasantly surprised how good a job Gary Busey did at playing him and at imitating his singing voice.

In Nordestina , a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco , Ant√¥nio ( Gustavo Falc√£o ) is the owner of a small dairy farm. One morning, he sends his son Pedro ( Carlos Azevedo ) into the forest to catch an animal. However, the farmer has forgotten to tell him about his last night, and the family comes back with nothing. Meanwhile, some locals have found out about this event, and decide that they must go there to find what happened.After a brief introduction, the film starts shooting... This is a very entertaining movie.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it . It is just not available in a good state of repair . I am surprised the studios haven't seen this and taken steps to remedy this situation. If you love action thrillers, then this is the movie for you. If you are one of those horror/thriller/action junkies then you probably shouldn't watch this. The pacing is horrendous, there is no tension, no suspense, no story line.The characters are generic, boring, predictable and flat. The actors are bad at their jobs.

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of the origins and history of the Vikings. The only flaw I had, was that some scenes just seemed very out of place. Still though, if you're looking to learn a bit more about Norse Mythology, then this is a great way to start!Read full review >
This movie has all the potential to do well, but it fails miserably. There are some interesting ideas, and some good acting, but the film lacks anything truly original or worth seeing.

This Oscar-winning short film ( 40 minutes ) , based on a short story by William Faulkner , takes us through the lives and struggles of a group of African Americans living in Louisiana during World War II. The first thing is that it's absolutely terrible. There's no other word for it--it's just bad. Bad movies have a habit of making me feel good about my life, like I'm participating in some sort of noble struggle. And even better, when I see a truly awful movie, I want to help people. But this movie has none of that.

Another go round with the monkey king going west .... sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie starts to drag and I can hardly get through any of it as it just keeps getting worse.In my opinion this film is nothing but an excuse to take some random people and make them look crazy, even if that means making them look ridiculous.If you are not a fan of silly movies then stop watching it right now.There is nothing interesting about it at all and I would have thought that the makers of this film would know better since they are from Hollywood.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen . Clearly not that many because it only has a cult following. It's a spoof on modern family films such as How The Grinch Stole Christmas (1985) and even more recent films like A Very British Coup (1995). I was lucky enough to see this in a Cineplex movie theatre over the holidays. I really wish they hadn't put this out in theatres. This was a poor excuse for a family film. My husband and I sat through almost two hours of non-stop cringe worthy jokes.

No . I 'm not kidding with this one . He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave some good feedback to the show. So if anyone reading this is in the Seattle area, it is highly recommended that you check this guy out and see what his opinions are on the show.I'm sorry that I am writing this but...this was one of the dumbest reviews I have ever read. What happened to "Reviewers Beware"? It's like watching your childhood dream come to life all over again. It's like when you're a kid and someone gives you a brand new toy.

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then do n't watch this film. It's all very slow and drawn out. This movie has some great moments but it is not really a good movie. The story is weak, the plot is weak, the acting bad, the direction is bad, there is no sense of excitement in what is supposed to be an action flick, the music is just annoying. I was hoping they could have pulled off something cool or at least created a believable world with lots of characters for the movie to take place within.

In Tweety 's S.O.S , Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that carries him off to some Caribbean island. Here, he becomes the stewardess and is then forced to work with her. This film is one of my worst experiences ever. I was 13 when this happened and I am ashamed to say that I actually enjoyed watching it (even though I had not paid for it yet) as a child. I have no recollection of ever seeing such a poor movie until years after. The acting was awful. The script was atrocious.

probably the best horror movie in 5 years .. there 's been lame remakes , attempts to make you scared out of your pants. I mean, what are the chances that this movie could have been even close to half a year earlier? I actually bought this on video because I am not a huge horror fan and don't see the appeal in it. The movie is about a girl who is taken to a haunted mansion by her friend (Amber). A couple of ghosts appear to attack them at every turn.

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best one of them. It's not just a bad episode, but I can't recall any other episode that could even be considered a "bad episode" as it is here. While the premise itself sounds good enough, the execution falls short of the potential and the story itself fails to deliver. I watched this film in the first 10 minutes. And I hated it. For starters, there was no dialog. We are presented with nothing more than a scene of a man and his dog playing together.

The movie is incredible, it has a sound track which sets the tone for the movie. THe lines in the movie are great, such as "Nothings to good for out friends" and "Its collection time Charlie collection time." I can watch this movie over and over again and still laugh because the lines and action are one of a kind. I feel that when i watch this movie I want to go out and shoot down bad guys, If there is a movie that you don't want to miss its this one.

Blind Spot 's images are great . The action draws you in completely , even though the movie is a B-movie, which isn't much to ask from a director who has directed dozens of low-budget films. What I can't believe is that he was allowed to direct this flick. He clearly had absolutely no idea what he was doing and never once considered making the film any better.The acting is good, with a few exceptions. I watched this movie last month at the festival, and there's one thing I learned after watching it.

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it. Since then I've searched for a video but never found it until now, 33 years later, when I ordered it from Moviehunter. Sorry to say it doesn't hold up. This glamourized version just can't rise up to the 1937 production level. I love Burt Bacharach's musical score, that is if listend to by itself, and I even bought a CD of it, but for my taste it doesn't lend itself well to this mysterious and compelling story. Just doesn't fit.

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been great ) but it was certainly fun and very informative. They showed us how to make homemade sauces such as garlic sauce and hot sauce . We came by this store to purchase some of the items that we wanted for gifts for our grandchildren, so that they could enjoy them even if they are not in the immediate family. Although we were able to find each item that we wanted at this store, with the exception of the Christmas tree, we were unable to return any of the items.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . There is little in the way of suspense and no sense of urgency. It's just a waste of a good story. As I said in my preview , this film is bad enough as it is without having to add something extra. If you're looking for an idea for a horror movie, or if you're looking for some inspiration for your own creative work, look no further than Death Wish III.

Chucky ( the murderous doll from `` Child 's Play '' and 2 crappy sequels ) is dead . But he can't die in a movie without leaving a nasty taste in the mouths of his fans. With this film you can tell that it was put together by two idiots with no clue as to how to write a story or plot. A group of girls decide to kill themselves because they think they're really ugly. No one believes them, but none of them wants to be around them. "Cult of Chucky" is what happens when people make a film out of things they don't even like.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances : Sanders , Patrick , and Blackmer . The scenes between the three of them are very believable. I don't care what anyone says about this movie, it's just not very good. It doesn't take long to figure out that most of the plot lines are made up by the characters. Not only that, all of the supporting characters (the police, the judge, the prosecutor, etc.) are portrayed in such a way that you can easily identify them as "not credible".

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance, a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - and beautiful scenery. Nicholas Cage never fails us, and here again does a great job. And so do the other principle characters. One key charater, the physician/father played by John Hurd, delivers (to his daughter) one of the best definitions of love I've ever heard. Some of the events are a bit too coincidental to be real, but I excused that, knowing that this is partly fairy tale and fantacy. My wife and I really liked the film.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative, but I loved this movie. I am a student of Asian art with a particular love of Korean art, culture and history. I thought this movie borough a very controversial and interesting character to life. Jang Seung-up is one of the (maybe the most) famous Korean artist and continues to be revered as a master. Given the tumult of the time in which he painted and his own conflicted nature, it is amazing that he produced so much work, in so many styles and with such skill.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one ! I watched him in 'Shawshank Redemption' after years of waiting for the right time to make a film. In my humble opinion he made the best film that was ever made. He managed to make an excellent drama and an absolutely fantastic comedy (The Shawshank Redemption is not only funny but a masterpiece ) without resorting to bad acting, terrible plot or boring cinematography. I'm always curious about what people are saying about any given movie. With this exception, it doesn't look like much of a "movie."

This is a funny movie . The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but I have my doubts. It is funny but it is also very sad. I was looking forward to seeing "The Bob & Eddie Show" since the TV series was so good. Well, this has nothing to do with the TV series. The plot is lame, the dialogue is laughable, and the acting is poor. If you enjoy watching old movies, especially ones that are made for TV, then this may interest you.If you don't, then by all means skip this one.

I can not say this movie was a hilarious, but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. I like this darker kind of comedy; "very bad things", "8 heads in a duffel bag" or "coldblooded"The way the main character tries to get away with murder is a lot of fun to watch. To me it was not much of a surprise what the ending would be, but the way that ending came about was. Another thing that sticks out, is the way they have managed to involve the audience.

That's right. Ohwon (the painter and the main character) is an exceptional person. What strikes me most is the message this film might address to all of you people there. And the message is sad. It says that, it's very difficult to do anything that's amazing or maybe even genius without having to obey the governments, establishment and other VIPs of this world. And even if you try, you might not be able to bear it. It is about the battle of a single person with a system. With many systems.A great film of this wonderful Korean director.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time. Top 20 of my lifetime. I laughed more than I have since Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and cried more than I have since I saw The Notebook. If you are looking for a touching movie without the sappy edge...this is the one. It is real and powerful. See it and you won't regret it. I was reluctant at first and I only watched it because I had to do a school project about speech disabilities. But this movie is so much more than that.

Very touching film , a great surprise to come up from Brazil , a country that usually exports features about drug abuse and murders . It was the only film I could watch in a few days (I don't do that much online ) and it still got me talking. The acting was good , the script is not as clever as i expected , but at least it wasn't so cheesy that I had to throw it away. If you are looking for a realistic movie , this may be for you, but if you want a thriller , then stick to your B movies .

The show start out with the boat . Desmond was i it . Then they went to try to save the boy. But, he was killed ! For those that don't know, "Boys Don't Cry" is an American action comedy film from the 1980s about a group of teenage boys who go off to sea to search for a kidnapped girl. In this film, however, the boys never find the girl and are forced to re-enact the event by going back to the beach where the kidnapper's body was found.

Gary Busey 's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography . Since had a musical background , he was able to convey all his emotions on the page. He gives us a very good look into the early days of Sam and Dean's relationship.Busey's character is very relatable. We get to understand him more and more throughout the book as he struggles to learn how to trust people, how to live without Dean, and himself. It's extremely interesting to follow the development of these characters from when they're boys through the time they become full-fledged heroes.

I thought this movie was pretty good ! OK , so maybe it had a few scenes that could make you think that it was trying something new, but overall . it didn't live up to all my expectations. I really enjoyed this show, and was looking forward to seeing it again after being disappointed at how the second season (the one that I saw) did not go far enough for me. And boy oh boy, did it disappoint! Not only was the character development lacking, the acting was so bad that it seemed almost like there were actors watching from the audience.

Is this a good movie ? It 's hard to say -- but in 1953 , for many people , it must have seemed like the best thing that happened since the invention of soap operas. It has all the hallmarks of a bad movie, if you ask me. If I was a teenager who wanted to see a comedy about a poor boy growing up in an Italian neighborhood, I probably would have made some kind of comment about how awful it looks.The plot is extremely contrived, and the whole thing is completely devoid of humor.

Yes , at times `` Unconditional Love '' overwhelms as it bounces -- no , as it ricochets -- from one mood to the next. Unconditional Love (1972) - I found this film in an older DVD box with a bunch of titles, and decided to just watch it. I'm not sure if this was a mistake or what, but there is absolutely nothing that could have been done to make it any more tolerable. The scriptwriters are clearly trying to use humor to make fun of some very serious topics.The film is set in the early 1970's in Seattle, Washington.

Let's be fair: there are no RULES for scriptwriting, so I won't say the movie SHOULD be something other than it is. I'll just state my opinion. OK, I really liked the script, the way things are told and characters are introduced. However, I think when a play is adapted to the silver screen, it could maybe try and fit this other media. Since this movie was directed by Jo√£o Falc√£o, the same man who directed the play, it's not too much of a surprise that the film turned out a bit too theatrical.

A very weird , psychedelic , esoteric , ( and did I say weird ? : ) experience.But on at the end it does give hope to people who are victims of cults. It's hard to tell for certain, but if you know what you're getting into, then you might find this to be an interesting film. The premise is interesting - we get to see just how a small "cult" would go about recruiting new members. It gets rather ridiculous pretty quickly as they attempt to convince a young couple that joining them has some sort of spiritual benefits.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly ( 1936-59 ) . He does have a little bit of acting chops in his repertoire. But he has no charisma whatsoever. I am not sure who this John Cusack character is supposed to be. Yes, I understand there is some historical significance to his life (even if it is fictional), but beyond that? It doesn't even sound like him. When I was a kid watching old episodes of SNL I thought it was very funny when they would do different characters from each other.

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war. The rain, the mud, the explosions - all these things are present but Chaplin seems strangely oblivious to them all. He's in France for one thing: to fight the Germans, something he does with unbelievable success.It almost seems like an extended ego trip for Chaplin - a very funny one, at that - until the final minute when it rises to a new level of poignancy and everything makes sense.Perhaps it's what all soldiers dream of before the go to war.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life , the action was great , and i had a lot of fun watching it , but i hated the end. I loved this film from the first minute I watched it, but I didn't really like it until about 20 minutes in. At that point I began to feel as though I was watching an episode of "The Twilight Zone", or perhaps some sort of science fiction/horror series. Not that these are bad films by any stretch of the imagination, quite the contrary.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature . Faulkner mostly wrote about the South. But there's so much more to be learned about the lives of the Southern whites from this great writer and his book, "The River." This movie is just plain lame! There are so few interesting points to make that I am almost embarrassed to admit to buying it. This is definitely not a serious movie. The only reason anyone would have to see it is for the cheap laugh at the expense of the real people who were forced to live in such poor circumstances.

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't bad , but the plot doesn't hold your interest. In fact you can easily skip this movie for it's lame plot and characters . I've been to one of those kids movies where the kid gets sucked in by his/her crush , and the love story starts from there :-o
Okay, so I am a huge fan of the TV show "The Adventures of Superheroes" as well as its spin-offs "Aquaman" & "Sharkticon."

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper , but no one he's friends with cared for him at all. He acted like nothing is happening to him, and in the end he just wanted to take revenge on someone that insulted him. But I found the whole character extremely annoying, and it got really irritating when he would talk to himself . It's like he's trying too hard to come up with some good rap name. I have watched this movie about 3 times now. Its a bad movie.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful reputation as the "Godfather Of Gore". Fulci's absolute greatest film, however, dates back to 1972 and, while it is definitely gritty and violent, it is not nearly as gory as many of his other films. "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" aka. "Don't Torture A Duckling" of 1972 is not only by far Fulci's greatest film, this tantalizing and utterly brilliant Giallo is one of the absolute highlights of the genre.

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television ( RTL7 , around 1800hrs ) and I still watch it at least three times weekly. I've never been able to grasp why the producers of this TV series decided to portray a small country in such an unfriendly way. I have lived in Italy for over thirty years, so I always had the opportunity to see many different types of culture, but in this case you can't really judge any kind of people by how they act when abroad. I read somewhere that this show is like "America's Next Top Model" without the reality factor.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the title hero into something less than worthy. I'm not sure what is so special about this film that it warrants another viewing, but I can guarantee you that if you have to see it again, it won't be at all worth your time and energy. Let's just look at some of the other reviews here on IMDB; "the worst movie I've ever seen in my life....and I've been watching movies for 45 years".

( Some spoilers included : ) Although , many commentators have called this film surreal , the term fits poorly here . I think a more appropriate word for "strange and beautiful" would be strange and disturbing . The story is very odd. What we are shown is quite literally a train crash, so there are some scenes in which there is no sound at all. The main character (played by Daniel Ritchie) appears to be acting as if he is awake, but in reality he is totally out of it. It is like he is having a schizophrenic experience.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it. It is just not available and it has not been on TV for many many years. I enjoyed it and the songs because it had something different to say and made you think how every person looks at something from different prespectives. Also we often don't appreciate something we have till it is no longer there.My 12 year old daughter just discoverd the music and is entranced with some of the songs. Someday I hope to get a copy of the film so she can have an opportunity to view it.

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I , which gave us Werner Herzog 's `` Lessons of Darkness ", in which an American soldier stumbles back into his homeland only to find it under Nazi occupation. I just finished watching all four parts of this series and have to tell you that my expectations were completely off. I wasn't prepared for what I got. One of the main reasons that I've always disliked British TV dramas is that they often leave me wanting more. In this instance, however, I would consider myself lucky.

First of all , around the time I wrote this comment , I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written on that page , and I can assure you , he was wrong about everything . There's no way in hell that a kittiwake is anything close to a rattlesnake . They're more than 50 feet wide at the widest point and, even if they were, their fangs don't measure longer than a quarter of an inch . I saw this movie as a teen and have always been interested in snakes. I remember seeing one in some old horror film from the 50's called Snakeman which was very cool.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy ( Garlin ) wandering around Chicago with a girl ( Rosie Perez ) who he has a crush on. He falls in love with her but she doesn't seem to like him. She keeps trying to make him jealous, and even tries to break up with him. I thought this was one of the most boring and predictable films ever. It's not just because there are really not much plot twists or anything interesting happening at all.The film is based on a book by David Drake which is pretty good, but not exactly compelling.

I do n't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch, so picked this one up hoping for something that would entertain me for a while.The film centers on a young man named John who runs away from home in search of his missing father (played by the late Jack Nicholson). The plot is convoluted and rather predictable. You know exactly what's going to happen when it finally happens. But there is no need to worry, as the story unfolds in an entertaining and creative manner. You could call this a bad movie.

"Caribe" is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects. However, it delivers a perfectly enjoyable story, along with a magnificent cinematography. The narrative structure is set around two narrative axes, one of them embedding the other, each one having elements that relate and co-exist in excellent harmony. The story never loses the right pacing, and it shows a very good blending of the human figure with its natural environment (which is a character in itself). The acting is great, and for that we owe credit to the emerging director, Esteban Ram√≠rez.

This is a stunning movie . Raw and sublimely moving . It felt like a very gripping , intelligent stage play. The acting was superb and I was amazed at the sheer range of characterisation in such an ensemble cast. I would love to hear someone actually explain why this film is terrible. Why, for example, would a person ever think it was appropriate to show a child as a victim in a rape case? When you've been raped by your stepfather do you take him to court? You don't. And neither should you be able to get away with showing a woman getting raped.

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow . It accomplished this through the energetic performances of each of the cast and the excellent editing. The plot is extremely predictable, but not boring by any stretch. There is some great acting throughout the film.The music is quite good though it should be noted that it is a bit over the top when compared to the action scenes. This film is one of those rare pieces of cinema that will have you turning the pages in your book or DVD player looking forward to seeing what comes next!

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something, and who appreciate a farce that is clever enough for you to take it seriously, this movie will surprise you. It is not a 'whodunit' for people who can't aren't able to follow the verbal exchange of our hero, Professor Dexter Cornell (Dennis Quaid).Cornell teaches in Southern California, near the tar pits. He has not published a novel in four years, his wife is divorcing him, he drinks a bit much, and is blessed or cursed with caustic wit, which he freely dispenses to his students.

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series was coming to a close and the group was near break up. Their inventive and comedic series (sort of an American Idol of their day) took four unknown actors and formed a manufactured supergroup around them.This is their take on their "manufactured image" and status as the 2nd tier Beatles. They always felt they were in a box, trapped, and unable to find credibility despite their talents.It is also a hell of a musical-trippy, inventive (I have the soundtrack) and full of surprises.See it with an open mind.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie. It follows all the rules. Short scenes, to the point, cheap to shoot, guerilla-film-making, no sets (just disused buildings) and possibly an empty hospital wing. Also, even the black&white film-stock was a stroke of genius, probably selected more for its low expense rather than film effect, but it worked.Reno was amazing as the Brute. Everyone's acting was brilliant. The plot was simple and effective and no flabby bits left to distract you.

Being American, I have not been exposed to this character before, which is good because some of you have been disappointed. I have nothing to compare it to. I have found no enjoyment in the mindless idiot humor in the American teen movies, and although this is a slightly similar type of humor, I couldn't stop laughing. I hardly ever laugh out loud at a movie. And usually a movie has a few funny parts for me, but this movie was funny from start to finish. My only disappointment was when it was over.

Separate LIES changed my life. Actually, the Q&A did.SPOILERS BELOW. Read only if you watch trailers or if you've already seen it:The Emily Watson character cheats on the Tom Wilkonson character. My first reaction to the puppy-dog-eyed Emily was "It's Over. Dump her. Bad riddance." For some reason, he stuck around. Not in a pathetic way. He just listened. And tried to accept her needs. At times he needed to leave. But he stuck by her and let her live her life.

"Showtime" falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying, and a little south of what I expected months ago when I first heard about Eddie Murphy and Robert Di Niro teaming up for a comedy. Overall, it was pretty good! As "real life" crime or cops go-- and plot, for that matter-- it is pretty illogical, but DUH--- this is a comedy. Also, while the special effects, chases, aerial shots, and skyscrapers blowing up were present but lower key than a Schwartzenegger movie, I found it a bit tiresome and overdone.

Without going into any details of a good...if a somewhat provocative...TV movie, there seems to be a consensus among the users that there is "no one to blame here".I disagree. Yes, the young male lover of Beverly D'Angelo, played by Rob Estes may be young and horny (and good looking) because he's not getting as much as he wants from mom, that doesn't mean, he can climb in bed and have sex with daughter. OK, he can use the excuse he just wanted to watch TV with her, but I don't buy it.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n ' roll . The young singer/songwriter had no clue what to do with his music except play it fast and loud. He was thrown into the wild and woolly world of "rock'n' roll" with no idea how to survive in it. This film was not even funny. I couldn't believe they put something like this together. Buddy Holly is supposed to be a hero, yet here he is getting his ass kicked by Elvis Presley! That's about as funny as it gets.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

I did n't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD . I knew it had a cult following, but thought that the plot would not be too far off from the Hollywood movies I was used to. And I was right about that. How do you make a terrible film worse? The first step seems obvious--make the actors sound as bad as their dialogue suggests. That's basically what director David Susskind did with his "horror comedy" Night of the Demon (1985), which he wrote and stars in.

As a film buff, I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny, sarcastic comments about this film (my favourite being Woody Allen's quip "If I had my life to live over again I wouldn't change anything ... except for seeing the musical remake of Lost Horizon"). Therefore I've never been able to watch it without smirking at the choreography/set/songs etc. Just recently I came across a widescreen DVD and watched it for the first time in years, along with a friend who had never heard of the film's reputation.

As with so many modern US films, there has to be a supernatural element to the plot, but if you just let that go, this is a tale with heaps of charm and a kindly heart cased in a crab shell.We are presented with a scene of a town in an economically depressed area struggling to find anything to be happy about. Beau Bridges' character is really up against it with a family on the increase, a nil bank balance and a brother-in-law who's sold out to a big business chain which he secretly hates, but in which he is willing to rub Beau's nose.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. When was the last time you could say you really enjoyed a movie? This movie has pace and keeps us moving in directions that may only exist in India. If you didn't want to visit India before this movie will surely make you want to visit it now. This movie has dancing girls, a chase scene, and the mafioso involved. But it has a lot more. Thanks, Bharatbala, for taking us on such a spirited and wonderful tale.

This film , winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 ( tied with P.T . Anderson for best film of the festival ), and being nominated for two Oscars (Best Original Screenplay, and Best Actor), is actually a piece of garbage.I have watched it twice, both times I felt no sense of excitement over the story, the performances were not believable, and the cinematography is bad. This movie is a waste of 20 minutes of your life that could be used to learn something about how to write or make movies.

Charles Chaplin 's 'Shoulder Arms ' of 1918 was his longest film to date , though , at just over two hours it wasn't very well done. I am so disappointed. I have seen this movie three times already, but everytime I try to see it on the big screen, I cannot watch it anymore. It's not that I do not want to see it again, I do. But after seeing it once in my life, I never wish to see it a third time. Not even if they are offering it as a gift.

That 's right . Ohwon ( the painter and the main character ) is an exceptional person . What strikes you , after watching the movie for a minute , is not only that he's really good , it seems like all his movies are really good . And we're talking about a man who produced some of the most beautiful and important paintings of this century ... It was supposed to be a great thriller. The movie was so terrible, even the acting was bad, I can't imagine anyone would actually get paid to act in such rubbish. The story didn't work.

This is a wonderful movie, and I still love it! It just so magical and it is fun for the whole family! I recommend it to people of all ages. I promise you will not be disappointed! The characters are always so engaging, so real, you will just love them!
