He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song , and now the terrific Justin Bieber is doing it too. this movie looked like it should have made $5 million, but it came close to making 1/3 of that for what it's worth. the only redeeming quality of this piece of crap were the acting. i cannot say enough bad words about these actors. they all seemed to enjoy their roles more than they could possibly give them credit for. if you want some good acting, go see an episode of "Buffy" and then see this film.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time . Then I bought the video and watched it countless times . I don't know why they didn't change it. This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen . The plot is a disaster . There is not a single moment that you could describe as a good moment. Even the most clich√©d jokes were not funny . And the acting was so horrible . This has got to take the title from the film. This is possibly the very worst film I have ever seen!

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot. Some dude named Gerald breaks his engagement to Kitty and runs off to Craven Castle in Scotland. After several months Kitty and her aunt venture off to Scottland. Arriving at Craven Castle Kitty finds that Gerald has aged and he has grown meaner. Gerald has certain rules for the castle(the rules have been the same for 200 years). Gerald does not want them to stay but, Kitty insist on staying by making excuses. One night her aunt catches a glimpse of the monster running across the hall.

What a surprise. A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor' only naughtier. Funny guy Tim Thomerson (who steals the show as Blinkin in Robin Hood-Men In Tights) is downright hilarious as the anal retentive Dr. Jekyll and the sex crazed Hyde. The one scene that is really funny is when Dr. Lanyon (Mark Blankfield) catches Jekyll in bed with his daughter and says: "how dare you take advantage of my innocent daughter." Jekyll replies, "but sir, I'm going ahead with the operation. "Lanyon replies back, "oh.

I wasn't expecting a great deal from this film, so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it and found it to be most noteworthy. It's noteworthiness is mainly due to the talent and appeal of it's star, John Garfield.Garfield plays Jack, a boxing star who is framed for murder. He must go on the run, and ends up out in the sticks with Gloria Dickson and the Dead End Kids. Here is offered a chance for redemption, yet will the past catch up with him yet? Garfield was an actor ahead of his peers.

I first saw "Signs of Life" on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation. It's a wonderfully written, ensemble production with terrific performances by Michael Lewis as Joey and Vincent D'Onofrio as his brother, Daryl. Arthur Kennedy, in one of his last roles, is also excellent as an aging shipbuilder whose family business is about to close. The rest of the cast which includes Beau Bridges, Kathy Bates and Mary-Louise Parker give remarkable clarity and substance to their characters.The direction is subtle and effective. I've watched this movie several times over the years and would very much recommend it.

I think it definitely is. The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should model their conversations after its dialogue. For example, the exchange between Paul Kersey(Bronson) and Ms. Kathryn Davis(Deborah Raffin) (more about this character later) is extremely clear and to the point: Ms. Davis says, "I hope you like chicken. It's the only thing I know how to make," to which Kersey deftly responds, "Chicken's good. I like chicken."

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful story of a man and a woman hungry for something more in their lives than they have at present. The chemistry between Lane and Gere is magical from the first scene in the film to their last embrace. The locations, beauty of their attraction for one another when it unfolds when they first meet, and the story that follows, and as they begin to know each other with the attraction they feel towards each other is real, is romance that is projected to an audience with tender care.

The best thing from the American Pie `` bakery . '' I found the humor and the plot to be very similar. The only difference was that there was more swearing in American Pie (which is expected of a PG film) and it also has more sex scenes. So you want to know why I'm giving this movie four out of five stars? Well, one: the acting was awful. Two: the soundtrack was lame. Three: there wasn't any good story whatsoever. Four: everything was filmed with a teleprompter. Five: I couldn't care less about the title.

"D.O.A" is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish. Dennis Quaid is at his caustic best; and Quaid is sadly one of the most underused talents in Hollywood. His then beau Meg Ryan also appears with him, but as is usually the case, doesn't really make much of an impact. The film is stylishly directed throughout, drawing on a number of influences to capture its 'seamy' feel. Would you credit that it's actually directed by two people? The answer is no. The whole thing is superbly slick, from its innovative camerawork to its unabashed use of black and white photography.

The "old dark house" sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the oldies to-day. Here is one that provides so very many suspicious characters you have to wonder how they will be able to tie up all the loose ends in the 6 reel running time.The Crooked Circle is a gang of counterfeiters and thieves who have decided to take revenge on Col. Walters (Berton Churchill) who has sent one of their ranks to prison. They decide he must die that very night. Meanwhile the Colonel's own group, The Sphinx Club, is determined to protect him at all costs.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious . Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull was a great character . I can't believe that anyone actually thinks this is funny. This is the worst movie I have ever seen, and I don't mean that it's bad or that it has anything to do with kids. It's just plain stupid. The plot of this movie revolves around a little girl named Molly who wants to be a warrior. So, she gets her dad to buy her a bunch of dolls, then goes out to fight imaginary goblins.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life, the action was great, and i was so scared, there was a lot of gore WHICH MADE It GREAT, i would see it 1,000 more times, and Paris Hilton, D*MN she fine in that movie. But anyway, i would recommend it to anybody, even kids(like me) Adults like it to. You would probably have nightmares at night though, but beside that, IT IS AWESOMe, I CANT STOP BRAGGING ABOUT IT.

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film. That's the way to go. Not only does the acting suck, there are moments that should not have happened. My first thought after watching it was "is this supposed to be real?". It is obviously made for TV. This is an extremely disappointing film. The script is so clich√©d and predictable, you can't help but laugh every time a new twist is thrown in your face.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

First off , I absolutely loved this movie . As a Billy Crystal fan , I must say that I'm a big fan of his work as well, but it was still nice to hear him sing some of his songs . What a waste of a perfectly good comedy script. The idea is great: an alcoholic husband and father gets drunk and loses control of his child(s). So the mother (Diane Lane) turns the tables on her abusive husband by becoming his full-time caregiver and disciplinarian. I think there were two movies in the 1980s that managed to have as bad a cast as this one.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall it is a very well-made B movie which has a good amount of laughs and a nice action scene. This was an interesting film to see, as I didn't know that it was based on the books by Stieg Larsson. But, after watching it for the first time, I found it rather boring and pointless. I'm not sure if I would recommend this film to anyone, although I can understand that those who want to see something new and different in a horror movie might find it quite interesting.

I think it definitely is . The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language could do no better than learn it. The narration is very interesting and well-written (although I would have preferred a bit more emotion in my narrator's voice), the characterizations are extremely realistic (even though this may sound trite, I believe that you should always try to portray each character with as much depth and humanity as you possibly can), the plot twists and turns are predictable (especially the ending), but still highly entertaining and suspenseful for the first couple of episodes.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

I always liked this movie , I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it : )
I think this is one of the worst movies that has ever been made. The characters, plot, direction and dialogue are all extremely contrived and lacking any substance whatsoever.There is no explanation why these people live like this, none at all, not even the slightest hint. They don't speak English, or if they do they don't sound anything like a person who spoke English in the 60's or 70's.

If you like who-dun-its , you will like this film , considered the best Italian detective story ( giallo ) that has been made by Italy . It is written and directed by Carlo Ponti, a very talented screenwriter.There is a great atmosphere of mystery in this movie , without being overly scary. If you like ghost stories , you won't be disappointed here . After reading several positive reviews from other viewers I had to finally give this film a shot. I didn't want to start with something so clich√©d, as it always seemed to be for all Italian films.

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series--my only detraction would be the somewhat jarring appearance of Mark Lenard as the Romulan Commander. My reasoning is this--if you were not around for the first run of this episode, then you know Mr. Lenard as Sarek, Spock's father. And for the 2nd generation Trekkie (or Trekker--your preference) it takes you out of the scene at first. Yet he's an excellent commander as well as opposite for our captain and this episode is strongly written and well-acted by all.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie . But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch because they are just so funny. I am surprised no one wrote a fanfic about this movie but I guess nobody has time to write fanfics about movies that you like and don't actually want to see, right? I'll give this movie some credit though, there are some pretty good jokes in it. The main problem is how the character development is handled. Most of them are forced and feel awkward coming from the writers.

This movie, based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt, is one of the best films I've seen on race relations in South Africa; a very good history lesson of the turmoil of 80's South Africa. I put it in on the scale of American History X as far as it's depiction of how a young man can get seduced by the Aryan doctrine and how the "certain" segments of the Christian church taught a false doctrine regarding race to justify an injustice.It's strong message of forgiveness and redemption, is one of rarity in films today.

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's been used to sell crappy action movies. He seems to be one of the few directors who is actually able to produce good art. This movie, though, does not fall in line with his earlier work. It doesn't make much sense and it just doesn't feel like a Fulci flick. I don't know what went on behind-the-scenes but there's no excuse for a movie this awful. There are only three or four real laughs in this movie.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an Italian Officer and a Greek Villager in an honourable story: "Captain Correli¬¥s Mandolin", just escapes me! Witness: a wobbly, inconsistent accent by Cage amid horrendous over-acting, with Cruz -- more adequately cast as a spoiled Latino opposite Johnny Depp in "Blow" -- in basically a repeat performance under the guise of a Greek nurse... ay, it was painful. But there were saving graces.The story itself is thrilling-to-tragic, and Cage does have some (-- redeeming, this is !--) musical ability.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC . I 've been looking for it ever since . It was a really interesting film, but I don't see myself watching it again . This one is even better than the first ( which I haven't seen ) . The actors are great and this one is very well done . Not too long into the movie , I couldn't figure out who was who in the cast ! I think that the writer and director should have put some sort of story line or plot into this movie.

I wonder why I haven't heard of this movie before. It's truly a magnificent comedy (I'd say farce, but it's too well acted and I'd hate to denigrate it's quality). A comedic character study about the travails of mid-life crises, the inequity for gays who can't have their long-time unions recognized, and the general differences of people who can't fit nicely into society, that pairs Kathy Bates and Rupert Everett to a wonderful effect. Forget Julia Roberts and Rupert; Kathy Bates and Rupert should do another movie together.

As far as I know I 've seen most of Lucio Fulci 's films , with the exception of some Italian movies which I am less familiar with.This is the only film that I really did not understand at all - even though I had already seen it twice (first in a theatre and again in the cinema)
I'd say this is one of the worst movies I ever sat through. It starts off pretty well enough, with a young boy and his older sister living in an old house that was once owned by a couple that lived there before they passed away.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat-- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had a Blockbuster coupon and passed on a string of new releases of violent Hollywood stuff. He was about to walk out when he saw this and decided to take a chance. There was only one copy -- and with some glitches in the DVD that we finally had to flip to wide screen version and then back to the full screen version to make it stop stalling. But it was worth it. Cathy Bates is so good and she was so perfect for the role.

I remember this film of old. It's a great, chilling, atmospheric horror picture about a man who moves into a Scottish castle, only to discover that there are strange goings-on in the corridors at night. And there are even stranger events taking place out back, in Hollywood's most familiar hedge maze. Yes, this is the maze you've seen in every feature-length film that ever involved a topiary puzzle, up to and including "The Shining." But the punchline to this story is about the last thing you would guess. I certainly didn't see it coming.

As I have said before, I am NOT a fan of Tweety. He's just so aggravating I wish Sylvester would just eat him and get it over with.In this cartoon Sly is homeless once again and is back to feeding out of garbage cans. He spots a cruise ship leaving port nearby and decides to hop aboard when he spys Tweety is one of the passengers. The ship provides an adequate stage for the following hijinks and Sly desperately tries to catch the annoying bird and avoid seasickness. If only for once he's succeed by chewing and swallowing, thus finishing of the irritating Canary forever.

Considering it 's basically low-budget cast , this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock musician Jimi Hendrix. So, you've just watched an episode of The Walking Dead (season 1), and you're looking to pick up a movie on your way to work. But instead of heading to the local IMAX theater like you should, you turn around and go to the video rental store instead. And when you finally do catch "The Devil's Advocate" at the video store, what do you think of?

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from! For once she was bang on! What a superb film! First of all I was convinced James McAvoy & Romola Garai were Irish so convincing were their accents; and by half way through the film I was utterly convinced Steven Robertson was a disabled actor and pretty sure James McAvoy was also! When I watched the special features on the DVD and saw both actors in their 'normal' guise, to say I was blown away would be an understatement!!!

Well , what 's wrong with the title `` Separate Lies '' ( accused elsewhere of not being `` exciting '' enough )? If you can't tell by now that this film is one big joke, you're not supposed to watch this movie--unless you're a fan of lowbrow B-grade humor.It starts out as a thriller about an ex-police detective who's been given a copy of a classified memo by a former employee. He then decides to investigate the source of the memo--who happens to be his ex-best friend--but soon finds himself on a trail of intrigue that eventually leads him down a dark path.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films , it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment . The story line is interesting, however i did feel as if there was not much of a point to the plot. It seems like the only goal this film had was to have some really good shots of the landscape. My rating: 1/10This movie has no logic whatsoever. I went into this movie thinking 'I'll be here for an hour or so, and maybe then I'll see what's going on' but in reality, we just sat through two hours of complete and utter pointless drivel.

Let me clarify that . This is not a `` good movie '' , but I am so glad it was made. The characters are well done, the story is quite interesting and suspenseful without being tedious or maudlin like so much contemporary horror. This movie will have you crying tears of laughter at least a dozen times in its first 40 minutes.The plot revolves around an elderly man's son who is taken away by the state because he has lost his marbles. He tries to help him along the way, and manages to get into some trouble along the way.

This is a funny movie. The Bob & Eddie Show feel of it could lead to a sequel but I doubt it will make enough money. Deniro proves he can be a great Straight man again with some hilarious and spontaneous moments. Eddie was fun to watch working with people instead of CGI animals and rodents. Rene Russo- well she's just fun to watch anyway and she's played her part excellent.Some wild and unusual stunts, especially the garbage truck scene. This was worth seeing in the theater. We needed a good laugh and got many from the movie and the great out-takes at the end.

`` Head '' is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968 . The acting is as good as can be expected from such an obscure and short production. "Head of the Turtle" is just about the most unfunny, over-the-top film I have ever seen. It features some very bad jokes - like the scene where a guy comes into a movie theater to see a "Wizard of OZ" concert and finds out there's not a live audience in the house (I was watching it with a couple of friends when they laughed their asses off).

**1/2 Elisha Cuthbert, Chad Michael Murray, Brian Van Holt, Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams. Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra.Yet another classic horror film remade with dunder-headed teenage acting despite grizzly and creative deaths. Based on the 1953 Vincent Price film House of Wax where a maniac kills unsuspecting teenage hooligans and turns them into priceless wax figures. Still with the fantastic set design to make the whole house into wax the movie is a typical classic horror remake like Tobe Hooper's 1974 classic Texas Chainsaw Massacre later remade, despite creativity and so-so acting the movie was still just a gore picture.

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I 'm Dancing' and it turned out to be a really good movie. I can't say anything more about it as I don't think that it's worth its time at all, but if you want to check it out - go see it for free anyway. I never would have thought that the most famous person to come out of Ireland, Sean "Pals" O'Casey, could have made such a terribly amateurish movie.

I love this movie a lot . I must get this on DVD . I have 2 VHS copies , 1 in my living room , the other is on a DVD at home. This one isn't really a good movie, but it was fun to watch with the family. My daughter and I were watching it together when her younger sister asked if we wanted to stay up late so we could watch more of it. I had to ask her to leave me alone, because I was enjoying myself far too much.

James Franco is totally cool in this movie. Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a sincere kind of way. At the Tristan screening some folks were on his back for being pouty and sullen and doing the whole James Dean thing but I don't think this true. Blind Spot is proof positive of his tremendous talent. In this film he carries himself with a different sort of weight entirely. It's a unique performance. Bittersweet and really moving. The lines from his journal cut you like a knife. You sense a sharp intelligence of observation behind his words.

Made at the height of the Black Power movement, this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope (Arnold Johnson) getting made CEO of a corporation after the white CEO dies (the white executives all hate each other and can't decide who should succeed the previous CEO). Once in power, he decides to turn it into a militant organization.I don't know how Robert Downey Sr did it, but he did it! "Putney Swope" is the ultimate jab at America's power structure. It's the sort of thing that seems like it would have come out of Richard Pryor's mind.

It took me a while to find this movie since they do n't have it yet on DVD ( and they don't have it on the net either...I'm sure that's why it was left off the cable list). I didn't see it at first. When I finally saw it I was impressed. As I was watching, I could not stop myself from looking up the cast, thinking "I should have seen this coming." This film is just plain bad. Don't waste your time!

`` I am ... proud of 'Head ' , '' Mike Nesmith has said . He should be , because he played the lead. Oh, this is the greatest film ever made! I had to watch it again, and again, and again, until I was able to figure out what in hell was going on. What were they trying to accomplish? The plot makes no sense! And even if I did understand why they were doing what they were doing, how does that make the film any good?The characters are unbelievable.

I am a guy , so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Geary will not be in it, but my mom said it was a good movie. anyway, after watching the movie i realized i should have seen it and then i went to the local theatre with my girlfriend and she started freaking out because she couldnt stop laughing at how bad the acting was. What a complete waste of time, money, energy, and brains this movie was. It has literally no story or purpose other than its own self-insertion. The acting is terrible.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

It took me a while to find this movie since they don't have it yet on DVD (and my VCR is not worth hooking up again). I guess all the referencing to drug use is too much for some folks. But I found a decent bootleg on Ebay and I must say that anyone who takes this movie too seriously is just retarded. It is a slap stick spoof in the vein of "Airplane." I must say that when I watched it on Showtime or Spotlight growing up in the 80s, I enjoyed the humor a whole lot more then, than I do now.

Telling the story would n't be the point at all , would it ? Barnens √∂ , spelled almost like "Bennen" and pronounced with an 's' instead of an 'o', is not a common name. I'm not even going to go through how stupid that title sounds. The movie is so bad it actually makes me wonder why this movie even existed in the first place, let alone made it onto DVD. There are very few good movies in the genre of Science Fiction or B-movie. These movies often try too hard to be profound and sometimes come off as silly.

Ross Hunter's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy, based on James Hilton's enduring bestseller, was written off by critics and audiences almost immediately in 1973, sounding off a backlash against musicals in general that gave the genre a bad reputation in Hollywood for years. Group of disparate British and American individuals end up on an emergency flight out of a war-torn Asian country, but their plane is hijacked and crashes in a snowy mountain terrain; a rescue party arrives and leads the group to an isolated community called Shangri-La, where the sun is always shining and most of the residents are youthful and blissfully content.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . In fact , if I had made a list of this film's most offensive qualities , it would be very short indeed. When I heard the word "retarded" uttered on the screen, my whole body shuddered. Why did I feel so sad? Did something terrible have to happen for that to happen?I was confused, and even more bewildered, at just what the point of this film was. It reminded me of a school play where all the students are playing an imaginary game.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I've just managed to watch this film for the second time in nearly twenty years, and I can honestly say it hasn't lost any of its kick. I can't believe that Channel 4 have let this one vanish without a trace as it is an extremely powerful, moving and moralistic take on the consequences of misplaced loyalty. It focuses on a clique of friends over the course of ten years and their relationship with two 'outsiders' from school; specifically how they use one and mercilessly torment the other.

A great movie. The movie was even better then the commercials put on. And believe it or not it was very very inspirational. I really think anyone who walks out of the movie at the end will be inspired one way or another.It was kinda corny at the very beginning, but quickly picks up. I laughed. I laughed very hard on some parts. The acting is basically above average, nothing special, but better then average. I can safely say it was the second funniest movie to come out this summer (1st funniest being CLERKS II).

To experience Head you really need to understand where the Monkees were when they filmed it.This was as their series debut. The movie is an interesting tale of a couple who fall in love but quickly realize that they cannot be together because of her father's abusive personality. They try to convince their friend to go with them on this adventure but he refuses, and soon decides to spend his free time hanging out with some prostitutes instead. I saw this movie at a small theater near my place and I had to rent it. There wasn't much dialogue and I found it very difficult to understand.

If we could have `` Separate Tables , '' why not `` Separate Lies . `` This becomes somewhat involved, however, and the book is only available in its entirety on the net. I had high hopes for this book. It promises to be a "classic" of the genre...and while it lacks the sophistication of many of its more famous counterparts (such as A Farewell to Arms ), it seems to have something that can be considered classic--an atmosphere, a story, characters who seem believable and complex.

As an English teacher , I appreciate films that do more than tell a story . Good films , like 'Gulliver's Travels' and 'The Jungle Book', try to answer some fundamental problems of our species . I'm a huge Disney fan, but this movie was absolutely disappointing. It had potential to be wonderful, but at times it felt like we were being fed a story line that had already been done to death. You can't really help but feel cheated when something you've spent hours and hours trying to decipher comes up with a solution you already knew existed.

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few. The wise can see the wisdom contained in what most call folly.This music may well regain popularity as world consciousness rises. It is about a land "far away from it all" where "living things have room to grow." Its people are "living and growing together" mentally and spiritually faster than in biological age.The lyrics help us recognize the relativity of this "world that is spinning around" and to "look inside yourself; that is where the Truth always lies."

When the new Outer Limits first started , the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging . As the series began to run out of steam , the episodes became more depressing and depressing . And by the time the sixth season started , the show was starting to grate on people . This movie isn't much fun. But I'll give it that, because this is one of those crappy movies you just don't see in theaters any more.It's about a couple who decide to spend some quality time together. They go into the living room, sit around, look at stuff, and so on.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to boot camp, where he has to learn how to handle his rifle and how to walk in line. That's a really funny scene as the tramp is not used to keeping his feet straight!Next thing you know he's in France in a trench. Hilarious scenes here include a starving Charlie eating the cheese of a mousetrap and reading a letter from home over someone's shoulder.When Charlie goes to sleep he finds his bunker all flooded and his roommate snoring.

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind, and certainly the only one to which I have been subjected. (I should add that there are so many excellent movies out there, some of which I might even have watched.)'' WTF??? I saw this movie with my girlfriend. We bought it as we both had just started watching a little horror/thriller at the same time. I am sure she was expecting something good. WHAT?? This movie sucks!

Lucio Fulci 's `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by the specter of corruption in its local and national institutions. While it's impossible to judge the film for its actual content (there are very few good films about Sicily), there is no question that this was one of the worst American films made during the 1980s. When I was younger, my dad liked to watch bad movies. I don't remember the name of the movie we saw, but I can tell you that it wasn't a good one.

In Nordestina, a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco, Ant√¥nio (Gustavo Falc√£o) is the youngest son of his mother, who had uninterruptedly cried for five years. When he is a young man, he falls in love for Karina (Mariana Ximenes), a seventeen years old teenager that dreams to see the world and becomes an actress. Ant√¥nio promises Karina to bring the world to Nordestina, and once in Rio de Janeiro, he participates of a sensationalist television show and promises to travel to the fifty years ahead in the future or die for love with a deadly machine he had invented.

I saw this film at a small screening. Even though it had a low budget, the creative direction and intelligence of the cast helped make this a small gem of a movie. It's April 8, 1994, each of the characters are in their "mid 20's" and pursuing some kind of artistic ambition (acting, music, film, writing) when they learn of Nirvana singer Kurt Cobain's suicide. They quickly get inspiration to travel from San Francisco to Seattle and attend the Cobain vigil. It's here where the film really picks up and serves up a series of funny and emotional scenes.

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man who finds himself trapped in an eerie haunted house. His only source of hope is a book that supposedly gives him the answers he needs to escape, but instead it makes him more desperate than ever. This is another movie that has gone completely off the deep end with regards to its storyline, premise, and direction. This is not a good horror movie at all. Let's start with plot: A woman (Mia Sara) is murdered and her head is kept inside a box.

I do n't see that much wrong with this movie . Granted , the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti or Raffaelle Battistelli , but I'm sure there are a few of them who can sing pretty good. As far as being "artsy" is concerned , I guess it depends on your definition of art. This is one of my least favorite movies, maybe because I've seen almost everything that's come out in the '80s.The acting is terrible, the plot has no logic at all and the ending leaves me speechless.

I 've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark . I'm sorry, but there is no comparison between this show and the one that has been making it's rounds for the past 20 plus years or so . I am not going to waste my precious time rehashing the whole plotline , as it can be summed up in a single word : BORING . There are several issues with this show, first of which is that they tried to change the format of the series from episodic to serialized and failed.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo ' ( hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door ') last night and I must say it was one of the best films I have seen this year. It is a masterfully-crafted film that makes you sit back and admire the skill of the movie-makers, even though you could probably guess what's going on from the beginning if you payed close attention. This is not the kind of movie for the faint hearted. You are going to need to do some serious studying before you are able to fully understand its mysteries.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans . Okay I 'm sure it 's not as good as the first one but it 's pretty much the same movie, only with a different plot.The problem I had with this film was that the story just wasn 't there. You could feel that the producers were just trying to milk every dollar out of this film so they could use it for more money later on. There was nothing memorable or frightening about any of the characters in this film. The acting was all over the place too.

I loved this film, which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival. In March 2005 I went to India with 2 friends, and this movie was very real. I related to everything, and savored every moment. The characters are believable, the story poignant and the ending realistic, but not sentimental. I also enjoyed the discussion with the director after the showing. This movie shows very well the blending, but not complete mixing of 2 worlds (East and West). The supporting cast was wonderful, depicting the life a tourist encounters in India quite realistically.

I just ca n't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense . It was never supposed to make sense it was supposed to be a spoof . You can tell by the dialogs the movie was never intended to be funny . Let me say this right out the gate, I like "Ghostbusters." I have enjoyed the series since the original 1984 film and even moreso with the new ones. I am very fond of Egon Spengler, Bill Murray, Sigourney Weaver, Peter Venkman and Harold Ramis' work. However, that does not make this film worth watching or entertaining.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something , and who appreciate a farce that is clever and funny , this movie really isn't. There's so much potential for comedy in this film, but none of it is delivered. This movie made me sick to my stomach. In the first place I don't find any sense in creating a monster out of nothing at all. Second, why did God send these creatures on a mission to destroy the world? What did they ever do wrong? And what was the purpose of their existence?

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps you enthralled.The story revolves around a young boy who, after spending the summer in a secluded house with his parents, accidentally falls in love with a young woman who happens to live in the same house. I'm an avid horror fan, so it wasn't surprising when I saw this on the Sci Fi Channel. But I was pretty disappointed by the lackluster production values. The scares are cheesy and uninspired. They look like they could've been created for a Saturday morning cartoon.

Oh my word!! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or consideration for anything other than the death of the scum! Michael Winner here makes a valid observation of human desires in displaying a gung-ho troth world of deep and damaged execution. Not only does he spoon feed us with utter hell on earth seen through the face of the moustached Bronson, but he also shows us the spoon he's feeding us with and says "look at what your watching now look at your self and ask the question: Are you enjoying this?"

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen, However, I am only in the second season.The typical Columbo activities are both amusing and irritating. His cigar ashes causing him trouble have been seen before, And the bit where he always identifies in some way with the murderer--in this case cooking ,Tho the scene on the TV cooking show distracted from the main theme.Also not explained was why the brother at the beginning of the show was cutting part of the wires of the mixer. The reason was never explained ,nor did it serve any purpose.

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few . The wise can see the wisdom of this story but the common man and women may not. If you are thinking of making it a date night, think twice ! You could easily spend half your evening in tears . First of all, "The Wizard of Lies" is probably the least well-liked Disney movie to ever hit the theatres. Its main problem lies in its blatant disregard for historical accuracy (which makes me want to kill my parents).

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining . It provides updates of tech news , video games, cars , politics & much more. It's funny how people get so worked up over this movie when there are hundreds of similar movies that I've found to be just as funny. "Spy Games" has some of those elements but it's far worse than "The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension" or any of the dozen or so bad 80's-90's comedies I could name off the top of my head without looking them up in a bookstore.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature. Faulkner mostly wrote about life in the South particularly during the depression years. Many of his stories have been adapted to screen. Short stories like Two Soldiers is an endearing tale of two brothers in December 1941 after the attack on Pearl Harbor. The older brother, Pete Greer, goes to Memphis, Tennessee to enlist like hundreds of thousands of young men, some who would never come home. His younger brother doesn't take his departure well. He manages to get a bus ticket to Memphis without any money to find his brother.

Another go round with the monkey king going west....sort of.Beginning in the middle of some action the movie just goes from the first frame onward.A monk and his three disciples go to a town to get the sacred suras that will bring peace to the world once they are translated and spoken to the world.But an evil force has intervened and kidnapped all of the children of the town. The evil force wants the monk because if you eat him you will live forever. The retainers battle the forces of darkness before forcibly sending the monk off for safety (The monk thinks he can win simply by reasoning with the bad guys).

Let 's be fair : there are no RULES for scriptwriting , so I wo n't say the movie SHOULD HAVE HAD one but instead it had ONE. It's pretty much all over the place. The movie has some great moments but it's a complete mess at the same time. I've seen this film in 4 different forms (not sure which). In the best of the versions I saw (the first being the DVD version), the "story" was not very good. There was too much filler, characters were illogical, and the story fell way short of expectations.

When I first saw this movie , I also expected `` our boys '' to be cute , and more importantly, to be human . Well, it's just a terrible film! It starts out very interesting and is full of promise. The characters are good-looking and funny. We're really interested in the story because we want to know who these "others" are. Then they reveal that there are no other people in the whole world but their friends, and then all the actors are killed off. It's an anticlimax!

I always liked this movie, I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it :) the story is interesting and special. But the only thing I have to disagree with is that I don't think Max lived in a Romanian monastery or what was that :P They don't look that way in Romania.. Anyway, back to the story, Ghita Muresan played pretty well but as someone said before me, his English needs to improve. And there were some funny moments and some tragical/sad parts too. It worths being seen, I thought it was sweet that the giant wanted to find his love.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old , I adore AristoCats . It is the first cartoon in which I could watch my baby watching it.It is one of those things that will never go out of fashion. You can't get any better than this film. The voice acting is perfect. The humor is very well thought out. Even the characters were unique and funny, even to the point of being likable.The fact that the whole movie was shot on video adds an extra layer of realism to the story line.

I do n't care what some of the reviews said , this movie was funny . The thing with this is that every time I think I've seen everything it seems like one joke or stupid story line would be all. This is just a bunch of people talking and never really saying anything . Every time you think you've heard enough , they throw a new joke in for you . A film so horrible, it's not even funny. If I had watched it when I was younger, I would have thrown up from laughing so hard.

I was watching an NFL game and started surfing during a break and found this on one of the HBO channels. I just thought, "hey this would be cool to check out!" So I did, then realized that I haven't watched an NFL game in almost a year! So I rewound back to when I actually watched football last and lo and behold, it was here! The first thing I noticed about this show is that every episode ends with a voice-over from the players or coaches discussing how they can improve for the next game.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live. I know personally most of the property owners of the various locations used in the film. As a teenager, I worked in the fields surrounding the isolated road shown late in the film with Ron Perlman, Jonathon Furr, and the car. I am told that Jonathon Furr and Ben Allison are are natives of NC. I was fortunate to see it at a local showing. At that showing was one of the people who helped select locations and secure props, such as the bus (1938 Greyhound) used in the movie.

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost ( for many years ) gem , I suggest you do it! This film is not without merit. It shows the horrors of WWII. However, it does not portray the reality of what happened to those people. In particular, some scenes that are used in the movie have no real basis in historical fact or common knowledge.For example, when the Germans are told how much they were making from the slave labor they were sending over, they scoff at their pay and state that the money was too high.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film . I have got to say that I was pleasantly surprised.I've never really seen a "comic" movie like this. The humor and the style is pretty good but the script is so bad it makes me want to vomit. I'm sorry to all of you that are going to be looking for a laugh, but there's simply no way to enjoy this one. The plot starts off promisingly enough with some great character development by the main cast.

I didn't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD. I knew it had a cult following but I had also seen a lot of the director's later works which although delightfully gory were also pretty much incoherent. DON'T TORTURE A DUCKLING actually had a linear storyline and a mystery that kept me guessing almost until the end. And after all was said and done, it was a genuinely unsettling and creepy experience. One major caveat: I would much rather have heard the original soundtrack and read English subtitles than the uneven dubbing found here.

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life, this time the creatures under the sea, in this extraordinary 8-episode trip to all the animals under the sea!The cinematography is astounding, bringing to the screen truly breathtaking footage of those whales! But the best thing about it, as well as seeing each episode, is how they made it! Whether it is making models of creatures, or those impressive shots of the whales, they explain to you in about 10 minutes how they did it!2001 had some great tv shows to our screen.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people. The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of life's moral highway make interesting viewing. There seems to be a different standard of judgement on women who have extra marital affairs than on men. Amy Watson's hurtful and humiliating behaviour towards her husband seems to pass without comment. Reverse the roles and one could expect a torrent of condemnation towards the man. If she found her husband boring and judgmental she could could have told him so, left and waited for a no doubt large financial settlement upon divorce.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it . It 's one of those rare movies that you just have to sit down, watch it once and pass it on to your friends/family because it is worth watching. I had no idea what to expect when I went into this film thinking it was going to be about a group of misfits who are forced to travel to some unknown location where they discover something that could save mankind (or at least the planet Earth) in the long term future.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old. I had no idea who Buddy Holly was, nor can I remember what it was that made me sit down in front of the television, tuned in to HBO, and watch this engaging biopic. What I remember was realizing that it was a (somewhat) true story, about someone who actually lived. I recall the music, great songs that I still love today (I can't believe Gary Busey sang his own songs and so well - What a stud!) Then, came the end.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie . I am not saying this lightly . I think it's a good movie to watch at night with your girlfriend or friend . Although the story is very basic . But in case you don't want to find out the bad and the good , here are some tips: 1 - Do not have sex on camera . (I was shocked by this ).2 - You should be able to follow the plot . (I am still wondering about the logic of his "plan").3 - If you get bored , take a break .

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary. I knew it was about an ex-Viet Nam POW in Laos who escaped, but I didn't know much else. In reality, I wasn't expecting too much. Oh what a surprise! The story of this man's life is very interesting in itself, but what sets this film apart from other biography-type docs is that Dieter himself tells most of the story himself. Dieter is very comfortable in front of the camera. His personality really shines. He tells his story about his life growing up in Germany during WWII and the hardships.

Accepted is a 2006 teen flick that stars the guy from the mac and PC ads . The movie is very forgettable and feels more like it was conceived as a joke than a serious attempt to make anything out of. A film with an 80% rating on Rotten Tomatoes doesn't really have much chance if it has no redeeming qualities at all. However, there are some things about this title that I enjoy. It does a good job of showing the hardships of military life, so we feel for the soldiers in the movie, but unfortunately the movie falls short of being entertaining.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments ever filmed. However this series does not have much to say, as far as I can tell. A lot of things are missing and what is there is just very unoriginal. One of the biggest complaints I see about this movie is that they cut the scene where the submarine is seen on the beach. Why did they cut this? Because we didn't know it had been destroyed. Well, maybe that's part of the problem, but it's something that could have been easily dealt with.

by TyNesha Mells. In this drama, Ja Rule, who stars as Reggie, struggles with the loss of his father. His old friend J-Bone, who is a cold-blooded thug recently released from prison, helps Reggie find who murdered his father. A week after his dad died, a preacher, Reverend Packer, came up dead. Reggie was suppose to be the one to kill him, but did he? Did Reggie kill Reverend Packer or was it some type of a setup? Back in the Day also has a couple of romantic scenes.

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply stunning romantic comedy. Their relationship is so compelling that you begin to wish the entire movie was devoted solely to their courtship and wedding. I'm not here to judge the quality of the film or its cast, but let me just say: this is the kind of movie that would be better as a DVD extra for someone's list of 'best movies of all-time.' Lane is absolutely magnificent as Edith Keating, a beautiful housewife who has fallen in love with a man who turns out to be a thief.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency. Putney Swope is on the board for no other reason than the fact that he is black, and the agency needs a "token" on the board. Swope is ignoring the meeting, reading Jet magazine at the big table, and everybody is ignoring Swope... Suddenly, the CEO croaks on the spot. No time is wasted. A janitor is called to haul off the corpse, and the board immediately and unceremoniously tackles the business of electing a new CEO.

`` Caribe '' is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects . However , it delivers a perfectly serviceable piece of entertainment that has the potential to become a classic. It is a good time to go back and watch an animated film I didn't bother watching when it came out.I would have liked to rate this more highly but felt like I wasn't giving it enough benefit of the doubt because of its rating on Rotten Tomatoes. The story starts with a kid getting his hands on some marijuana from his drug dealer who happens to be looking for a new customer.

Being a middle aged mom myself , I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in and out of the story. It has been said that movies can make you think, it can entertain, it can lift you up to another world, or put you down to a lower one, but most of all movies leave you asking questions. "Is this real?" "Where are we going?" "What have we just done?" "What do I do now?!" This is not a movie like that.

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog's filmic work that is without peer. Having recently rewatched it on DVD, nearly a decade after its initial US release in 1997, it has lost none of its power, and one can see its influence on documentaries as diverse as Herzog's own recent Grizzly Man and Errol Morris's Academy Award winning The Fog Of War. Like the former, it details, in its far too brief 74 minutes, the life of an interesting American. Like the latter it gives a peek at a side of war that few see.

I've read a lot of reviews about Showtime on IMDb and many seem to miss the mark. I've noticed a lot of reviewers calling this the typical "buddy" film. De Niro is in no way Murphy's buddy throughout most of this movie. In fact, part of the comedy of this film is De Niro's reluctance to be friends with anybody.Murphy really shines in this one. He is back at doing what he does best, acting like a complete ham. He is a cop who wants so much to be an actor and enjoys being in the reality show.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 "They Made Me a Criminal." Celebrating a ring victory in a jammed locker room, boxer Johnnie Bradfield emotes about his love of mom, rejection of booze and clean living style to fans, including cops, who eat it up. Later in the evening he's plowed and tussling with his bimbo gal while his manager, in on the con, shares the evening. And the whiskey.A problem develops when another couple arrives. The guy is a newspaper reporter and he says he'll expose Bradfield's phony life on the front page.

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to watch those movies too. If you're anything like me, and you probably are, you'll be laughing for years to come at the jokes in this movie. One of the funniest parts is when Gus sharks some money off a guy with kids and then the guy takes those kids into the forest like Hansel and Gretel then he and his wife go home with them. The soup scene kitchen is rife with comic genius of buffoonery: "Inspection officer -- Here!"

I thought it was brilliant ! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down . Dwight Howard is simply amazing in this show, he just oozes charisma . If you have not yet seen this movie please do yourself a favour and check it out. The only complaint I have about the movie is its length - I found myself getting bored after about 2/3rds but that could just be me being spoiled by so many other films on DVD. There are a couple of really good moments which don't take too long to get across.

I thought it was brilliant! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down. Dwight Schultz still looked the same, he had hardly changed in looks, neither had Dirk Benedict, he still looked just as dishy! I thought that Mr T looked thinner though, but it was still great to see how he looked after all this time. I thought that it took some doing tracking down the other members of the cast, such as the one who played Decker, and the lady who played Amy. It was just a shame that Mr T could'nt make the actual reunion.

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost (for many years) gem, I doubt you will be disappointed. PS has an odd blend of social satire and ultra-cool blaxploitation-- even hints of slapstick, but it's so odd that it was not only ahead of it's time, nothing has been seen like it since.I strongly disagree with people who say that the film is dated, especially with Spike Lee's "Bamboozaled" (SP?) a few years back which was a misfire of trying to capture the same message. (Good filmmaking, disjointed script.

`` Showtime '' falls somewhere north of what some critics have been saying , and a little south of what the public is willing to give it. The movie starts off with one of those scenes where you think, "This could happen." I was shocked at how easy it was to make that happen. Well, in all honesty, I don't really care too much for this film. I've seen it twice. In fact, I may be the ONLY person who saw it two or more times.

OK , so I loved Rachael Ray before , but now , I ADORE her ! How innovative . I was amazed to look at the movie and realize she was actually on the same screen as herself ! The concept of this film is good, however, its execution would have benefitted from better editing. Every time I see this movie it makes me think 'why did i watch that?'. There are times when the story becomes a little bit too confusing, particularly for the younger audience. The plot is fairly simple and doesn't take you out of the movie by much.

OK, so I loved Rachael Ray before, but now, I ADORE her! How innovative. I love that she has a cooking section- I admit that occasionally I skip that part, only because it makes me WAAAY too hungry! But I also love that you can get the next day's grocery list on her website. I love that she has regular helpers and that she's made some of her viewers become her regulars. I love how personable she is and how creative she is. I also like how she does her Mystery Guests.

The Monkees , surprisingly , are a big favorite of mine . Yes , they might have been the original rock'n roll band , but to call them an old school group is quite an error. There's almost nothing to hold them back from being one of the biggest stars in pop entertainment history. If you haven't seen the series , you'll have a hard time getting through this movie . It's really a waste of time . It is difficult to think of a film that makes me feel this way when watching it, despite the fact that many of the things I was thinking were totally false.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne 's `` For The Flag '' by the Czech master director Karel Ancic.Ancic's latest, in addition to having a lot of style, is also highly original. In addition to being a masterpiece of art cinema, it might also be one of the most significant films ever made about space flight. I loved this film, but I don't love space movies. When you have an amazing cast like Travolta and Keitel and fantastic set design and effects, well, you can't really fault them.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie. But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. (MINOR SPOILERS) As per usual, the main character, B, is the sane one of the bunch. B has this crazy idea to make up his own college when he's rejected from all colleges he applies to. He's known for making fake IDs. so an acceptance letter is no problem.Because B's dad is a hard @$$ and suspicious of this university he's never heard of, B gets his friend Sherman to design a website for the university.

Is this a good movie? It's hard to say -- but in 1953, for many people, it was a remarkably effective movie, suspenseful, scary and then, amazingly, actually touching when "the old gentleman" meets his unhappy death at the end of the movie.Yes, what lurks in the Maze turns out to be something of a surprise and, for a lot of people, a hilarious one. But the basic idea (ontogeny recapitulates phylogeny) was a very real one at the time the book was written, and does have some basis in fact.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the cast.The plot of the script was not bad. In fact it was pretty good. They could have at least written out a decent ending, as there were no cliff hangers. I really liked all the actors and how they handled themselves in the film. But the script was just too weak . A very low budget, poorly-written movie, with poor acting and awful dialog. The only redeeming quality of this movie is some of the special effects.

I ca n't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I 've described it to a friend in an effort to avoid saying it ourselves. This movie is the worst thing I have ever seen. I don't even know why I watched it at this point. The acting is terrible, the story is awful, and the production values are just embarrassing. This movie would not have even been worth watching if Michael Caine's voice hadn't come on every five seconds. He gave absolutely nothing of himself here.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family 's journey from the Old World ( Italy ) to New World ( USA ) in order to escape an arranged marriage . The Golden Door is based on a true story about a family's struggle between their Italian roots and that of their new-found American identity. I thought I would try this movie since it was written by my wife, who liked it so much she had been recommending it to us. This movie didn't live up to her expectations. The only thing that was interesting was the plot.

The Ali G show was really something amazing - he was so stupid wannabe rapper, but no one he interviewed noticed that he was just pretending. Sasha Cohen is actually very intelligent guy, who pretends to be stupid, so he could get really honest answers from people... And it is very funny. So I didn't expect movie to be good, cause it was all acted - no real people or interviews. So the basic point of all show was lost. But I was wrong - I laughed all the time, it was one of the funniest films I ever saw.

The "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." scene was a riot. I also guffawed at the scene in the bar where Hyde snorted the horse radish and flipped the bird to the Japanese guy and said "Pearl Harbor buddy". I think my IQ is higher than 115, but I'm not sure because I can't count that high.Funny thing, this 10 line requirement. Seems as though they would bash you for making your comments too long, not too short. I hope I don't make it to 1,000 words before I get to line 10.I'm still two lines short.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

`` Showtime '' is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro ( Meet the Parents , A Bronx Tale ) and Danny DeVito (Pulp Fiction), but it is not funny or clever in the least, especially when compared to their earlier work.DeNiro does an excellent job with his accent, as he attempts to make the best of a life that is quite different for him. Unfortunately, the story line doesn't hold up too well under scrutiny. Good news, I saw this movie before writing this review, so I don't feel obligated to rehash old grievances.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn 's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect Dad. This has to be the first movie I've ever seen in my life that made me want to have a mental breakdown. I'd say it had as much to do with the fact that I was having a very good day and there were a bunch of other people at the cinema enjoying their movies, but hey...I'm not complaining. The main issue with this movie is that it doesn't have a plot!

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I 've seen in a while . It 's an emotional roller-coaster that takes all of us as viewers. This film has more twists and turns than a roller coaster ride, and it's made by someone who knows what they're talking about! The actors are believable, and the story keeps you on the edge of your seat--even with the occasional lull.The problem is that it's a pretty bad film. The acting is flat, the pacing is slow, and the plot is too convoluted.

Coming from the `` druggie '' generation , I thought this movie was hilarious . It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde to my attention .The actors in it were great , but the dialog was just terrible. I am sure you can guess by now what I had in mind... I must say that the original version of Frankenstein was a little dull, slow paced and quite predictable. There is one scene where a couple of scientists are discussing whether or not they should make a cure for the monster. The doctor's answer has an element of scientific certainty to it--it's too dangerous to try.

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a d√©j√† vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

"Live Together, Die Alone" is divided into three main story lines, and each one of them alone would have been enough for a great episode. So when you put all of them together, you have a great ^ 3 episode. It was a daring move to give the flashbacks of a season finale to a character (Desmond) who had only appeared in 3 episodes up to that point, but it worked: his backstory is absolutely fascinating to watch, both informative about the past of the island & the Swan station itself and honestly moving.

Oh my gosh ! ! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !!!!!! My God ! it is the best! and i can't stop watching it. I don't know what to say, I had high expectations but they were dashed on this movie. I am not one of those people that has to give a movie more than 2 stars. I always rate movies on their originality, creativity, and overall enjoyment. The movie doesn't quite fit in to either category.

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it on DVD. It turned out that it was being released in the USA under the title, "Masters Of The World" (I think). At that time, it had not yet come out in Italy so I got hold of my local Italian Video store and rented it. There are quite a few strange things going on in this movie. Not the least of which is the fact that one of the leading characters is an alien from Mars.

"Back in the Day" is an interesting, but flawed effort. Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, a honest but sad man trying to cope with the death of his father. He meets his old friend J-Bone (Ving Rhames) who tries to force Reggie into a life of crime. Reggie also falls in love with Alica (Tatyana Ali) who is the preacher's daughter. Now he has to choose: Love Or Crime.Ja Rule does a competent job as Reggie. At least he's trying to act. Ving Rhames is perfect as J-Bone.

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent . He runs away from his parents and decides to go on a journey. Along the way, he runs into several characters along the way including a young girl called Lola (who he later finds out is his own sister). I didn't love this one at all because it just doesn't have anything special or memorable going for it. It's just bland, boring and dull. This movie made me want to take a knife and stab my head so bad that it might as well have been in the film itself.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

Wow, What a wonderful film-making! Mr. Im has done it, again!His last work, ChunHayang (2000) was a great film, but this one is even greater. Selected as an official feature film in the Canne Festival for the second time in a two-year row, this 66 years old director is getting better and better at what he is making of with a Korean culture.Simply, Chihwaseon is about a great Korean painter, '(Ohwon) JANG, Seung-Up' who was considered as a prodigy in the late Nineteenth century.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you 'll find it. Well this is the biggest letdown ever. At no point did we get what we expected to be an interesting movie with decent acting. What a waste of time, I mean come on they could have at least put a decent story line in there. The worst part is why couldn't they give us some good looking women? They are supposed to be super hot but this movie looked like it was filmed on a school campus.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time . Excellent original music , clever , heady ... it's not a typical comedy with a good cast. The story is very funny, about a woman who tries to win a divorce from her boyfriend. It's hard for me to explain why this movie was terrible. The script is awful. The acting and direction are just awful. What's even more amazing is that this movie made $4.5M worldwide on a budget of $30K. I cannot imagine how someone came up with a script so terrible and then allowed their production team to produce it.

WTF!! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending?? The Notebook was good...but sheesh, enough with the depressing endings already. I'm told that he writes about realistic situations that people deal with in real life. Understandable...but sometimes it's nice to see people who have sacrificed their whole lives to only get to a mediocre unhappy time in their lives - to finally find the true meaning of happiness and are able to live it out for the rest of their days. Don't we already know what really happens in real life?

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally , at the end of the 1960 's. This film was based around the life of a small time crook who gets caught by the feds and sent to the big house where he meets his eventual fate. I've never understood the appeal of this kind of flick, and for that reason alone I'll probably never return to this film. It is just a waste of two hours of my life that I don't feel like paying back with money. There isn't really much going on here.

I love this movie , though I do n't like how they picture Egyptians , being an Egyptian citizen myself , it just seems wrong , when the people of Egypt are depicted as bad , stupid and evil ! And what about the women ? This is a very silly little movie, with nothing to add except the fact that the story was written by a former student of mine (the same guy who turned "The Secret of Nimh"). What I found especially disappointing was that there was no effort made to show the characters from a more humanistic point of view.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character , unable to speak , living in a world incompatible with modern life . His main mode of communication is the bowler hat and glasses. I found him quite annoying at times, which might explain why I didn't like them as much as other reviews make it sound. Why would any person pay money for this "movie". You can look it up in your library and watch it for free on YouTube.The only reason that I watched this movie was because I knew that someone else had reviewed it. This movie is horrible.

Mark Blankfield (from the old late night TV show "Fridays")plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll, a mild-mannered surgeon who invents a powder that turns him into a drug-crazed party animal. This was not, of course, his intent, he had higher aspirations, but he goes with the flow. This is actually a fairly stupid movie, but it's also pretty fun. Of course, once the good doctor realizes what he's done, he's ashamed, but he's also not above doing it all again & running through Hollywood as a crazed sex machine with frizzed out hair & gold chains.

I'm not a massive Disney fan, but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so we've built up quite a collection, and this is one of my favourites. We first saw this a couple of weeks ago and we must have see it half a dozen times since! OK, as others have pointed out, not the most complex or inventive of plots, but there's more to a film than that.Great characters, Phil Harris stealing the show as Thomas O'Malley, but Edgar the butler not far behind.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre , but I think this one is done quite well. The story seems like it will be fun and funny at the start, but then turns into a depressing mess . I could see myself being sucked in for a few episodes, thinking "What's up with the girl? Why doesn't she just tell her family to get out?". This show is pathetic. Every time you want to laugh or enjoy something, its all about the characters. Its really hard to understand what they are thinking or doing.

I 've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie . I agree it's not up to the level of the book but I would still like to see it because I am a huge fan of Stephen King. This was an atrocious movie. The acting was terrible, especially from Jennifer Jason Leigh (who had her first lead role in a long time and really needed to get off her butt and do more), as well as from Tom Selleck, although I guess they were trying their hardest.

This is one of the best of the early `` Star Trek '' episodes , with Kirk and his crew having to battle a space ship from the future in order to keep Earth free of the Borgs. I've always hated this episode because I think it's very boring, and I also can't stand that they had to go into the future so often just to make some lame joke. I really don't know what to make of this show. It looks like it would be pretty enjoyable, and there seems to be a lot of money being invested in it.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie. I caught it last night on TMC. I thought it was hysterical. I laughed so hard and loved the ending. Image what a Marx brothers movie would like if they collaborated with Salvadore Dali and Malcolmn X and then all dropped LSD.Funny and edgy are two overused words these days, this movie sure has that plus about 200 IQ points of most comedies today and surrealistic to boot. I had to be up at 6:00 am and watched it until 2:30. I over slept and missed my obligations. Still worth it.
