The film isn't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch. I am the first one to agree that Victor Fox isn't really that attractive and his music and style are pretty cheesy. I also agree that the film has some odd distractions and some scenes don't work well. So what? If it makes you smile and you enjoy it who cares? Does every film have to make sense? Does every film have to be perfect? No. A person could get razed admitting that they love this film. Again, so what?

I Loved this movie . Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role . More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade with him ! I think we're all guilty of this one - when we see a really good film that is not in our immediate cinematic interests, we have the tendency to try and catch it on TV instead. We can't help but think: what if? What would happen if someone else took the same premise? Well, I'm pleased to admit that I watched "Cave Dwellers" without a hint of jealousy (perhaps due to the fact that I don't own a cable subscription).

Can the intensity of a husband 's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime , despite the obvious consequences to themselves or others? If so, how did this guy escape with his life? I got this movie after seeing "Lethal Weapon 3", and I am not sure how it could have possibly improved on such a great concept. There are several things in this movie that just absolutely do not work: 1) The first time I saw this movie (at a friend's suggestion), I thought it might be good. It was.

I've never seen the original "House Of Wax" so I really didn't know what to expect when I went to a sneak preview of the new film. After a somewhat wobbly start introducing our young characters, "House Of Wax" shifts gears and becomes an extremely effective horror outing.The plot really doesn't matter too much here - I think most people know upon seeing this that these stranded kids are going to meet up with a nasty killer and find some awful things in the titular house of wax. It's all about the special effects here, and they are top notch.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever. I love all the characters, especially Alex, who is the PERFECT woman! Always makes me laugh and feel good when I watch this show. There is just something about it that is amazing, hard to describe.It seems some or all of the episodes synchronise with music albums as well. Here are a few examples. (The episodes start again when they end - but DON'T play end credits until the very end, but always play the opening credits. With most the episodes the album plays once and the episodes play twice, but some go on further.

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special `` Simpson 's Roasting On An Open Fire '' which had Lisa (played by Sarah Jessica Parker) being interviewed about her life story. She claims that she was raped by a man at the age of 7 when she and her mother got lost in a storm on the way back from the beach to visit relatives. As I mentioned earlier this episode is terrible, and it only gets worse. It's one of those episodes where you don't know why they were doing it until it's already over.

it 's a great movie for the whole family . i do n't think many people have seen it cause it is about a kid who has to stay in school to get a job as a bus boy . i found this film quite funny and thought its a good one to show kids. if you want to know what all the hype is about check it out! This movie might not be that bad at all. The script is fairly well-written and the plot does hold up reasonably well. I'm not going to say too much on this review since it's pretty much just an opinion.

If you have n't seen this film , do it . Its a genremix as i 've never seen another. Theres just too much going on in this movie to fit in a single review so i did a quick write-up for those that want to read a short synopsis of what is about to be presented to the world . Why? Why? Why? Where's the love? Where's the emotion? We're supposed to feel something while watching this film, or we won't be able to make any decisions about how to spend our time.

I think this show was right on the money for me . I watched it over the plane but there was nothing in it that could not be done in one hour with an A.D.V.R. (Airborne TV Video) . The story line and dialogue was good, but the writing and production values were pretty awful. I didn't get the impression from the show that it was made by professionals. I am hoping someone will post a better quality tape of the show online. When I read the title of this piece I thought "oh no".

This is a wonderful movie , and I still love it ! It just so magical and it is fun to watch . I have heard some people who don't like the movie , but i can assure you it is not because of this reason. The first time I saw this film was when I was six or seven and we were watching movies at night on a rainy night in an Italian apartment. My mother had recently gotten married, my father wasn't around, and all we had was that one piece of pizza from Pizza Hut and some popcorn.

I'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci's films. Most of his 80s gore films had their moments, but often came across as second-rate Dario Argento imitations. With the exception of the entertaining "Zombi" (which was a George Romero imitation), I didn't really enjoy them. I know Italian horror often disregards the plot, but the storyline and characters in his films were just far too thread bare even by the standards. This is why "Don't Torture a Duckling" surprised me. Its actually a very well made film with an engrossing murder mystery.

Chucky's back...and it's about time! This time, with the help of Jennifer Tilly and a little spell from Voodoo For Dummies. Well, at least with this installment, the camp is back. This was the more gruesome of this series, so far. It has some good twists and some good action scenes. This one was by far, the most fun of the series, and successfully, if unintentionally, bridges the gap between pure horror to horror/comedy. I am looking forward to Seed of Chucky. It'll be a hoot!

I don't usually comment on films since I am in the movie distribution business, but I have to say that this is one of my favorite films of all time. The acting is fantastic and the script is even better. There were no cheesy speeches or exploitation of handicapped people to try and make this movie more "Hollywood". James McAvoy is such an outstanding actor, I could not look away from him if I tried. I was impressed with Steven Robertson as well. I cannot believe this is his first real film.

Like some people here, I love/loved Stingers! In Norway it got aired a lot later. That also means that we are in the 176th episode. (yea, that's right) I have to say that I really love Stingers! It can make me cry, laugh, smile and so on. I think I'm going to die the day we reach episode number 192. Stingers might be the on series(except from Grey's Anatomy) that I really watch! The actors are amazing! Especially Jacinta Stapleton! Personallly I think she is one of the best access we have!

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

When the new Outer Limits first started, the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging. As the series began to wind down, most of the episodes became just plain ugly and devoid of any entertainment value. The six episodes here reflect the very best, and worst, of the series.Since The Outer Limits always preaches a moral. I would like to offer my own. Starting with the most entertaining to the flops.1. Afterlife: As an institution, The U.S.A. military-industrial complex is both evil and paranoid, not to mention plain stupid.

I was 19 or 20, years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City, Utah and I still remember the new dome theater, called the century 21. Layback chairs that rocked and a new sound system, large screen and huge open space between the screen and the packed theater. We felt all the excitement of a new preview screening of a film. Ta da da daa da ta da dada dada... I can still hear the opening music ringing trumpet and the crash of cymbals. I loved the interplay of characters and the filmed vistas.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear we all have. Fear of rejection, fear of intimacy and most importantly fear of our own inadequacies.The three lead actors, Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo are match well to their roles and are excellent. It was a joy to witness the dynamic between the three of them as it seemed real.I believe Barbora Bobulova is a stand out. I hope we see much more of her in the coming years.This film doesn't take the easy way out.

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade . She smokes and drinks . She does n't have a lot of experience with men . She is very attracted to Owen Wilson
This was one of my least favourite movies, in fact I never went to see it. I've actually heard people calling it the worst movie they've ever seen, but I don't believe them because it's pretty awful.The script isn't that bad at all, as it has some interesting things in it. But the whole thing is so contrived and contrived it just drags along.

I never heard of architect, Louis Kahn, until this documentary. In this almost two hour documentary which goes very quickly, his son, Nathaniel Kahn, explores his father's life from Estonia to the slums of North Philadelphia to the University of Pennsylvania in West Philadelphia where he studied and taught. He travels to Bangladesh, Israel, Connecticut, Trenton, and La Jolla, California as well as New York City to explore his father's creative genius. Personally, Louis Kahn had three families including his wife, Esther, who refused to give him a divorce and their daughter Sue Ann.

Made at the height of the Black Power movement , this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope ( Arnold Johnson ) as an all around thug who uses his fists to settle his personal problems. He has no respect or sympathy for women, children, and anyone else not "in his place".This is a rather odd film to make. It's obviously meant to be a comedy, but it doesn't have a lot of wit in it. "Black Power" was made in 1973, and released into theatres that same year.

Some days ago , in Rome , a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a beautiful young woman who was his lover's fianc√©e. This violent act shocked us all, especially me. It took me a few weeks to understand that the movie I just saw was not about a real life event or even about a real life person (though it is obviously based on true events).I'm a huge fan of The Sopranos but never once did I expect to be watching an "Sopranos" spoof.

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage. A good example of this is when Johnny Cash was interviewed before a gig in London. After seeing this film, I had to re-watch all my favourite '80s TV series for inspiration because they were so clearly based on this film's plot line. It is an absolute travesty that anyone thought this could be done justice. To make matters worse, it did not come close to accurately capturing how bad this film was.There is no excuse for what this film has done to these shows.

After seeing The Aristocats: Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound, I decided to buy it since both of these films were childhood favourites.The Aristocats is a classic, definitely. It might not be a five-star classic, but it is a fun film and makes a good evening's entertainment. It is somewhat a light refreshment from the darker, more serious Disney classics. The Aristocats tries to be a light-hearted musical comedy, and I think it just about succeeds.The storyline doesn't really make much sense and I don't think the plot is particularly strong, but it is certainly not weak.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing? Never heard of them!! But this is one of the funniest comedies I have run across. It should win the Putz Puller Prize for Parody. The absurd starts with Dr. Jeykl snorting his powder and turning into a sex fiend.He is pursued by libido driven nurse early in the movie in one of the funniest scenes of the movie. Pay attention to the hospital PA system in the background; rather like the system in MASH. The final scene with Hyde accepting the award has had me laughing for years.

If we could have "Separate Tables," why not "Separate Lies. "This becomes somewhat involved. A housekeeper's husband is killed when he is hit by a car while on a bicycle. The culprit turns out to be the woman she cleans for. The latter was having an affair with a friend and was driving the car with the lover in it when the accident occurred. To complicate matters further, the housekeeper once worked for the guy's parents and he had her jailed for stealing. Therefore, people will hesitate to believe that it was his car that caused the accident.

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , in terms of atmosphere and characters, its also one of my favorite movies to be shown to people who dont' speak Italian. This movie has a very low budget making it look like it was done at an extremely low-budget indie film studio but the effects are awesome. The movie features a duckling on the run being hunted by a group of humans. As you can imagine from looking at this website, I'm quite a fan of all things sci-fi/fantasy.

The movie is excellent . Acting , cinematography , direction and music are spellbinding . It seems to me that they just shot the movie like a reality show, with the actors portraying the opposite of real people. Wow, this movie isn't very good. I didn't really expect much after watching so many bad movies but it's just plain bad. Even the title doesn't do it justice. The story sounds like something from a cheesy B-movies. You don't think about anything because the movie keeps trying to convince you that everything in it is important.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music. Filmmakers were daring to make avant-garde films discussing taboo subjects only permitted before in exploitation films. Starting with both "Breathless" and underground American cinema (such as Kenneth Anger), films became more and more experimental. All of this accumulated when Hollywood realized they had mass commercial appeal with "Easy Rider". One of the best (and most surprising) outputs of this era was also one of the least successful initially.

I just can't understand why people are surprised this movie makes no sense. It was never supposed to make sense. (Duh! The writers were completely wasted on Frodis at the time.) It was just supposed to entertain and mock, and it does both wonderfully.The Monkees are good actors. They wouldn't have been hired if they weren't good actors. Mike has a thing for deadpan and darkness, Micky is the best at sheer psychotic comedy, Davy is a Broadway veteran, and Peter actually had people believing he was that dumb in real life.

Ah the Outer Limits. I love that show. It was surpremely creepy, or down-right mysterious. I loved all the genres of the show, from horror, to thriller to mystery, whatever the genre, it was good. I guess I must have started watching way after it got canceled, when Sci-fi showed it as re-runs, or played marathons of it. It was a really good show, I don't know all about the seasons and everything but I do remember that every time I saw the screen freak out and the voice on the TV say: "There is nothing wrong with your television.

A film about the relationship between a man and leopard that's very reminiscent of "The English Patient," even down to a scene similar to when Ralph Fiennes' character carries the body of his lover across a desert-rock cliff. In "A Passion in the Desert," the main character carries the body of the leopard across a desert-rock cliff but in the opposite direction (calculated decision or unconscious contrast?). Historically expanded from a very short Balzac story, the film is not perfect but a treat no less. Final shot will haunt me for weeks.

Better than it has any right to be, this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office. At times sophomoric, at others, bitingly satirical and witty, Jekyll and Hyde is mostly just a near perfect reflection of the times, laden with drug and sexual humor, reminding one at one time or another of everything from the Woody Allen of "Everything You Always Wanted To know About Sex" to the Mel Brooks of "The Producers", Saturday Night Live to Monty Python, Carlin to Cheech and Chong.

I 'm not going to go into too much depth , but Showtime was a pretty funny movie . There were lots of references to movies that aren't very good . I am sure you can find more out on the net. If you haven't seen this flick before, be prepared to feel a bit stupid. It's about a high school nerd who wants to play football for the big time. The problem is he doesn't fit the physical type. He has small hands and isn't built for contact. The coaches don't want him at linebacker because he can't run fast enough.

I just thought I would add another observation , here . While there are a couple of visual sub-references , they are very brief and don't do the story justice. I was disappointed to discover that most people have not seen this film. That said, I'm happy to say that after reading some of the negative reviews I've seen it is worth a watch if you enjoy horror films with a lot of blood and gore. I am not one of those people. I enjoyed watching it as much as other people.

I 've never seen the original `` House Of Wax '' so I really did n't know what to expect, but this show was horrible! The only good part in this movie that i can remember was when it was just the cast and some friends. House of Wax is one of those "scary" movies where you have to look away or else you will be dead before you finish the movie. This particular film was not scary at all for me and I watched it with two friends because we were trying to scare each other out of boredom.

It 's up there with Where 's Poppa , The Groove Tube , Putney Swope . It memorializes the NY musical theater scene of the sixties and seventies.The actors are uniformly good.I really like the music, especially the first few minutes of "Paddy's Pub" . But I just can't get into this movie after the first 20 minutes. This is a movie about two men whose love has been tested by a terrible tragedy. They travel to Europe to find out what happened, only to find that the woman who died was the daughter of a very influential person in the area.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME. The 1973 musical remake of the James Hilton novel about mythical SHANGRI-LA! is a real special gem. Music by BURT BACHARACH and lyrics by HAL David. A strange mixture of straight drama, adventure and musical sequences. It has the distinction of being the ONLY anti war musical fantasy ever filmed. This film was a critical and financial disappointment in the United States, but made a lot of money overseas. Only in America did it fail.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

I love the TV contest . Hate to see it end . There are so many talented contestants . It's sad to see them go.. It's not often a movie can bring out two reactions in people: "OMG this movie was so awful, I can't believe someone actually made this," and "Hey! That's how you make an interesting movie?" Unfortunately, that is exactly what happens on this movie. Let's start from the beginning: there is absolutely no sense of where the story is supposed to go.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard ( Beau Travail ) , Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem to the American dream, set in the mid-1920s at a fictional resort town called Golden Door. It's a place that seems to be populated exclusively by hard-bitten working women, who make good money for their trouble. I think I might have bought a copy of this movie on sale just so that I'd have something to add to the discussions about what it's like to actually work in the film industry.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good . I have to admit Ms Cruz did well with her role. If you ever want to see a film that has nothing to do with cinema go check out "A Christmas Carol". This movie is an attempt to bring the characters of Christmas Carol into a modern day setting. The only redeeming qualities are the cast, all of whom seemed to have done little more than stand around and laugh their asses off.I saw this movie after watching a friend who had seen it watch "A Christmas Carol".

This new installment to the Child 's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as having a boy pretend to be a man so his teacher won't think he is gay. I had been looking forward to this movie for almost a whole year and now I wish I never did. The characters are flat, the dialog is all over-the-line and the plot is incredibly boring. In fact it seems to be the director's way of getting attention from the other distributors out there that don't have any idea about what movies they are distributing.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a movie theatre is stupid, period. Somebody tell us what's the problem? Is this really a comedy? I mean, it certainly isn't good but it's funny as hell. It has nothing to do with sex. No matter how hard I try to put my foot down and point out all the holes in these characters, I don't think I'll be heard. It's very easy to find humour in situations when you have no emotional involvement.

Like a few people I know, I came in late on 'Stingers'; not until 2000. Three years later there is no way I'd miss an episode. The show really is that good and has, for a better word, maintained its integrity, unlike 'Blue Heelers', for example. The crime is the thing; personal lives are there but only wheeled out when affecting an investigation! When Gary Sweet was brought in, some fans seemed worried, but he's really fitted in well, which didn't surprise me.

I had heard of John Garfield , but , did n't know him . I loved this movie . I thought it was a little too long , but at least it showed some character development .The acting in the movie was just good enough to make you enjoy it . If anyone has not seen this movie yet then here's a hint. It does not resemble the book at all. Yes, it has the same title, but if you go and buy the book you'll see that it doesn't have much in common with the film.

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film! Hat's off to Ben Daniels, Lavinia Currier and the great Honore de Balzac. This captivating film conveys the passion experienced by the characters so effortlessly and yet so powerfully. I watched it mesmerized, almost holding my breath as the story developed towards its inexorable end. This film's execution was almost flawless: simple and pure, it plays with our hearts, guiding us in understanding the strange platonic, absolute thus possessive bond between two creatures not meant to be part of each other's world.

My impression, having seen this documentary, is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had before he made the film. He took five years to make it, a labour of love and longing. I can only imagine the turmoil of the editing process, what to leave in, what to take out. His father, the renowned architect Louis Kahn,comes across as a man too selfish and self-absorbed to be emotionally available to even one wife not alone three. But like many men of his character, he attracted women who were spellbound by the remoteness and entranced by the creativity.

This movie was great . It had everything a true action fan could want . Plenty of people getting shot and falling into water . Lots of explosions and lots of destruction . There's not a single boring moment in this movie . If you've ever heard someone talking about the first Star Wars, this is what you should do ! My god. I'm embarrassed to be called a "fan." When it comes down to it, all I really have been doing for the last twenty years is watching bad movies. I don't care what anyone else has to say as long as they're entertaining.

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I knew she would be a good choice for this film, but what a pleasant surprise! She brought something truly unique to the project that was very refreshing. She and her co-star James Woods were able to come across as characters who were actually interested in the script; they seemed genuinely excited to do the film. Even though neither of them had quite enough screen time to really sink their teeth into any one part of the story, I thought it was well done.

* May Contain Spoilers * The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was a kid, so I can't comment on how it is today. I've seen the original and it was pretty poor. But this re-release looks like a new movie made by someone who really doesn't understand why people like his movies. It's almost as though they took the old one and added an extra hour or two to make it look good.I don't want to give away too many spoilers, so if you haven't seen it yet, please go see it!

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime, Lifetime Movie network and on Courttv. Jonathan Scarfe and John Corbett did a great job of playing Luke and Walker Morrison. I am glad that Walker got his brother Luke to confess of murdering his parents and their brother Bobby. I enjoy watching True stories on Lifetime, Lifetime Movie network and on Courttv. The Morrison Murders is a good movie to watch. Next time The Morrison Murders is on Lifetime, Lifetime Movienetwork or Courttv I am going to watch The Morrrison Murders again because My favorite actor John Corbbett is in The Morrison Murders.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic lines. There is no place on Earth this film could have been set anywhere in the US except Los Angeles. I'm just a normal guy, with average looks, a job, a house and family, I live in a nice suburb but my wife has two kids and i don't want any of them going to war. As soon as i saw this flick i instantly wanted to get my kid out of there right away and buy him a ticket to Europe or the US.

In an early scene , Luca ( David Pasquesi ) and James ( Jeff Garlin ) are walking down a city street when they encounter two men. Luca picks up a pistol and tells the men to drop it. While he's distracted, the other man lunges at Luca and shoots him in the side. This movie does have some good points. The story is interesting and not too dissimilar to that of "Pray for the Wicked" although it doesn't seem quite as grim. I would recommend this to fans of horror, thriller, or any genre you could think of.

"Pearl Harbor, buddy." This movie is brilliant! Sure it doesn't exactly flow like an multi-million dollar comedy does, but the jokes that are constantly thrown in are unbelievable. I'm one that goes for silliness, much like "Dumb and Dumber", "Airplane" and "Wet Hot American Summer" and I have to say this easily ranks up there. Movies just aren't written with this kind of sporadic comedy anymore. Too many jokes in this are such a surprise to the viewer that it's honestly amazing that more don't know about and praise this slapstick masterpiece!

Very touching film, a great surprise to come up from Brazil, a country that usually exports features about social themes, violence, sex... Magical realism is a very hard task, and I believe Jo√£o Falc√£o has made it wonderfully. It seems that he really didn't intend to make a realistic film, far from that. Although many people think the film was adapted from the play, he said in his interviews that he actually based the film on the book. Another mistake is to think that Falc√£o has been influenced by the series "Hoje √© Dia De Maria".

If you like who-dun-its, you will like this film, considered the best Italian detective story (giallo), Fulci has done.It's not Mickey Spillane for sure. There are scenes designed to disturb anyone.Many would be offended by a local beauty trying to seduce a 12-year-old boy. She was joking, but she was naked nonetheless, and he would have jumped at the chance to jump her bones. She also tries to tempt the local priest.Young boys are turning up missing, and there are several interesting suspects. You have to watch carefully to discover the killer. Can you?

"Head" is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968. The movie is a complete contradiction of the Monkees image. It presents the Monkees in a way their fans never perceived them; men with real thoughts. Totally controlled by their producers, the Monkees were given the opportunity to tell their side of the story. The film pokes fun at their image, the entertainment industry, and corporate America. The soundtrack contains some of their best music. It's a movie well worth seeing over and over again.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly ( 1936-1959 ) is a tour de force for the first time that I have ever seen in my life. "Holly's" career can be characterized by three distinct phases: 1. A very brief period in which he was quite popular and successful, 2. The so-called "Bad Years" from about 1957-1960, 3. The "Lively Years" between 1960-1967. During this time Buddy managed to make only a couple of decent albums but never managed to attain the fame and fortune he might have received had his music been marketed more effectively.

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

the first time I saw this movie , I just thought `` what the hell ? '' a 10-year-old kid could have made this film. This movie is awful! The whole movie has no plot. We get to see one or two of the people involved in a horrible accident. There is not even a clue about who the main character is. Why? Who knows. It would be fun to watch a movie like this, but the only reason it was created is because people were bored with the last "Tales From the Darkside" movie.It starts out with a man and woman playing poker.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu , being Greek I adore my country and the landscape there, it was truly breathtaking . The only thing I didn't like so much was the acting , the actors all did their best but there were many moments where they showed a lack of focus , which I found very annoying.I recommend watching this movie if you know nothing about Greece or are not fond of melodrama . You will be able to see the beautiful country at its finest . The movie begins with a description of the island of Corfu.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan , with Robert De Niro as Jimmy Dolan and Diane Lane as Sally. This movie is so bad I'm embarrassed to admit I've seen it once or twice. The plot involves two men who live in different cities, but the only contact each other has is through e-mails. It's almost laughable. You get the sense that these two characters can't stand each other, and their relationship is based entirely on mutual contempt.There's no suspense, no drama, and absolutely no humor.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II picked up and became a quite enjoyable watch for a couple of hours, from primarily two points of view. The love triangle is an interesting one and strikes me as believable, because I know it happened in various places under occupation. Penelope Cruz played Pelagia, a young Greek girl engaged to be married to Mandras (Christian Bale). I had questions about the depth of their love from the start, but their future was torn apart when Italy invaded Greece, and Mandras went off to fight.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert . A brutal but beautiful film. It's a tribute to those who have lost too soon and to those with no life anymore. I love this film. I really do. Its an extremely sad movie but it is very true. The main characters are very much like me (I'm 24 y/o straight male and i have never been as close to a complete outcast). As a child, I was absolutely terrified of anyone other than my parents.

A well written screenplay. A moving story showing the middle class English at it's best. Some great acting by Tom Wilkinson and Emily Watson. Tom Wilkinson is one of Britain's best actors. He knows how to be subtle and honest. Emily Watson is an actress I was not familiar with, but to her credit she does a great job of playing the ****** wife. The director, Julian Fellowes did not succumb to the typical Hollywood gimmicks to give the film some meaty storyline. It has not over dramatized it's portrayal of the English middle class.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews, and I had low expectations for this movie. I was pleasantly surprised. While the plot is a little off-beat, everybody in the making of this movie pulled off a pleasant flick good for many a laugh. The writing and jokes are far more literate than I have come to expect. Better yet, they are delivered with aplomb by unknown actors doing a good job, all of them.The main reasons I wanted to see this movie were Justin Long and Lewis Black. Long is from "Ed" and the new Apple computer ads.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but manages not to let the film turn into schmalz.This is a fantastic film, its funny with sad bits and it makes you look at things differently. Tell everyone you know to go see it now- FANTASTIC!The acting is excellent, and Dublin plays a starring role. This film will change the way you view people with disabilities and also give you a very entertaining night out in the cinema. I can't wait til it comes out on DVD.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house . The whole thing is just a big boring joke, but it's not as bad as it looks. There are a couple of good gags along the way. The writing is pretty bad, which isn't surprising considering this movie was produced by Disney. This is a film that would be very hard to find under the radar. If you're a horror fan, or have seen some of the horror flicks of the last 20 years, then you'll probably like this film.

where do we go from here? that is the overriding question of this film. And make no mistake, 'mainly ETC. ', the 2003 effort from director john jansen, asks far more questions than it answers, but none so poignantly or so powerfully as this one.much of the the film plays like a running conversation between you and your college drinking buddies, and I'm sure many of the questions raised by the main characters you'll recognize from your own evenings of drunken debauchery. however, one of the many beauties of this film is that we are rarely given an answer.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

`` A Slight Case of Murder '' is an excellent TV movie , which is defiantly worth the price of admission alone . It isn't really a movie at all and I don't see why anyone who has seen it would even bother with any of the following:
It took me years to come around to this film but once I did, I was completely blown away. If you love movies that aren't just about cars, trucks, bikes, planes, etc, you will probably be entertained by this one.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film, like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles, as just another patchwork of mindless violence. And while there is a fair amount of mayhem, DEATH WISH 3 is not that awful of an effort, particularly for fans of the series and its star.This time out, aging Charlie's Paul Kersey is let loose by a police chief desperate to clean up a rough part of New York City. The trigger-happy vigilante moves into the heart of gang territory, where he once again becomes a one-man army in an urban war of good versus evil.

William H. Macy always gives a good performance. He never looks lazy and never seems like he'd rather be somewhere else. In short, he's what more actors should be like. "A Slight Case of Murder" is directed by Steven Schachter, who went on to do two more great films with Macy (Door to Door, The Wool Cap).Television movies have long been a dump of overdone acting, poor cinematography, and sub-par scripting. That's why it's so refreshing to see a TV movie that does exactly what it's sort of film was created for.

I was 19 or 20 , years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City , Utah and I happened to catch a bit of this show while on a trip. It caught my attention very early on. I thought it was one of the funniest things I've ever seen. When I got home, I started watching all the episodes again and it still holds up. It's not just good comedy, it's pretty darn funny even when it doesn't make any sense. There are times when it makes total sense and some other times it doesn't...at least they try.

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

Being a middle aged mom myself, I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in the many issues that effect us. Diane Lane beautifully portrays Adrienne and the sacrifice and conflict that a mother goes through, wanting to do what is right for her children, but still have a happy life herself. I am not a big Richard Gere fan, but he always does a good job with the guy who is sort of jerk, but learns something about himself.Criticism of their romance as unrealistic is hardly justified when compared to most other romantic movies.

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts . But it will put any doubters to shame - if they don't give up in the middle. I think it was written by one of those people who really have no sense of humour. The film opens with an almost comical accident at the hands of two police detectives. One falls down a flight of stairs (I'm sure you've already seen that one). When they search his jacket, they find a piece of paper that reads 'Wanted' and a picture of a naked woman.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie . I caught it last night on TMC . What a waste of time . The story is laughable . This is an unfortunate film. I know that it's being touted as a "biopic", but it's not even remotely like a biopic. Instead it's a melodrama about a group of African-Americans in Chicago in the 1920s. It tries to pass itself off as an exploration of race relations; it certainly isn't. The plot focuses on one man's rise through the social, political and economic ladder.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time. Excellent original music, clever, heady...it's hard to be articulate about something this good. There isn't one character that you don't instantly love to watch- Myronex "Putney, there's trouble in the black room!" "My name is Rufus." The lines, thrown away left and right, are classics themselves, recalling Slapshot, Caddyshack, Anchorman, Repoman, Dolemite, any comedy whose dialog is not of the formulaic set-up punchline variety. "Putney, Myronex called you tasteless!"

What a surprise this film was. I've seen a good few of Fulci's horror and zombie flicks and was amazed that this was by the same director. He also wrote the screen play which shows that the chap was quite capable of crafting a detailed, complex story line. The dubbing on this is not good, but far from the appalling slop that only further hinders later howlers like 'Manhattan Baby'.The photography in this film is fantastic. A strange, almost futuristic highway appears throughout the film which focuses on a small town where young boys are being murdered.

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

What a shame this movie was never released. (It is now playing on cable.) I tuned in based on my high regard for the stars and was rewarded by seeing a movie far better than the ones I've been paying to see in theatres recently. I like to be surprised. So often movies are marketed as "offbeat," but are in fact more of the same old recycled drivel. This movie is genuinely different, with the bonus of a heartwarming message. Jonathan Pryce sings like an angel.

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously . I thought it to be a very intriguing movie with lots of action, suspense, and some decent acting. But sadly, this movie has no redeeming value whatsoever. I've already mentioned that I didn't understand what the characters were trying to accomplish. The story was dull and predictable. The acting was amateur at best. There weren't enough twists and turns to keep viewers engaged. A lot of actors could have done a better job since they were not given enough time to develop themselves as characters.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's had a lot of interesting plot twists and turns... This movie is totally insane. It starts off so slow that I couldnt even find my way home. After about 2 1/2 hours, there are no more action scenes left. All the characters are dead except for the cop. I felt like I'm watching a rerun of a terrible television show. The violence is almost laughable in comparison to the great movies on cable channels.

When his elderly mother Emily ( Jeanne Bates ) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier ( Brion James ) at home, young Jean Valjean's (Gael Garcia Bernal ) life takes a dramatic turn. As he fights his way to freedom and away from the sinister Duvalier, he comes into contact with an array of people who will be key players in his eventual redemption. Jean Valjean is one of the more entertaining actors I've seen in a year or so. His performance is not perfect, but that's part of the charm. It isn't always pretty, but it isn't usually awful.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an abusive couple, in a film that was basically a sequel to "Vacation" -- is never really explained. I am not saying that the movie wasn't well acted...it sure was. But what could have been done to make this movie better? As a huge fan of Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz, I saw this as an easy target. After reading all the reviews I decided to give it a shot. Well, at first it seemed like a great movie.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo' (hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door'), and was very impressed by both it's dreamy & occasionally surreal tale of a family that immigrates from Sicially to the U.S. in the early days of the 20th century. It also worked as a (proverbial)middle finger jammed into the eyeball of Homeland Security (preferably all the way up to the 3rd knuckle),in it's depiction of the ill treatment of foreigners who just want a better life than they were getting from their original mother land.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an `` against the system '' type of movie and not really for those who are anti-government, I thought it did a good job of highlighting the lack of governmental accountability. If you were looking for an entertainment film that was light on plot but heavy on characters and suspense - look elsewhere. It's not a very exciting movie. But if you're looking for great acting, stunning special effects, and some truly tense scenes...then this is for you.The story is basic and predictable.

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times. I taped it in about 1987 when it was shown on Channel Four but my tape is severely worn now and I would love a new copy of it.I have e-mailed Film Four to ask them to show it again as it has never been available on video and as far as I know hasn't been repeated since the 80's. I have had no reply and it still hasn't been repeated. The performances are superb. The film has everything. Its funny,sad,disturbing,exciting and totally takes you back to school days.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave. I'm happy with that, as a big fan of horror, and I liked most of those new horror films. BOC is a one big pack of horror. Colorful, fast paced and original. I see this movie more like the opening of a new trilogy (much like Episode 1 and Aliens: Resurrection) since it comes up with a new twist. Instead of focusing on the little boy-killer doll relationship we have here a twisted movie about couples. We have the sweet young lovers in contrast with the killer crazy doll-sized lovers.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history, someone had to be the first. One could make a case that in Shoulder Arms, Charlie Chaplin invented the genre.Hard to believe that back then this was a daring move. When you consider that some of the best films involving such people as Bob Hope, Abbott&Costello, Laurel&Hardy involved military service and made during war time, it's just something you accept and laugh at.In the First World War Chaplin along with fellow stars Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford went out on bond tours.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! In 1933 Mae Questel caricatured Pitt's voice for the character Olive Oyl for the Fleischer Studios animated cartoon version of the comic strip Popeye. Zasu (pronounced Zay-Sue) does her best "Olive Oyl" impersonation walking around whining and ringing her hands or attaching herself to the policeman's laynard. I kept waiting for her to say "ohhh myyyy", but instead it's "something always happens to somebody." The first time I saw this film I loved Zasu and found her character really funny.

I absolutely love this film and have seen it many times . I taped it in about 1987 when it first came out , I was very disappointed with it , I think they made the most of a poor script and did what they could to sell it . If you are a fan of horror films this one is worth checking out , if not get some popcorn and maybe an old copy of "Scream" or "House of Wax". I am a lover of scary movies. I can remember watching Carrie (Carrie) and reading all the gore/scary/mystery novels I could get my hands on.

This movie is great I really enjoyed it.This movie is about a cat mom named Dutchess and her 3 kittens.T Dutchess and the kittens love music.They have to practice the piano everyday.But the butler named Edgar tries to kidnap Dutchess and her kittens he tries to make them sleep. But he fails. Them Dutchess meets a cat named Thomas O Maily. Thomas falls in love with Dutchess. The cats break into song. With the song everybody wants to be a cat. Thomas gets to love music like the other cats. Thomas and Dutchess really like each other.I loved this movie and i like the cats to!

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written and directed by David O'Connor (who also wrote the movie's score), who has some nice moments. But there is a fundamental problem, which can only be explained by looking at the novel in light of its sequels. I thought this was kind of funny but I have to say that this film is absolutely terrible!!! The characters are so stupid and you can't figure out anything that is going on. There is no humor in the film at all.

This is possibly one of my favorite films . It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda ( Chelsea Field ) who grows up to be a very beautiful woman. One day, while visiting her Aunt Elsa ( Margarete Heu) she meets Hans Gruber ( Jorgen Odenholtz ) , an evil man with a dark past. They become fast friends but soon they fall in love. At the end of the film, when the bad guy has finally been killed, it looks as if everything is over for the good guys. Not so!

"I am ... proud of 'Head'," Mike Nesmith has said. He should be, because this film, which either has been derided by many of us or studied and scrutinized by film professors, works on many levels.Yes, it's unconventional. To many, frustrating. It's almost as if the producers hand you the film and tempt: "You figure it out. "You probably already know that The Monkees TV show was a runaway marketing success that depended upon business acumen and no small serving of public deception. TV shows are about selling soap and toothpaste first, than to entertain.

This is my favourite Columbo . Martin Landau ( excellent ! ) plays twins , one of whom may have the power to make people disappear. I don't understand how this show has lasted for 22 years. If you watch it with a kid under 12 or your wife, you are more likely to go crazy. The story lines are completely absurd and all the actors act like kids. It seems like it was made in the '50s or earlier. I can't figure out what the purpose of this show is. There's no plot, no mystery, just bad acting, poor direction and dumb jokes.

Warning -- this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story was based on wrote a very bad book called "Punk" that I bought at the local Blockbuster back in 1993. I didn't enjoy it, and so I turned it into a comic instead. So far, I like the comic more than the book. If you love books, then this probably isn't the book for you. There's nothing wrong with this movie. You don't need to watch it if you're not interested in seeing people getting killed.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live . I know personally most of the people who work on this film company and am very familiar with how they work , so I could not possibly have seen it as anything other than an insult to all that are still living in the real world.I'm not trying to judge this film too harshly because it is a documentary , but I can't help but call it out for being full of lies and misinformation. All of the people quoted in the movie are dead and there is absolutely nothing written about their lives at all .

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the murder and robbery of an innocent woman in their neighborhood. What they don't realize, however, is that she isn't who she seems to be; she's part of an underground religion that worships a female devil. (This movie, unlike many others in this category, is not very good)
I really didn't know what to expect from this flick. I love the horror genre and usually enjoy movies with strange plots and interesting characters. This one was different though.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining. It provides updates of tech news, video games pretty much everything geek. They are also the official broadcasters of E3 and Comiccon. If you are a geek, gamers or anything really, you will enjoy this show. They have definitely upped their game since the guy below me's review (2006). It's the only place that I get my tech info. Kevin Pereira and Olivia Munn work beautifully with each other and the show always has segments referring to things in the game, movie, comic... Universe.

SHOWTIME is a mess , but it 's an entertaining mess . The plot is forgettable , the satire is so obvious , that it has gone over people's heads (they are not even trying here). But the whole show is so dull, I found myself bored almost immediately after getting through only a few seconds of it. There are so many scenes and sub plots going on that it's impossible to keep tabs on all of them, and no one ever does anything except sit around and stare at the ground as they talk.

These days , you rarely come by a kid 's show that does not involve 1 ) a preteen/teen pop star's attempt to find fame and fortune in the form of being cast in a TV sitcom and 2) The use of children who are either naive, gullible or both. However, "Pee-wee's Playhouse" is different from many of its forebears in this respect. This comedy about a middle-age man who can't find love or fulfillment in any meaningful way makes me cringe so much I sometimes have trouble breathing.

The Child's Play series isn't a favourite of mine, but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay movie. This time we have two dolls Chucky and his former girlfriend (when he was human) Tiffany. Together they go on a journey to find an object. There are a few interesting scenes through the movie like the guy getting hit by the truck and literally exploding, the sex scene between Chucky and Tiffany and the ending which allows for another sequel to take place. Wasn't really a straight forward horror, it mixed a lot of comedy and was a sort of spoof of the horror genre.

'Captain Corelli 's Mandolin ' is a fantastic film in itself . It is nothing like the book , which is not surprising to me. I think it just didn't fit with the movie, that's about it. My favorite parts are the first 5 mins of the movie when everything goes right, and the scenes in the hotel/lodging. The acting is great, though. I would have loved to have heard from Mr. Egan or his son if there was going to be a sequel. What an utter waste of time and money.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up , many people began to get excited about seeing it ... really excited. The film had the potential to be quite great if done well - and boy did it not deliver. I've seen a lot of awful films in my day, but this one tops the list. The acting is so bad it's almost funny. Most of the leading men look more like they were ripped from a magazine than they do actors. Every scene seems to play out with one actor talking while another character looks on, looking uncomfortable.

Considering it's basically low-budget cast, this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock pioneer Buddy Holly. Gary Busey stars as Holly, who was one of the first to use an electric guitar for pretty much all his music. Backed up by his Crickets, Holly had a string of hits and became a bona fide star before his death in a plane crash along with Richie Valens and The Big Bopper. The film follows his rise to stardom, marriage to his sweetheart and eventual death. I like this film and believe that you will too.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time, when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series again and again in re-runs and complete on DVD. I find the New Outer Limits WELL MORE than just a remake of old retread episodes, as some of the more adolescent commentators have suggested.With seven (7) years of programs versus just the two (2) years of the original series, the producers and writers have certainly added considerable new original stories and philosophical lines to a much longer running and very well produced (cable) TV series.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage's better films. He turns a fine performance as the title character. This is a romance set against the backdrop of a worn torn island. John Hurt's character gives his daughter, played beautifully by Penelope Cruz, some honest advice about love. This movie doesn't have the fault of being completely predictable. This movie also allows Cruz to turn in a performance as a strong woman who knows her own mind and heart. Once the film warms up beyond the opening sequence this film keep you focused on it.

The best thing from the American Pie "bakery." I found the humor and the plot to be far more engaging audience than any of the American Pie movies to date. .Also concerning the appropriateness of the content I found this to be acceptable to a much larger audience than any of the previous American Pie movies. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie experience. When the movie first came out I read a number of negative reviews and ended up not going to see it while it was still in the theater...I now regret that decision.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol' says it all. I used to watch this movie all the time as a kid; and even then I sensed the silliness of it all. The low budget, horrible acting and lame script was ever apparent back then. I watched it again yesterday and just couldn't stop laughing. It's so bad it's actually good lol. Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

Do you liked "Dead Man don't wear Plaid"? What about "Top Secret" and "A Chorus Line"? Well M√ºllers B√ºro is a fantastic Melange of all three of them, as unlikely it may seem. Very Funny "tongue in Cheek" Movie Noir hommage with stunning Songs and great Dancing. You have to have a little odd humor for this movie, but it is very well worth seeing it. I've voted it a nine, If the end would be a bit more logic it would have gotten a ten. Thats how Good that Movie is.

I do n't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor . You need to be very open minded if you want a good laugh.. it takes a LOT of imagination. The reason why we laugh in movies is because there is a good story behind it . This movie did NOT deserve a 10! Why would anyone bother wasting an entire afternoon on this trash? It starts out really bad, but I could care less about the plot (which was pretty terrible in the first place).

Even after nearly 20 years apart, the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing. In this concert, they perform their best songs from their heyday (1970-1978), including "N.I.B. ", "War Pigs", and "Paranoid".Also included is priceless backstage footage with interviews and retrospectives into their days as the top hard rock band on the planet. The comments of Ozzy, Tony Iommi, Geezer Butler, and Bill Ward are just as interesting and intriguing to watch as the fabulous onstage performances.A must-see for all Sabbath and Ozzy fans.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love, passion, and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in his latest film BLINDSPOT.BLINDSPOT'S diegetic world is exploding with suspense and takes the audience on a twisting ¬†journey to the core of the human soul. As a director, he manages to draw the human spirit from the performances of his actors. With superb editing, especially in the flashback scenes and beautiful cinematography, BLINDSPOT is a thought provoking suspense from beginning to end. A thriller which leaves much to the minds' eye.What an ¬†astounding accomplishment for Stephan Woloszczuk. Cheers Stephan!

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could ever want. It's a crime that such a brilliant film has to be so badly managed in order for the director to pay his bills. The actors are very talented and can really deliver their roles well. I guess some might complain that they couldn't afford an Oscar-winning cinematographer like James Wong Howe but he certainly did a superb job here. So, we need to watch this movie now? No way! What if you have just had a heart attack?

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie ! A must have in any '80s ' movie collection ! Guns, girls, sex and violence ! What more can you ask for? When I see this movie, I just think that they could have made it a little better! It starts off great...but then it's over too quickly and the movie loses steam. There are so many plot holes that don't get mentioned until the very end and no one bothers explaining them.I don't care what anyone says, this movie shouldn't be in the top 50 of all time list.

This is one of the best of the early "Star Trek" episodes, with Kirk and his crew venturing into the unknown to do battle with an enemy known only by name. Imagine their surprise when they find out that the dreaded Romulans are racial offshoots of the Vulcans! Young Mr. Stiles, well-played by Paul Comi, is one of the few truly unlikable characters in the "Star Trek" universe. His barely disguised hatred of Mr. Spock is eerily similar to the post-9/11 hatred and suspicion many Americans have of people of Arab or Middle Eastern origin.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song, and now the terrific Justin Lee Collins wanted to reunite the cast members and maybe some crew of one of his favourite TV shows as a kid, The A-Team. The only member he wouldn't be able to get was the late great George Peppard who played main character Col. John "Hannibal" Smith, but he did get some kind of psychic to try and help. He did manage to reunite all members including Dirk Benedict (Lt. Templeton "Faceman" Peck #2) who went to Celebrity Big Brother in 2007, Dwight Schultz (Capt.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

I went to the pre-screening of "Rory O'Shea Was Here." I like this movie better than I expected, because the excellent casts and the powerful performance. It's a film about the friendship of two handicapped young man. Rory is free spirit young man who wants to be independent regardless his Duchenne muscular dystrophy. He can only move his two fingers but he can talk eloquently and help his new pal, Michael, who has cerebral palsy and is significantly speech impaired. I guess that's enough to start with a weeping drama. Well, it is.

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade. She smokes and drinks. She doesn't have a lot of friends and she has a nagging mother(Beverly D'Angelo). Jade finds herself growing closer to her mom's boyfriend Billy(Rob Estes), maybe she is attracted to him. Of course, I don't need to tell you what happens after that. This is probably my favorite TV movie. This movie shows that sometimes everyone is to blame. This movie also has the best acting that I have seen in TV movies.

The movie is excellent. Acting, cinematography, direction and music are spellbinding. It seems to me that the reason so many give the movie a low score is because of the devotion they have to the original, 1937 version starring Ronald Coleman. That movie - for good reason! - engendered an unbelievable level of commitment. From talking with people who saw the original when it first came out, I believe the impact was something akin to the first "Starwars" movie in modern times. I have seen it. It was and is wonderful.

I'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it's absolutely everything you could ever want in a horror film. This is the definition of being a horror film. I consider myself to be a big horror fan and I must say that this house delivers the goods. House of wax Is the story of a group of college kids on their way to a football game whom decide to camp out for the night and have a run in with a local weirdo. Upon waking the next morning they make a gruesome discovery and decide to go into town for a broken car part.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD ( I 'm expecting to see the My Mother and Me set on that one at my local Wal-Mart ), there is a lot of potential for great movies to make themselves available in this format. I just had to write a review of this horrible movie. I can not begin to imagine how anyone could watch this film and enjoy it. It starts off OK, with good acting and plot lines. But once the script becomes more and more nonsensical, the story completely falls apart. There is no point to the movie.

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days . It was not a pleasant ride to what is now a TV classic. When I saw it on the cable channels, I knew it was time to get it off the shelves. But then I saw it on DVD and was shocked at the awful quality. There are only five scenes of the whole show left in the DVD and one of them doesn't make sense to me.I think that's enough from me. The show is just so bad that there is no point in telling you why.

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who seems as if he is trying to get away from his past by going into showbiz is at best annoying and at worst annoying in the most painful way. He is a complete waste of money, but that doesn't save him from showing up in scenes that make you wonder if he is still around. Well, I don't want to be rude, but "Madame'' is just plain terrible. It took about 5 minutes of viewing to realize what kind of movie this really is.

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a wheelchair? As it turns out, no one, not even the actors. I bought this movie just because I like to see how bad actors are compared to their real life counterparts on IMDb. To my surprise, the only way they can compare themselves with their real life counterparts is that they take horrible acting lessons. What's more, the script was awful. The characters were extremely shallow and didn't have depth. There was very little dialogue and most of it was completely useless.

Always enjoyed "DOA",1950,which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film. Dennis Quaid,(Dexter Cornell), was a professor who loved his wife and finally found out she was having an affair with one of his students. Dexter gets involved with Meg Ryan(Sydney Fuller), who was a student in his college class and at the same time had a big crush on him and wound up having a one night stand and in some ways loved him deeply. Dexter learns that he received a drink which had bad contents and would cause him a great deal of health problems!

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies. Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 reminds me of "West Side Story" with a new twist. Not even the recent flick "Gangs of New York" can measure up with one New York neighborhood in Death Wish 3 which is plagued not by two rival gangs---but one big gang. A gang that is willing to do things like cutting a person to death with an ax if he trespasses on its set.Deborah Raffin, who plays a public defender, plays gently in this action-packed movie that is filled with a lot of shoot-em-up violence.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

Really , This movie should be released to DVD . I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was the original "Sharktopus" that I rented from VHS at a garage sale, and I just can't bring myself to watch this. It is just so much better than the actual film, it almost gives me the shakes. The special effects are laughable, the storyline is lame, etc. There is one scene where there are sharks swimming past in a boat, and they swim right next to the kids, who are riding on the back deck of the boat.

Another enjoyable Warner flick. I really liked John Garfield in this, though I'm wondering why Cagney wasn't in the role. Perhaps it was too similar to ANGELS WITH DIRTY FACES? I mean, it's another Dead End Kids story of sorts too, but I really appreciated them here and this film had a lot of nice comical touches along with some good serious drama. The boys work great with Garfield. A nice sequence was the whole "swimming" scene which starts out with no cares but winds up coming too close to disaster.One negative comment: Claude Rains was grossly miscast.

A very weird, psychedelic, esoteric, (and did I say weird? :) experience.But on at least on one level - it did exactly what it was supposed to do. It bridged the gap between the silly, manufactured, Hollywood look at teen pop idols that was the Monkees TV program and the adult, musically growing and evolving, and yet still a little silly Monkees of the '70s and beyond.The most important line in the film is Mike Nesmith's, "If they think we are plastic now, wait till they see how we do it."

One of the most magnificent movies ever made . The acting of Charles Buchinski ( later known as Bronson ) was so good that he is still remembered today. I can't help but feel like I'm sitting at home in my living room watching this film on repeat. It may not have been quite the masterpieces of the French New Wave, but for a 90 minute movie, it sure has a lot more than one. The plot is fairly simple: a woman leaves her wealthy husband and heads to Los Angeles. Her son finds her and decides to take her under his wings.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (as the cast of MASH might have been in the latter) and then you won't mind too much if your expectations are knocked down slightly. I will start by stating that this is the worst movie I have ever had the displeasure of seeing. The premise itself is a great idea. There is a mysterious desert island, where the only people left on earth are some scientists from the past. And one of those scientists goes back to live among the natives for reasons which are not made clear.

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to it, I was not a big fan of it so I won't comment. I watched this film based purely on the premise (in my humble opinion) that "if there's anything more depressing than being a middle-aged guy who can't seem to find anyone to hang out with at night, let me know and I'll come over and make you some tea." But what could possibly be more depressing than watching people you don't even really know trying to kill each other for no apparent purpose?

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman's, and with a lot more character development. (But still without any actual magic!) I really liked this film but I must say that it isn't perfect. First of all there was absolutely nothing magical in this story. It could be described as a "happy ending." The movie seems to be trying to make up for its lack by adding in a lot of extra stuff. One of these extras would be the relationship between the two lovers.

`` Back in the Day '' is an interesting , but flawed effort . Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper , a young gangster who gets into more trouble than he bargained for when he kidnaps two teenage girls and takes one of them to Las Vegas. The film is riddled with all types of clich√©s involving drug dealing, guns, prostitution and gambling. I thought this film would have been a better movie if they hadn't tried to pass it off as a comedy. What a waste of a talented cast and crew.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar! The film took a while to pick up from the start, at least for me seeing as I expected this was a run-along America Pie flick. But it was slightly different-- a fun-loving slacker who finishes high school and makes his OWN college, running it accordingly. As you can expect, there's a lot of parties and hot girls in bikinis but this film tried harder than your average teen flick. Bartleby Gaines (Justin Long) encourages his students / peers to learn through freedom of expression and ultimately 'shove it to the system.'

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

Well, what's wrong with the title "Separate Lies" (accused elsewhere of not being "exciting"). It's cunning, subtle and a bit poetic. (Of course there's a Phil Collins song and a James Belushi film called "Separate Lives", which are alluded to here.) But the real point is the ethical dilemmas of telling lies at different levels that the film probes. OK, it's not an "in-your-face" hilarious title, but then it's not an in-your-face hilarious film. Please give British films like this a chance.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing ? Never heard of them ! ! But this is one of my favorites ! I can only imagine what a pain it must have been for her to sit through all of these boring scenes. If she didn't have a really strong stomach, she couldn't have sat through this movie. I mean, come on, when you watch it again and again, you will find nothing new.The dialogue is so predictable; it's as if the director/writer didn't even read the script before shooting. The performances are average at best and not memorable either.

I first saw `` Signs of Life '' on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation . It 's a wonderfully written drama about a terminally ill young man, who finds comfort and hope in a religious sect. This film has a lot going for it, however, I think that part of the reason for its success lies in the fact that it portrays a very believable world. The story was interesting, though I felt that there needed to be more backstory. There were some moments that I thought were rather forced, which didn't really enhance the film's effect.

This is sweet. The actress who played the nurse with the gonzongas is the same actress who plays Elvira mistress of the dark. Another little tidbit is the actress who played the nurse who would give her wedding ring was the landlord lady of Roy Munsin in King Pin. This is most glorious story ever to be told.
