It should sell more copies than the bible. My parents played a part in suggesting the release of this movie to a local movie theater. The movie ran for a week and we were one of 4 families to see it.

Charles Chaplin's 'Shoulder Arms' of 1918 was his longest film to date, though, at just over 45 minutes in length, it was not quite a feature film. With World War One just drawing to a close, many popular entertainers of the time were doing their part to inspire their native troops, and Chaplin was no exception. And so the lovable Tramp went to war! The film begins with the Tramp in training, and the character is hilariously inept at even the simplest military drills, including marching and gun-slinging, much to the disgust of his drill sergeant.

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . It's amazing how much time, energy and money the filmmakers put into making that film. There are literally hundreds of tiny little plot holes, poor performances, awful effects, cliches and bad writing. Don't think for one second that it's any more fun than the movies from the 70's or 80's - just because it looks better. There are so many bad movies made today. This one falls in my top 5.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan , where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion . It's a good movie, but the director obviously made a big mess of it -- and not just on the set.For one thing, his script was bad. I thought that he had done a very good job of building the story from the inside out. But as it turns out, all of the character development takes place by the end of Act II. A few years ago, I was introduced to The Black Dahlia.

This is what movies should aspire to. Funny without being totally stupid, a little sexy without having every female in the cast show her boobs, biting without resorting to 'f-bombs' every line. I've been seeing Justin Long pop up in a lot of films over the past few years, I figured with the right role he could break out. (Mac commercials not withstanding.) This film just might put him on a fast track to the A list. The rest of the cast also did their jobs perfectly, this is an excellent little film with a nice message.

This is one of my favorite films , ever . The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so rich and likable . I will watch this film again and again because of all it has to offer . I can't make a decent joke about this movie's plot. What the hell is going on? There are only two possible explanations. One is that the people involved in making this made it up, then realized that it was an absolute piece of crap after it came out. The other explanation is that the entire production team was simply high or drunk when they were working on it.

Years ago I read the book ' A M√°quina ' ( The machine ) . As I re-read this little book I realized that it was a very clever and well written book.The only problem is that there seems to be no connection at all with this movie. This film may have been made for $40m, but one thing is for sure - it was poorly made.I'm an avid horror fan and have watched quite a lot of movies since I was a kid. I've had great enjoyment out of just about anything that comes across my screen.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings, who love film, have good attention to detail and enjoy indie movies with funny, smartly written dialogue then this is a film for you.For those with a poor attention span, high expectations and no brains.. well.. um.. you may get bored and find things dragging at times.This is a charming, modest and well paced movie with the actors bestowing a real sense of depth and warmth to their roles. I chuckled to myself pretty much the whole way through..This film is a little gem.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time . Quickly the movie grabbed my attention and I just had to see if the rest of the cast were good or not. I was happy to say that the rest of the cast were quite good but the acting was very bad. The story line did not do the movie any favours . It could have been set in a much better place to be taken seriously although it may have been too easy for them to get away with it ! You're looking for a classic? There's something for you!

*Could contain spoilers, read only after seeing last episode season 2* Think about it. The guys on the north pole? Center of the earth? Looking for abnormal magnetic behavior? They also said something about: "did we miss it again?" So there was another abnormality? Of course that was when the plain crashed! I think this whole Island is a setup. Set up by her daddy. She found out about it and is looking for her Desmond. How else can she know what to look for.So basically it's an Island in a magnetic shield.

Lucio Fulci , later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie , was years earlier a prolific painter. In fact, I am sure that this man had more paintings than any of us will have in our lifetimes, so I would like you to watch them. The most disgusting thing I've seen in a long time. I'm sorry but people like this make me sick. The acting was not very good. Maybe it was due to the actors' accents or maybe they just couldn't do anything other than sit there and stare.

Dr. Paul Flanner ( Richard Gere ) , a successful surgeon , has his wife leave him , his son is molested by a neighbor and in the process of going through puberty , he begins wearing women's clothes, thinking it is "the man thing" to do. The plot was not original. It had the same basic idea that so many movies use: people go to a country where there are lots of wild animals and have an adventure with them. However this time it wasn't all fun and games either.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job . He apparently doesn't quite understand the basic principle that it's better to leave people guessing than to tell them directly . I didn't buy this movie at first, but after watching it for 2-3 hours I realized it is not what I expected. The characters are very shallow and without any depth, there is no plot, no development whatsoever. I feel sorry for the people who put their money towards this film. Maybe they will have a great time if they do a DVD release....

The film is n't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch . The story line has some nice moments that make it all worthwhile. It's amazing to see how bad a scriptwriter could turn out a movie. You would think that if they were trying to be as accurate as possible, the script would at least be good. But after watching this stupid flick I can't help but feel sorry for the actors. They all seem to want to be the hero in every scene they're in.I thought I was watching a real war movie when I first started this movie.

Barbora Bobulova's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time. It has been a long time since I have seen so much hidden passion and mystique presented by any actor simply by utilizing her facial features and the use of her eyes and mouth the way Barbora does with this character. She was entirely believable as Valeria and I was swept away with her characterisation of this role. All at once the film was real life and fantasy, the clever use of what was limited dialogue left me spellbound.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20 movie for me now. Great acting, great story and great editing.I can see that it has received more attention from film critics than most of their films but i am sure many other people would agree. There seems to be no good reason not to give this film a 10 because there are only 4 negative comments on IMDb. Some say it looks like it was filmed in Italy. Others say the acting is stiff.

This is a good film , no doubt , but with some odd aspects . Without spoiling anything it takes place on a desert island , and there are several things about it you should know. 1- The film opens with a scene depicting a man walking along the beach. He's talking to a woman, and he walks past her. She turns round to look at him and she says 'Why don't you ask her yourself?' (I think this was used as a reference to how women act around me when I talk to them in real life).

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television (RTL7, around 1800hrs) and I still watch it! I don't like the A-Team... I absolutely adore them!! It is just great to see Justin chasing the former members of A-Team. Brings back memories from the old days, when I was young an sweet. I would have given you a 10 for excellent, but Justin looks like he is chasing the former A-Team members all by himself. Of course, that is the only bad thing on this documentary.

No, I have not seen the original series and I won't compare the two if I had. This series is filmed in Canada in Vancouver and Victoria, British Columbia. The series is well-written in a different story each week. Some are little out there but most of the time it is the quality of the story telling. I loved the Afterlife episode with Clancy Brown and Barbara Gerrick and the Deprogrammers episode with the irresistible Brent Spiner as a Deprogrammer in a world where humans have become slaves to a lizard reptilian species.

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens √∂ really do not do it justice . I read the original book by R.L. Stine at age 7 and fell in love with it from that moment until now. I would say this is a better sequel than the original one. So much so that I even bought the movie for my brother, who didn't like the novel. He told me that he wanted to see how the story ends. When I first saw this film, I thought its premise was genius but then I realized that they were just throwing ideas around.

Well , I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning . So far, my opinion is that the only good thing about it so far has been the excellent soundtrack. The acting was terrible, the directing was horrible, the editing was awful. I cannot recommend this movie. I would like to tell you how the actors are "bad" because I know some of them were on TV and I just can't stand that. The acting was bad enough that I never watched it.

SPOILERSI love the Simpsons, and I have seen every single episode that had ever come out. I must admit, season one is by far the most underrated season, and this is the most underrated episode in season one.The episode begins with the family playing a game of Scrabble to get Bart ready for an intelligence test he needs to take at school. He says the game is stupid and he doesn't want to play it, but he needs to. He spells out a word that angers Homer and he chases Bart around the house.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce shows that are entertaining and informative but not necessarily worth watching (especially if you don't live in the target audience). The series, however, does have a good plot, some pretty good acting, and plenty of great music. However, one thing I really did not like about this show was the use of very short flashbacks. It would take too long to explain something that happened in the past or what has just happened with no real explanation.

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally, at the end of the 1960's decade. It was immensely entertaining, and provided a contemporary view of the many changes which had occurred during that period - and were still ongoing - in terms of the Black Power movement, Vietnam, and the volatile movement which followed the quieter, preceding postwar 1950's.All of this and one of the funniest films, then or now.Viewing it for the second time recently, I was surprised to find it as engrossing as when seen originally.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously , its primarily directed at teenage boys, who are looking to relive the glory of their high school years, a period of great social and cultural upheaval. First of all, let me say that I think this film is an abysmal piece of nonsense. I was expecting something more like "High School High" but this is pretty much the opposite. What it does have is a group of mostly male teens who don't know how to act around girls, they only do stupid things and then blame it on someone else.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White, Cinderella, or Bambi, but it IS a very sweet, enjoyable, romantic, well-done Disney animated feature.There are, of course, lessons included herein for the kiddies, and some very appropriate kiddie-cheek, but there is plenty herein for the adults, as well.While this is somewhat of a regurgitation of the Classic Disney RomCom Adventure, it still holds some elements, which solely belong to the AristoCats. O'Malley is the "tramp" and Dutchess is the "lady," but Dutchess has several kittens and they are all trying to get home.Phil Harris is our tomcat O'Malley.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. (SPOILERS)Now not one doll, but two, meaning double the impact, Jennifer Tilly played the part really well and definitely pulled off the best kill of the movie.If you have seen the Child's Play movies this would be a worthy film on your Chucky collection, but if you've never seen the Child's play movies before, this'll will be a new start.

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery's best performances in a movie, and I have seen most of her movies.I saw this for the first time on television when I was around fourteen, and I was so scared.I watch this movie every now and then, and I still enjoy it very much.I know that these days that this movie would probably not scare people too much.That just goes to show that the public movie and television audience has seen too much graphic violence in the last thirty years or so.I love movies that do not show the graphic details, you let your imagination do the work for you.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol. It has singing, the British Guy, A guy who's sometimes nice, and a super-nice woman.Of course it is different because there is a sing-off, and there's dancing and some acting (we just don't see some of the acting). I gave this show a 7 because there are a couple tweaks that I know a lot of people (including me)would make if they were working for the show. The first thing that really needs to be changed is the judges deciding who goes home.

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling actors. I was really surprised to find that i was totally wrong. The movie centres around Bartely or B who has been rejected from all of his colleges- the actor who play B is very natural and makes his character seem real- and decides to create a pretend school so his parents stop harassing him. However loads of people see his fake website and join. Feeling their sorrows B can't turn them away much to the chagrin of his best mate.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful place on the IMDb all-time cult-film list, alongside John Waters. He has also made such horror classics as "Blood Alley" and "Vampire Lestat". The only redeeming aspect to this piece of crummy garbage was the fact that it could have been done by a better filmmaker. When you look at the set design (which I can't recall seeing before), there was nothing in it to suggest anything other than the film being a parody of Italian horror cinema.

Between sweeping , extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded to the ground by the fact that all this is being made by a man who has never set foot on any Indian soil.I'm sorry but I found myself wondering "What do they get up to down here? They've left their own country behind?!" If I had not seen the film before, I might have assumed this was the work of one of the 'Big Four' in Hindi cinema. After seeing the first five minutes, I should have expected nothing less.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II was going to be something different, but alas it was just plain predictable. For starters, the plot is simply that the Nazis have landed on the island and are trying to wipe out the Greeks so they can then conquer the entire Middle East (which isn't happening). They've got all sorts of crazy Nazi weapons which they decide to take with them for some reason.The main cast is very dull.

I can't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I've described that scene to folks not familiar with this film. I saw it the year it was released, I was 19. I don't think there were a dozen people in that East Village theater that night. For years I thought we were the only ones who saw it. Nice to see here that others found it as hysterical as I had, and see it's lasting value despite the time gone by. Rent it, buy it or steal it.... a must see.

I 'm not a massive Disney fan , but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so I was happy to give this a shot. He loved it, and when we watched it for the first time in about 8 months, I felt very guilty that he had to wait another month before watching it again because I forgot to record it while I was with him.The characters are well thought out and acted, though none of the actors seem to be able to really bring much to the role. The voice acting is terrible, and there's little variety from one character to the next.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. This is a haunting tale of loneliness & missed connection in which the longing for intimacy conflicts with our fear of revealing too much about ourselves to another. The three leads (Barbora Bobulova as Valeria, Brigitte Catillon as Flavia, Andrea Renzi as Massimo) are all excellent and the dynamic between them is very surprising. After all the movies which devalue older women, it's wonderful to see Flavia (who is a law professor at a university in Rome) presented as beautiful & sensual as well as seductive & powerful.

This film is an impressionistic, poetic take on the immigrant experience, a reflective look at the turmoil and fear which might be associated with emigrating. These are aspects not often considered in movies about emigration to America in particular and to to any country more generally and the film vividly and convincingly depicts the nervousness and enthusiasm, if ignorance, that poor, illiterate Sicilian immigrants have in anticipation of their emigration to the United States. They have some fantastic, unrealistic notions about the United States which are disseminated on the trip over.

Not a stunner , but a good movie to see once or twice . Bill Macy shows he can do serious acting without being cheesy . The plot is predictable , and the ending is anticlimactic . The premise of this movie is so stupid that I can't even think of it as something that could be remotely entertaining. Why would anyone have to pay someone to kidnap children? What kind of a person would want to kidnap an infant for ransom? And if kidnappers kidnapped babies for money, what kind of people are they? This was the absolute worst movie I have ever seen.

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary . I knew it was about a group of people who worked as a cult and that it wasn't for the squeamish . It turned out to have none of the charm or originality of some of the movies I have seen. The film is nothing more than a reenactment of a couple of years of the lives of those involved in the group. The acting is so bad that you begin to wonder if the actors even knew how to speak English.

Loved today's show!!! It was a variety and not solely cooking (which would have been great too). Very stimulating and captivating, always keeping the viewer peeking around the corner to see what was coming up next. She is as down to earth and as personable as you get, like one of us which made the show all the more enjoyable. Special guests, who are friends as well made for a nice surprise too. Loved the 'first' theme and that the audience was invited to play along too.

I first saw The Victim ( aka Out Of Contention ) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. I must have been 12 or 13. I think that at the time my father had a copy of this on video and we watched it together. It was a fairly average horror film. The acting was pretty good but nothing spectacular. I'm not even sure who played the lead, but he wasn't bad either. The story is quite simple - a family move into a modest suburban home. Things start going awry with strange sounds coming from the basement one night.

I don't usually like this sort of movie but was working at home and wanted something to halfway watch while I did. I got so engrossed I gave up working to just sit and finish watching the last half hour uninterrupted. And I sure don't usually shed tears over this sort of show, but I was crying at the end. A lot of emotional nuance. Great acting, and good southern feel. John Corbett is one of the most talented actors out there, and the guy who played Luke was really good too. Highly recommend.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre. Set in rural Italy, there is a serial killer of children at large. Add to the mix an array of characters familiar to fans of giallo cinema ¬ñ a madwoman, a newspaper reporter, ineffectual police, a sexy siren, a priest, a mute girl, a mentally-retarded loner etc. This is one of the best Italian thrillers of the early 70's.Unusually for a giallo, the victims in this case are young boys, which makes a change from the more typical women in peril angle.

As a film buff , I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny , sarcastic comments about this movie online, so when I finally got a chance to see it, I couldn't help but be disappointed by what I saw . This is one of those films where if you don't watch it with your parents, you might find it mildly disturbing. The story is simple enough, there's an old house that has been abandoned since the early 20th century and its contents are kept in various drawers and boxes.

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce , Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman 's remote hometown of St. Cloud, Minnesota for a romantic getaway. I am so tired of people who think they know the movie industry when they have never been in it. The movie industry has come a long way but it isn't perfect. Let's start with how this one starts. A man calls his girlfriend and she says she'll see him soon. Then there is an old man who gives the man a ride.

This is one of Chaplin's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more mature United Artists features. More opulent than the Mutual films, it continues Chaplin's quest for perfecting his comic expression. Most people forget that the film is actually a dream that Charlie has while awaiting being sent off to the front.There is plenty of slapstick via the Limburger cheese being used to gas the enemy, and Chaplin's foray into enemy territory dressed as a tree.By this stage in this career, the great man had become so immersed in filmic expression that his films give the impression of making themselves.

Being American , I have not been exposed to this character before , which is good because some of you might like her. But she did not come across well in the book. The only thing that made me happy was that we were finally shown the side of her as a person.I felt sorry for her being so naive and innocent, but I don't want to spoil it for myself by saying more . I watched this movie with the expectation of watching someone else do an "American Made". However, I couldn't help feeling disappointed.

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

Oh my word ! ! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or sense of responsibility ! The characters were pathetic, the acting pitiful, and the story contrived. It was one of those movies that could have been much better if it had more time to grow on you. It starts out quite good, but soon the plot is dragged out way too much. I'm sure there are many other critics who disagree with me on this. Some people will like it, others may find it boring.

I don't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor. You need to get your head out of your up-tight ass if you don't find this movie hilarious! If this isn't your "cup of tea", so to speak, then look at it for what it truly is- a damn funny movie. Maybe they DID set out to make yet another drugs/T&A movie, but in this case, they've truly hit the spot. It's especially funny for the Ali G fans, because he delivers everything we've come to love and expect from him.

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form. I tracked it down on video a couple of years ago and viewed it again. The film although slow and slightly odd (the mountain men look very strange) the atmosphere was eerily effective. It's one of my favorite slasher films and I have no idea where an uncut version can be found. Currently deleted everywhere (except the USA where it was accidentally put on a horror compilation!). It's a shame you cannot get this movie as it was meant to be seen.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre . Set in 1950's Sicily during the Italian Civil War. The story starts off with a college student trying to figure out how to make some money, but finds that there are many ways to do that without using his brain. First, he has to have sex, which he does by shooting and killing someone. Next he decides to steal a motorbike, which involves finding a victim (who just happens to be a famous actor) and then kidnapping him and dragging him across town to kill him.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances: Sanders, Patrick, and Blackmer. The scenes between Sanders and Patrick are particularly outstanding. Demming, as the detective, is unfortunately not nearly as good. He lacks the intelligence, strength, and cynical world view of a Bogart. Had Humphrey played this part, we could have had a classic.Pace, location (a library), and atmosphere are all good. But there are a few plot holes. Sanders strongly fears Blackmer and the ruthless organization (Nazis) he represents. Yet after mistakenly killing Blackmer, Sanders seems to experience no anxiety or remorse.

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt, My parents loved it and now in syndication I feel what they feel. This show did what the original limits and twilight zone (new and old) couldn't do. This show used some old ideas and some truly original ideas.I still cannot believe Jonathan Glassner and brad wright did this. Those guys were producers on stargate sg-1. The show kept the audience entrenched in the story and set a truly scary atmosphere. This is what was not there in the new twilight zone.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in this country when slavery was being conducted. I would recommend this movie to anyone with a strong stomach. It's not just a movie but it's an eye opener. My wife and I wanted to take a break from watching too many bad movies on TV, and decided to rent this one.I really can't say what we thought about it. I thought it looked like a cheap knock off of The Shawshank Redemption (of course, I'm biased here).

Films belonging to the "film noir" genre usually contain similar elements: a "deus ex machina" plot twist that drives the main character headlong into bedlam, a pretty but psychotic girl, a handsome but psychotic thug, lots of money, lots of brutality, and usually a denouement in the desert. Think "High Sierra" or "White Heat. "There is plenty of hard-boiled bad film noir out there. But when film noir is good, you can't take your eyes off the train wreck of human lives.It is this latter tradition that "Blind Spot" belongs to.

This is a brilliant film . The story starts off in Romania , where Billy Crystal stars as an agent who goes after the mobster that's been responsible for the murder of several people. The problem, however, is that the movie never really finds its groove, and only gets more confusing with each viewing. I must say that I had very high hopes for "Kill the Irishman". It seems to have gotten a lot of hype by being made into a big budget Hollywood blockbusting movie (which I applaud), but I thought it could actually be a pretty good movie.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos since. It's no wonder, as in this role he takes on some of the most memorable characters from the "Boris Karloff vs. Dracula" film! A great idea that fell flat. The premise is brilliant, but there are too many unanswered questions and too many plot holes for one movie. This was my first horror movie and I was shocked at how much gore it contained (which was actually quite tame by the standards of today's movies).

Lucio Fulci, later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie, was years earlier a master of the Italian giallo (in the company of Argento and Bava) with films like A Lizard In A Woman's Skin and his masterpiece, Don't Torture A Duckling. This film has all the elements of the Italian mystery/thriller genre known as the giallo, but really pulls the viewers in by having each key character with a skeleton in his/her own closet. This keeps you doing as much detective work as the detectives in the film itself. Who is killing the young boys in town?

`` Blind Spot '' one of my festival favorites . I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers being locked in a motel, and how their situation could be resolved when they encounter each other. When I first saw the ad for this movie, I thought it sounded really fun. I'm glad I checked it out.I guess it's just too bad that I didn't get to see the rest of the cast before I made up my mind. This is possibly the worst horror film ever made. And I've seen some of them.

I've heard a lot of different opinions about this film and then to find out that Paris Hilton was in it as well didn't give Me the best impression of the film .... then to be dragged to the cinema by a group of my friends and sit there expecting a pile of pants i was shocked to find that i was scared stiff all the way through the film ... it was predictable yes but the build up of the deaths and the whole atmosphere of the film made it REALLY scary for me ... i was watching through my fingers the whole way through.

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see . The acting , writing and production values are all superb. This movie has a great ending (I can't believe I'm saying this). One reviewer said he saw the end in about 5 mins and it wasn't that close to it. It was interesting to watch this movie. The premise was somewhat interesting, but after watching it I am left with a question: Why didn't they tell the director that it would be so easy to get these kinds of scenes in a normal movie?

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house. It's a very positive and happy type of music. The movie has some sad parts but mostly the music is what makes me happy. Gary Busey did a great job as Buddy Holly. Buddy Holly kept on going even tho his pastor, his parents and the Nashville record producer told him no. Buddy Holly didn't give up on what he liked. I didn't know much about Buddy Holly until I watched this movie.

i did not read the book . nor do i care to . the movie was a beautiful romance , with no drama . I really don't know why I've always hated this film, it is so awful in every possible way. First, let's start with the casting. They have actors who are obviously over-aged and can act at only high school level. There is one girl in particular whose face has turned into a pile of freckles. This is especially apparent when she goes into a classroom full of pre-teen boys and yells, "STUPID LITTLE BOYS YOU WILL NEVER EVER UNDERSTAND MY SHEPHERD RIDE."

Ah the Outer Limits . I love that show . It was surpremely creepy , or down-right mysterious . I don't remember what happened when they left the room. But it definitely wasn't funny at all . This one seemed to have more substance . Well, this movie didn't really seem like it had any sort of purpose other than to see how many stars could make a movie for $10 and a few days of rehearsal. That is NOTHING compared to the actual film production company, which put out a truly terrible film in the first place. The writing was absolutely awful.

This version of "The Lost Horizon" is actually not a bad film at all. I think the problem is people like to pick on musicals, especially those made in the 70s. I saw the film upon its original release in 1973 (I was ten) and really enjoyed it, the music especially. (Burt Bacharach has always been a favorite.) The story is fun, the acting is good, and technically it's excellent. Sure, there are one or two rather silly dance numbers, but hey, you can't win 'em all.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

Indeed , Cynthia Watros is in this movie as Elizabeth talking to Desmond . Though I 'm just wondering how many times she can say "I love your wife" before it's replaced with, "Why are you married? You mustn't hate your wife." Also, I'm guessing that the other female roles were written by a woman. This movie made no sense to me! And I didn't even care if there were any vampires in it. I kept wanting to turn the TV off and go back to sleep.

OK , so this film may not have won any Oscars , but it is not a bad film . It starts out slow, and then ramps up to ridiculous levels . At first I found the acting good, but after about 2 hours I started to lose interest... This film has everything that is wrong in cinema. The characters are all over the place, the story is confusing, the soundtrack is either awful or completely irrelevant, the effects are very weak (I can't think of a single scene where someone looks like they've taken an electric saw to their body).

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt , My parents loved it and they would come over to watch. Now I see they don't really love it anymore. This show isn't funny, not in my opinion, it's just plain un-funny with an extremely generic storyline. The story is very simple. The main characters are trying to kill their nemesis but they can't as he has too many followers. They try all different ways to defeat him but by the end of the show one of the characters ends up dead.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film and I thought it was great to look back on a movie when I had just been through it. I think that this movie is not well suited for children. It is full of gross sex scenes, nudity, violence, sexual innuendoes, and crude humor. To top it off, the characters have absolutely nothing to do with anything in the movie. They never discuss anything except what they see or hear or smell. The only character who gets a plot development involves his girlfriend's sister.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen: much better and deeper than Luhrman's Romeo&Juliet or Spielberg's Titanic. Gerda's love impresses me every time, her search, her battle is exceptional. Gerda becomes a strong, loving woman throughout the movie. Kay is the poisoner of dark forces: the temptation. This story encourages me to fight like Gerda for the ONLY ONE, for the love of my life, for Mister Right. Patience is one of the keywords of this movie. I cry every time when I realize all the suffering of Gerda and Kay.

Spike Milligan's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years, and 2002's 'Puckoon' is sadly no exception. The novel, set in 1924, concerns the partitioning of Ireland, in particular its effects on a solitary community ( the 'Puckoon' of the title ). Due to a colossal blunder, half the village is now in Northern Ireland, the other half is in the Republic. Locals go to the toilets at the bottom of their gardens to find a barbed wire fence blocking their path. Drinkers crowd like sardines into a corner of the pub to enjoy a cheaper pint.

In the first transformation scene, what is the music? I've heard it was "The Greeks Don't Get No Freeks". Is that right? I really liked that sound. I also liked the "Hyde's Got Nothing to Hide" in the final scenes. Truly a doper movie, but with many laughs and puns, sight gags, and slapstick. Madam Woo-Woo's place was reminiscent of some places I have visited myself. Ivy Venus has appeared in some other stuff that is truly amazing. She looks much different in the movie we're talking about, but her maturity didn't hurt her a bit.

I thought this was movie was great , Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie . The only problem is the acting is a little stiff . I would not recommend watching this film because it takes itself so serious . Why do you spend $20 or more on this nonsense? It's nothing but a complete train wreck. Not only are there NO good scenes in here, but the plot is just plain silly as well. For instance, where does the money for the trip come from? What is going to happen to all the characters?

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development . Fulci was a master at creating horrific characters, as his films often do. I was particularly shocked by some of the child abuse scenes - I've never seen anything so sick in my life! There's also a lot of sex (though there is very little) and violence - which is quite gratuitous, considering how graphic the gore scenes are. I watched this on TV last night, because I can not stand horror movies anymore. They have all too often been replaced with slapstick comedies that are no longer scary even for kids.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie. She was only 19 years old and gorgeous. What a pleasure to watch her dance with George Murphy. The story line was typical for its day but the dancing was really special. I never tire of watching Fred and Ginger but Lana Turner in this movie was just as terrific. I always thought of Lana as a so-so actress who tended to over act. She should have done more dancing and less of the Maddam X and Peyton Place roles. I had a new appreciation for her after seeing this movie and her wonderful dancing.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert. A brutal but beautiful world that is explored through memories and edgy layers of sound and score. The landscape develops its own persona, paralleling the inner geography of all three characters as their stories unfold. The stark void of lost love, the fear of the unknown, and then transcendence of emptiness through the very openness of this desolation. Three misguided souls fighting to find something absolute and positive in all that negative space. The drama is compelling. James Franco and his co-stars deliver deft performances.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink in 1956 Lubbock, Texas. As the credits start, the camera moves down from the moon to the parking lot, into the roller rink, past the concessions and across the rink to a small bandstand where a small band is doing their sound check. It's a tracking shot Welles and Scorcese would both appreciate. It cuts to Buddy Holly's bespectacled face peering down in rapt concentration as he grips the headphones and talks to a man putting this band on the radio.

This movie gives us some WWII history along with some touching romance , a little fantasy and meaningful emotion - all done in a very pleasant and easy to understand style. Well I went into this film with high expectations. When I first saw the trailer for this flick I was pretty excited. I thought what could be better than the classic World War II epic 'Valkyrie'? After seeing the picture I thought it was gonna be one of those films where we see a guy on horseback ride into battle and save the day. Wrong. This movie was not that good.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog 's filmic work that is without equal in the realm of self-parody. After watching the first two episodes of this show, I have to say my expectations for it were a little too high. After watching the first episode, I found myself wondering why this show even existed. It's not just that the characters are poorly developed, they don't seem to be living out any life whatsoever. Every character has a single flaw that is immediately apparent and yet everyone keeps on going about their daily lives anyway.

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville's Century Theatre. A well crafted, solid drama with an ever developing plot and ongoing 'twists in the tale'...as the lies piled up! A masterclass of acting by a flawless cast, well marshaled by first time director Julian Fellowes. Outstanding performance, as usual, by Tom Wilkinson but good turns by all concerned including supporting actors Linda Bassett and John Neville. Our audience was engrossed by this film, which includes a couple of shock incidents which really make you 'jump'.

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian ex-pats. The film is amazingly beautiful and smooth flowing for a first film. The direction is self assured, especially with locals who were recruited on the fly for extras and bit parts. While the plot and story line is elementary to nonexistent, the pleasures of watching the performances and scenery offset the lack. The soundtrack to this film is a big attraction to world music lovers. If you want to see what can be done in 45 days, with a different location every day, check out Hari Om for inspiration.
